reviews.name: Terri D
reviews.title: Take your time, if you can
reviews.comment: Yes, this really is a fun drive. Hopefully no one will be pushing you...sometimes travelers to and from Snowbird are in a hurry. Take your time, pull off when you can. A wonderful place!

reviews.name: camaronz
reviews.title: Very easy drive from the valley, great for an afternoon drive
reviews.comment: This is a great drive if you wish to spend a couple of hours away from the city in the Fall. The colors are so nice and the road is easy, i guess it would be different once the snow comes but would still like to see it then too.

reviews.name: Michael B
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The fall colors are stellar. River is beautiful. Lots to do at Snowbird resort. If passing through Salt Lake take an hour and drive up canyon.You'll be glad you did.

reviews.name: Jeffrey O
reviews.title: So Beautiful and fun drive
reviews.comment:
Just out for a drive while here on business and traveled through Little Copper Canyon. Went all the way to Alta Ski Lodge, pulled over and walked around. Spoke to an officer for about 20 minutes and got the low down on happenings around the area.
The drive is so beautiful and worth going to see. I was told there are some easy hikes that you can do and really get a great view of the entire canyon. My picture was on my way back down the canyon, so beautiful!

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Another Amazing Drive
reviews.comment: Had a wonderful day driving up and down this canyon. Enjoyed the amazing drive and seeing the snow. People were still skiing in the middle of May! This is a beautiful drive any time of the year, so take time to enjoy it.

reviews.name: Chuck
reviews.title: beautiful
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful places I've ever been. Went to ski but would love to go back during the other seasons.

reviews.name: Shanna S
reviews.title: So Pretty
reviews.comment: The drive through the canyon is beautiful. Whether you ski or not, at least visit the area and see it. It is spectacular!

reviews.name: differentname
reviews.title: Summer and winter playground...
reviews.comment:
It is also a playground for all those days in between. Most people don't know that there is fabulous hiking easily accessible from almost any starting point, with all degrees of difficulty.
Have fun!

reviews.name: JennScents
reviews.title: Beautiful drive, incredible scenery with off-the-beaten path hiking trails
reviews.comment: We stumbled upon this beautiful drive, that led us to some incredible scenery and photo ops, with off-the-beaten path hiking trails. We stopped off on the side of the road at a little parking area. We could hear water flowing so we hiked the trail until we found a gorgeous creek with flowing water. We sat there taking in the fresh air, beautiful weather and enjoyed a snack. Traffic was a little congested heading to Alta, so we turned around and headed back. Still worth the trip.

reviews.name: dragonflytw65
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: We had spent quite a lot of time in Big Cottonwood Canyon and our drive to Snowbird was our first time in Little Cottonwood Canyon. It was very different and just as beautiful. The drive alone is a must do for nature lovers visiting Salt Lake City and even non skiers will appreciate the atmosphere, restaurants, shops and views from Snowbird in the winter.

reviews.name: ZekeMarsh
reviews.title: Lot of interesting hiking routes
reviews.comment: It's great. I had the chance to go to Lisa Falls and walking alongside the water, fantastic sights, fresh air. Honestly wish I had more time to spend here.

reviews.name: HoleySneakers
reviews.title: Gorgeous Scenic Drive Just Outside the City
reviews.comment: Little Cottonwood Canyon is one of the three main routes up to Salt Lake City's famous Ski areas. All three routes offer spectacular views. Little Cottonwood Canyon is an eight-mile drive that ends in the old mining town/now ski resort town of Alta. If the steep granite walls didn't clue you in, the heavily bunkered resort buildings and periodic gates and avalanche warning signs would tell you that this drive is not one to be taken lightly in the winter. But in the fall, the foliage is absolutely gorgeous, especially in contrast to the granite. If you want to get out and walk, there is Temple Quarry Trail at the mouth of the canyon. Just keep in mind that there are no dogs allowed anywhere in the canyon (to protect the watershed). Alta itself is a bit of a disappointment as a town, as there is really nothing there except the resort. But as a little getaway to nature that is just minutes away from Salt Lake City, it is definitely worth a visit.

reviews.name: pbnc63
reviews.title: Fall visit
reviews.comment: Worth the short drive from Salt Lake City. Beautiful views. Follow the road all the way up past Alta. Alpine flowers in bloom. Peaceful and quiet.

reviews.name: KB_222014
reviews.title: Beautiful drive. Very much worth your time if you love the outdoors.
reviews.comment:
On our last trip to Salt Lake, my wife and I had about an hour or so of free time, so we decided to take a drive up the canyon. The road ends at Alta ski resort, so you'll need to turn around and go back to where you came from. Other canyons we have seen actually connect to roads on the other side - such as the drive up to Park City, for example. However, this probably means there are fewer cars along your way.
The scenery is breathtakingly beautiful. I'm sure it would be pretty dangerous during the winter months with snow and ice everywhere, but if you are here during the summer months, you have plenty of wonderful scenery to enjoy. Along the way, there are several places to stop and take pictures or just enjoy the view.
The drive up to the top of the road does not take very long - it's only about 9 miles or so from the base of the canyon to Alta. But it also means you can see the entire canyon quickly.
If you love the outdoors, you would love to make this drive.

reviews.name: snorkelingfan46
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: Visiting family in Salt Lake City, our daughter took us up to Albion Basin in Little Cottonwood Canyon to see the wild flowers. Although mid-July may be a couple weeks before peak season, the hike up the path to the mountain lake was quite spectacular. It's the perfect place to escape the 90+ degree temps down in the City with a breezy mid-70's temperature to enjoy while climbing the trail. There is no shortage of wildflowers in all directions, as well as leftover snow pack in many places. The canyon in the winter is prime skiing area, so there are chairlift towers around, but not enough to diminish the enjoyment of the scenery. There are bathroom facilities by the main parking lot at the trail head. Parking can be a bit hard to find. The volunteers on the roadway will encourage you to park well below the trail and take a tram up to the final parking area, but we took the risk and were rewarded with a newly vacated spot. There are also a few turn-outs along the drive up that offer spaces for 3-5 cars, so it is possible to park short of the trail head and hike the road a ways. We noticed quite a number of couple with very young children in backpacks because the climb is only moderately demanding. Note, that the elevation in the canyon is over 9,000 above sea level, so if you are from a much lower altitude, you may possibly get a bit more winded than you might expect.

reviews.name: Mitch M
reviews.title: Beautiful drive!
reviews.comment: An amazing scenic drive right outside of SLC! Just as beautiful as Big Cottonwood Canyon, but less crowded. The road also ends at Alta and you must go back in the same direction you came, unlike BCC.

reviews.name: Heather R
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment:
I think this is what I miss most about living in Utah. I used to live in Sandy, which is in the valley below the drive up the canyon. It's very easy to get there and it's not as crowded as Park City and some of the other scenic drives in Utah.
It's definitely my favorite drive in the fall. When the leaves are changing, it's an amazing drive. It's also got some nice hiking trails for the summer months. It's a nice break in the summer from the heat in the valley. The trees always smell amazing and there's usually a nice breeze.
I love this canyon and wish I could go back more often.

reviews.name: Kurt H
reviews.title: A Top 5 Scenic Ride Next to Major City
reviews.comment: One of the top 5 scenic drives within 30min of a major airport in the US, maybe the best. Glaciated, U-shaped canyon. Mountains rise 7,000 ft over Salt Lake valley floor. Tram ride at Snowbird is amongst the most scenic trams/gondolas in US, and new restaurant at top is an outstanding place to have a bit to eat, soak up sun and chew on God's scenery. Caution that if snowy, won't see much and road requires chains and/or 4WD with significant fine if you get stuck b/c you drove up with bad equipment (rent the right car at airport if winter). NO dogs allowed including in car (another min. $125.00 fine). Numerous excellent hikes in the canyon, but none are truly easy. Pretty much all are at least intermediate if not hard. 2 ski resorts, Alta, Snowbird are world class skiing, although Alta isn't world class hotels/amenities (people ski here, so this isn't peopled by boards of monied folks.) Enjoy it!

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Wonderful Snowy Drive
reviews.comment: Drove up this canyon 3 days before Christmas and enjoyed seeing all the snow and beautiful scenery. Stopped at Alta Ski area just to enjoy the view. Enjoyed watching the people ski. You should take time to drive up this canyon. It is worth your time, it takes about 30 min. to reach the Alta area once in the canyon.

reviews.name: tibet71
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment:
Little Cottonwood Canyon is short drive and it dead end about 8 miles from starting to finish. It is a beautiful drive but if you want a good choice of hiking I think Big Cottonwood Canyon is better. Little Cottonwood Canyon is the way to Snowbird where you can take the tram.
Both Canyon is easy access and the drive is easy but be careful and slow down on your way down.

reviews.name: Ruchi2787
reviews.title: Mesmerizing Canyon, can never get enough of it!
reviews.comment: Drove this canyon with mu husband countless number of times and each time it's been a unique, out of the world experience! Ski resorts in winter and alpine lakes and hike in summer, what could get better than this! Especially when the drive to the canyon from downtown SLC is not more than 25-30 mins. Never lived in a city so beautiful and with so much charisma surrounded!

reviews.name: flymetoaustralia
reviews.title: sweet alpine hiking not far from your car
reviews.comment:
A steep canyon on the SE edge of the city, take the 215 beltline to the 6200. Becomes wasatch avenue. pass entrance to big cottonwood canyon, head up canyon towards alta. A couple nice campgrounds up there- and a huge ski resort complex. In Alta, free info is handed out for area hikes.
We drove past the resorts, up the steep road, past where the road becomes gravel. The hike we chose took us to an alpine lake 1 mile away, then we struggled up further to the top of a mountain peak. Saw 4 moose, marmots, great views...totally peaceful and cool.

reviews.name: TheSuze12
reviews.title: Beautiful Views
reviews.comment: We had toured Big Cottonwood and decided to drive up Little Cottonwood. The views are beautiful and it was a treat to see the ski resorts and homes and the top of the mountain. If you only have time for one I recommend Big Cottonwood. Both are just glorious in June.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Wonderful canyon to drive
reviews.comment: This is a wonderful drive any time but this past May there were lots of waterfalls because of snow melt. Enjoyed sitting in our car at the end watching some people sled and some marmots running on the snow. Alta ski resort was closed, but the views are still wonderful.

reviews.name: jdms33
reviews.title: Wonderful ride and scenery.
reviews.comment: We drove through both Big Cottonwood and Little Cottonwood Canyon today. Little Cottonwood Canyon is a beautiful ride and the geology is so much different that Big Cottonwood. Not as many trail heads but equally as beautiful. When we drove back down the canyon road the few through the opening of the canyon was breathtaking.

reviews.name: GeorgiaGirl59
reviews.title: Breathtaking Canyon
reviews.comment: Little Cottonwood Canyon is the home to ski resorts Alta and Snowbird. The views are fabulous and this is a wonderful place for extreme out-doorish people. Many people hike up to the top of the peaks and ski/board down outside of the resorts. Hiking is another activity that is widely done in the canyon also. There are several condo's and house for rent and the Alta shuttle makes it easy to get to the slopes and back home with little trouble. We stayed at HellsGate Condo unit "J" and the views were fabulous. The condo was nice and well equipped. I would highly recommend Little Cottonwood Canyon to experience Alta/Snowbird and the views!

reviews.name: Carol A
reviews.title: We are spoiled to have this beautiful canyon so close by!
reviews.comment: This canyon is only minutes away from the south end of the Salt Lake valley. There are many hiking trails of varying difficulties, 2 ski resorts ( Snowbird & Alta), camping and picnic areas, a creek and the town of Alta at the top of the canyon. If you have a 4 x4, you can keep going at the top and take the dirt road over Guardsman Pass and end up in the Heber Valley. We love to cross country ski along the Quarry trail during the winter. A beautiful glacier-made canyon!

reviews.name: JMHUT
reviews.title: Incredible resource
reviews.comment: A short drive from most homes in Salt Lake City, Little Cottonwood is a year-round outdoor playground. World class skiing is a given. However, when the snow melts those same slopes and peaks offer top notch mountain biking, hiking, backpacking, etc. It's also at least ten degrees cooler than the valley in the summertime and offers clean air during the conversion months that make the valley so uncomfortable to be outdoors in. In late May the meadows explode in wild flowers. It is really a site to see and does the soul good after a long week in the concrete and asphalt of the city. Not only free to the public but accessible via public transportation. Food and lodging available at Snowbird, which stays open year round, as does its tram.

reviews.name: KenJean2014
reviews.title: Best wildflowers ever
reviews.comment: If you are ever in this canyon in August you can find the best wildflowers if you hike through Albion Basin up to Cecret Lake. Easy hike and great news.

reviews.name: jdcoach
reviews.title: take the mirror lake hike
reviews.comment: Two world class ski resorts, half dozen decent restaurants, million dollar view. The Mirror lake hike is short and sweet, you can take your young children for a half day hike, enjoying the outdoors with your family

reviews.name: Sheekar
reviews.title: nature art its best
reviews.comment: beautiful sight, a wonderful place for hiking, biking, and picnics with family. Take in the fresh air and gorgeous views, brings you a whole lot closer to nature and excellent for meditation. Utah has some of the most scenic canyons just 15 minutes from the city that cater to a variety of sport enthusiasts. my favorite is walking/hiking on the many wonderful paths and collecting wild flower seeds. Make sure to bring water and maybe a picnic baskets and plan a romantic day in the canyon.

reviews.name: JohnD70
reviews.title: Premier wildflowers above Alta Lodge, late July
reviews.comment: The parking is very limited and the road is not paved but the wildflowers are spectacular.The area is called Albion Basin and it is the starting point for wonderful high altitude hikes and alpine scenery. Come prepared to deal with high altitude, above 9000 feet, and tough terrain. The basin wildflowers are worth the trip by themselves. Bring a good camera and spend some time.

reviews.name: MeliChr
reviews.title: Great canyon for hiking, snow sports, and views
reviews.comment: The views from this canyon are beautiful. There are multiple hiking spots with varying levels of difficulty, some great easy hikes for kids. A fun place to climb on a road bike or catch trails with a mountain bike.

reviews.name: MaitreyeeMayhem
reviews.title: Near my house, great for a quick get away.
reviews.comment: I live in Sandy so it's always been a great way to get out of the city for a bit for me. I can literally drive 20 min and be out in the middle of no where. There are a lot of hiking tails and off roading places you can go too. The view is just gorgeous, you will not want to go anywhere else. There are plenty of camping spots that are actual camp grounds or just random spots you can go to camp.

reviews.name: RooneAlredge
reviews.title: Great drive and beautiful vistas!
reviews.comment: Just spectacular! Make sure that you drive safely and do not speed up or down the winding canyon road. One, you'll miss the beautiful scenery, animals and the like, and two, it is dangerous. Safe if you obey traffic laws! You need to go all the way to the end past the Snowbird and Alta Resorts (not just for winter skiing). Many nice hikes and trails. Spring time has the flowers blooming. Must see anytime of the year. Very high recommendation!

reviews.name: scribblin
reviews.title: Best Views Around
reviews.comment: After living here for about six months and motorcycle riding various canyons, I have to say that Little Cottonwood is my favorite. Without taking anything away from Big Cottonwood, Emigration, and other local canyons, the views in Little Cottonwood are the best, in my opinion. Even if you don't ski, grab lunch at Alta Lodge -- lunch prices are comparable to an Applebee's or Chili's -- and just enjoy the scenery. In warm weather, drive past the gate at Alta and up the dirt road for even more spectacular views (and great hiking). Follow the road to the parking lot for the camping area, and hike up to the lake. Beautiful scenery and a pretty terrific motorcycle road make Little Cottonwood my top pick for local canyons!

reviews.name: OSF35
reviews.title: Amazingly Beautiful
reviews.comment: We headed up the canyon to do a bit of hiking and were happy to find out that the wildflowers were in bloom. There's a meadow wildflower hiking trail to follow--and it was great. It's moderately difficult--we're not claiming to be in great shape, but the elevation and a few of the steep inclines, made us stop to catch our breath (but there were elderly folks and young kids stomping up and down this hike--so you know, i guess we are out of shape). The views are great, the wildflowers were gorgeous. We got to catch a deer grazing and of course all kinds of little critters and birds. Great views down the valley. Our time was short, so we didn't get a chance to spend more time here, they were running lifts up to one of the peaks and there are some restaurants open--but we needed to spend only about an hour of our time. It was totally worth it, though and highly recommended.

reviews.name: 5barbs19
reviews.title: Wonderful hikes
reviews.comment: I love cottonwood canyon ! Beautiful day hikes , saw lots of wild life even moose. Go during the week if you can very quite and serene. If you go in the summer go early, the weather is about 10 degrees cooler than the valley

reviews.name: Susan A
reviews.title: Nature at its finest
reviews.comment:
People define beauty differently, but it's difficult to beat the beauty of Little Cottonwood Canyon. From the city limits of Sandy to the end of the trail above the ski resorts, the winding road takes you from pines and aspens, through fir and spruce, and up above the tree line. If you're there for the bloom of the spring wildflowers, the views are truly breathtaking.
The fauna can be spectacular as well. The canyon is home to many species of birds and fish as well as squirrels, pine martin, deer, and other Rocky Mountain creatures. This is also the one place where I can almost always spot a moose.
Take a day or just a two-hour drive. Take a picnic or just a bottle of water. Take your family or just a friend, but definitely take advantage of this spectacular natural wonder.

reviews.name: Tawny H
reviews.title: wonderful!
reviews.comment: Little Cottonwood Canyon is great! Its a wonderful place to get away from it all and its so close by! If you get the chance, definitely check out albion basin in the spring time!

reviews.name: sdoise1
reviews.title: Great ride
reviews.comment: Terrific motorcycle ride!! Wish it was longer. Drivers observed the speed limit, for the most part. More paved turnouts would be better for motorcycles.

reviews.name: EvaSkates
reviews.title: breathtaking views
reviews.comment:
A friend and I decided to go on a little hike towards Alta. We picked a perfect day. It was sunny, warm, however lots of snow was still on the ground (there was an unexpected snow storm two days before). The paths were freshly groomed by snow grooming machines. The hike was very pleasant, and easy. Most ski lifts were opened, few skiers, a couple of show-shoers.
After climbing to one of the lifts, we sat on rocks to eat snacks and enjoy breath taking views. One complain - as a first time visitor - no trail maps, the official trail site does not specify which trails are not accessible until summer. We wanted actually to go to Cecret Lake, but learned from a local person, that it is truly a summer hike. However we both had a good time on whatever trail that was

reviews.name: ruup4adventure2
reviews.title: Lovely drive in the autumn
reviews.comment: This canyon makes for a scenic drive year-round, but it's especially splendid in the fall when the leaves on the quaking aspen trees turn color. It's a steep canyon and smaller engine cars may struggle at times. Picnic areas are unfortunately extremely limited, but hiking trails are plentiful.

reviews.name: Mike F
reviews.title: Skiing is superb
reviews.comment: I always love to ski at Snowbird and Alta. They are, hands down the best resorts of all others around here. They have the best snow and best challenge of all of them, and are not as expensive as the Park City resorts.

reviews.name: Hannahbears_mom
reviews.title: Absolutely breathtaking!
reviews.comment: I'm so glad we took this scenic drive! The views were breathtaking! We went during October, specifically to see fall foliage and we were NOT disappointed! I've never seen so many vibrant colors at one time (outside of a crayon box)! We went the entire length through, and spent a good hour stopping to take pictures of the views and family. I can see how it would get insane during the wintertime, but on a Thursday morning.....the drive was perfect!

reviews.name: Erensto D
reviews.title: Nice driving around
reviews.comment:
Beautiful sceneries which to be back during winter but something heavier than a short sleeve and shorts. Anyway, highly recommended for whatever mood you are!
You can go up with friends and enjoy or as I did by yourself.
Amazing

reviews.name: Benjamin R
reviews.title: A most beautiful glacial landscape
reviews.comment: This canyon, uniquely carved out of granite mountains by ancient glaciers, is one of the most beautiful places on earth. A drive up to the top reveals glorious alpine vistas. Climbing up side canyons introduces you to White Pine, or Red Pine Lakes, Cecret Lake, Albion Basin, and the world class ski resorts of Alta and Snowbird. The clean, simple beauty of this canyon is unique not only to the Wasatch Mountains, but is unusually scenic compared to any other place I have visited. A portion of my heart resides here.

reviews.name: vjgonzo3
reviews.title: Summer fun in the Wasatch at the "Little"!
reviews.comment:
My wife and I recently biked and hiked a couple of the many splendid trails among amazing views of the granite cliffs set against the Wasatch-Cache National Forest.
Located 15 miles south of Salt Lake City it is easily accessible via signs after taking the 6200 SOUTH exit of I 215.
The "Little" has so much to offer visitors in the summer including wildlife viewing, cruising the 2+ mile road along a roaring river and, camping at one of the two camp grounds - Tanner’s Flat & Albion Basin. Climbing is also popular.
Locals and visitors alike benefit from this beautiful canyon whether or not they leave their car as the sounds, smells, and sights will bring smiles to all.

reviews.name: Steven W
reviews.title: A nice drive during any time of the year
reviews.comment: This is a nice drive to take during any season. Plenty of outdoor activities along the way, or just enjoy the drive through a beautiful area. The mountains are spectacular here. Take time to explore some of the areas along the way.There are some great hikes and a few lakes to explore, as well.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Nice drive
reviews.comment: Drove up this canyon on a snowy day just to watch the skiers at Alta and to have a beautiful place to eat the chocolate tort from The New Yorker(downtown SLC). Enjoyed the afternoon.

reviews.name: SomePersonHere
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment: The mountains are beautiful. Amazing snow with the lightest powder ever. The views are amazing from the summit's and the bases. The sunsets are breathtaking, so be sure to stick around long enough to enjoy them.

reviews.name: TheGoatQueenstown
reviews.title: Ripping Fresh POW at Alta Snowbird
reviews.comment: An amazing week ski Utah's finest POW at both Alta and Snowbird, I can't imagine anywhere could be better!

reviews.name: shake801
reviews.title: Most spectacular and dramatic canyon in SLC proper
reviews.comment: Every visitor to Salt Lake should ride the Snowbird Tram. The experience and views are not to be missed. In the summer, amazing wildflowers color the fields of Albion Basin. Great hikes up White/Red Pine and also Albion Basin. Amazing waterfalls in spring and fields of gold aspen groves in fall. You may encounter moose, mountain goats, deer, coyote, and other wildlife if you look hard and hike a little. And of course, winter boasts the iconic Alta powder and Snowbird terrain that make this a destination for real deal skiers.

reviews.name: Pixtonian
reviews.title: Granite slabs, great hikes and great skiing
reviews.comment: Big and little cottonwood canyon are the greatest opportuinties to expirience anything you love to do in the outdoors minus the ocean. The climbs are tougher in this canyon becuase it is mainly granite but a ton of fun. This is where all the locals go skiing as well so stay out if your not from here. hahahahahaha.

reviews.name: Utahns_
reviews.title: GORGEOUS
reviews.comment: Love this canyon. Bike, hike, fish, camp - whatever. you can do it all. Except swim or let fido off leash. Love utah, take care of it. kiss it. love it.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Very nice drive
reviews.comment: Drove up the canyon twice while visiting family in SLC. Very beautiful drive. Went early evening & watched the snowcats grooming the ski runs. Lots of fun for a flat lander! Lots of wonderful views & picnic areas on this road.

reviews.name: saphfirebluez
reviews.title: Snowbird, Alta, Campground...all the best!
reviews.comment: This is my favorite canyon for summer camping, hiking, or concerts at the Bird... and winter skiing is the absolute best. I ski at Alta mostly as a local they have the best deal with the locals pass. But, Snowbird is my favorite. Love little cloud and the Tram run. Love having foot rests on my chairs, too.

reviews.name: R M
reviews.title: Bike ride up and down
reviews.comment:
Great canyon to ride a bike up. I’m a mamil and cycle regularly but there’s nothing close to this scale near me. About 1000m vertical ascent with a near constant uphill for over 20km or 13 miles. It’s a tough climb but I found plenty of places to stop and I did that quite a lot. My Garmin showed up to 13% gradient and on my not friendly hire bike gearing it was very tough. Good news there’s plenty places to stop, take a drink and take in the beautiful scenery.
You can get up over 8000 feet or 2500m and I was there in November. There was snow around and plenty on the high mountains and it’s cool towards the top of course, but I was warm enough for a short sleeve jersey. On the way down I put everything on! Keep the windchill out and make sure you have decent brakes!

reviews.name: MihirMeghani
reviews.title: Great scenery, drive & hikes
reviews.comment: My wife and I hiked for several hours a few days ago with snow falling & several inches of snow on the ground. We enjoyed our short hike. The winter scenery was amazing. Great to see fall colors, mountains, streams, rivers, & trees.

reviews.name: Sanj2561
reviews.title: Great fall drive!
reviews.comment: What a beautiful drive up the Wasatch mountains! The trees were a brilliant yellow and the other plant life were green and orange, making for a patchwork of color. We continued onto Park City, which was a scary ride in the early morning...very high elevation with lots of low hanging clouds made for a white knuckle trip down the mountains!

reviews.name: Chief
reviews.title: DO IT!
reviews.comment: This is what family hikes are about! Crystal lake... AWESOME Kid friendly outdoor fun.Fun to see so much happening in nature.

reviews.name: Ashar G
reviews.title: Wild and Beautiful
reviews.comment: Drove out here for a quick visit from SLC. Worth the drive and if you have time, great place for camping.

reviews.name: NCWFUcyclingVet
reviews.title: Beautiful area
reviews.comment: We drive along the scenic Highway and hiked to donut falls. The area is beautiful and lush. They are lots of trails in the area. The hike was great. Lots of people there. Busy trail

reviews.name: Krissy C
reviews.title: No having fun allowed
reviews.comment: We started to drive in. We wanted to pull over to have a meal and then continue driving through, but every single pull out required a fee, and the signage made a person believe they rather you just leave. No swimming, no dogs, picnic areas with $129 price tags. All we wanted to do was have lunch. Federal Govt park rules were a nuisance for our road trip. I bet it was beautiful.

reviews.name: MKTBE
reviews.title: Numerous Recreational Opportunities in Beautiful Setting!
reviews.comment: The beautiful Big Cottonwood Canyon affords children of all ages the opportunity for numerous recreational opportunities. The drive alone is a visual treat. A meandering creek accompanies the road, with many turnouts to view, and photograph, the natural beauty. For the adventurer hiking, rock climbing, camping, and skiing are all available. The drive leads to Silver Lake and Brighton Ski Resort. In summer and fall there are hikes that lead to picturesque Lake Mary, Lake Catherine, Clayton Peak, and many more. Big Cottonwood Canyon is absolutely stunning, and provides outdoor activities for all ages!

reviews.name: Hot-Tati
reviews.title: great road trio in a road trio
reviews.comment: we took our couples photos hear and enjoyed the drive finishing it off with a beautiful sunset as we exited the canyon

reviews.name: CloCro
reviews.title: Great drive
reviews.comment: Such an incredible drive- you will get lots of pictures just dricing through. We stopped at Donut Falls trailhead and walked for a bit just taking photos and watching little kids learning how to ski down the tiny hills. Good place to make snowmen too!

reviews.name: Ayisha T
reviews.title: Incredible!
reviews.comment: An incredible place to visit and hike. The drive and views are pretty. Worth visiting when you go to Salt Lake City!

reviews.name: Utah John
reviews.title: Fall foliage outstanding
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a great treat any time of the year and the fall foliage adds an extra plus. The canyon is great for hiking, biking and just sight seeing. An of course in winter there is the best skiing on earth!

reviews.name: ANDREW J
reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment:
Awesome. There is Mtn and Road Biking, hikes, including some with boardwalks, campsites, fishing, skiing and snowboarding and more. You can often see wildlife such as deer or moose, especially if you know the right trails and go early in the morning or in the evening.
As a local, I visit here every week. Just note that no dogs are allowed. (Even in the car) If you don't have a dog, or can leave yours at a hotel or house, you must visit! There is something for everyone -Thrill Seekers, Families, Large groups, Solo visitors, and more.
The views are incredible, and you will not recommend visiting, weather just on a drive or getting out and doing something.

reviews.name: Annabell O
reviews.title: Spruces Campground - Big Cottonwood
reviews.comment: The Spruces Campground in Big Cottonwood is stunning. Our site (#36) was on a small creek, and we loved the beauty and serenity of the setting. Bathrooms were very clean. We would have loved to stay longer and explore the area more, but we were on a long road trip. This stopover was a very pleasant surprise!

reviews.name: Robert N
reviews.title: Up Close & Personal
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of the world’s most beautiful drives. There are places you could roll your window down and almost touch the mountain cliffs. Unlimited hiking and camping are just a few of the activities you’ll find. Make sure to drive to the top and enjoy the vast Aspen groves. They will put on a spectacular color show later in September.

reviews.name: Cheryl H
reviews.title: Beautiful drive!
reviews.comment: We were here during off-season, so traffic was very light. The drive through the mountains is spectacular! We always pack a lunch for days like this in hopes of finding a quiet place to stop and enjoy a picnic. The road runs along the river, and we found the perfect spot to sit and watch the rapids. Highly recommend this scenic drive.

reviews.name: Brent H
reviews.title: Breath taking views - literally
reviews.comment: The hiking scene in Big Cottonwood is phenomenal. I have hiked many places in the east coast and none of it compares to the Wasatch peaks. The grandeur and majesty of these mountain are mind blowing. The hiking trails themselves are tough. There are few “easy” hikes and most have significant elevation gains. Makes sure to bring lots of water!

reviews.name: Ludo F
reviews.title: Best hikes in the Valley!
reviews.comment: I love big cottonwood canyon in the summer for its amazing hikes and in the winter because Brighton Resort is there! My favorite hike is Lake Blanche! I highly recommend it :)

reviews.name: Jacob B
reviews.title: Big Cottonwwod Canyon Review
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a beautiful place, and it is just a couple of minutes away from Salt Lake City. There are countless hikes, campgrounds, and places to explore in both this canyon and Little Cottonwood Canyon, which is nearby. Definitely a must-see.

reviews.name: vaishalibhagat
reviews.title: Perfect to kick off summer hikes with lakes, water streams, wild flowers, moose and deer!
reviews.comment: Any age group can find a hike in this area, starting from Silver lake board walk to a rigorous hike..

reviews.name: kellyricks
reviews.title: Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: The mountains around Salt Lake are really nice. Big Cottonwood Canyon has great scenery and super hiking trails. It would take a week to see it all (depending on snow fall.)

reviews.name: LoveTravel78385
reviews.title: Fall is the time visit!
reviews.comment: Unbelievable views and fall leaves. No better color and views of the canyon below. Make this a priority if you are in the area! I’m sure the views are stunning any time of year .

reviews.name: bookgirl211
reviews.title: Great Drive
reviews.comment: We were in Salt Lake in the spring. Unfortunately, our timing wasn't so great for hiking as there was still so.much.snow. But the roads were clear and it was an amazing drive to the top.

reviews.name: LeAnne
reviews.title: Wonderful!
reviews.comment: We thoroughly enjoyed Big Cottonwood canyon! We went in the early fall as we like to hike and we found so many wonderful trails to Hike. When you are there make sure to go to Guardsman Pass as this is beautiful. Also, eat a Silver Fork Restaurant! There is a wait but it is cozy after a long hike and good food!

reviews.name: TeePeeEnCee
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: While visiting our son, who works at Snowbird, he showed us the facility, and then drove us in a scenic route through the canyon and over the pass to Park City. Wonderful experience.

reviews.name: etbtravelphotography
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Lots of hikes to lakes in this canyon. Many are relatively short and easy too for the resort goers. More info on hikes on my SLC TA page. https://www.tripadvisor.com/Trips/92933170/Salt%20Lake%20City

reviews.name: Michael B
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The mountains, river, trails, ski resorts, lake. If you are passing through SLC take an hour and go up the canyon. It's like another country.

reviews.name: Diana w
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon with Ski Resorts and many hiking trails.
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon has two ski resorts, Brighton and Solitude. Brighton has great deals for family skiing. Solitude has some expert only ski runs. They both have long skiing seasons as well.
But during the summer it is a great place to escape the heat and get away from the city. There are many trails, some of them for overnight camping.
There are a number of locations for camping and improved sites, as well as the hike in camping.There are group campsites as well.
Children will love walking around the lake up at the Brighton ski resort during the summer. They should be able to see some fish in the shallow lake.
And it is especially beautiful in the fall, when the vibrant autumn leaves or contrast to the evergreen trees.
It is very convenient as the mouth of the canyon is no more than 20 minutes from the heart of Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: kmcelhaney2019
reviews.title: Scenic drive
reviews.comment: We drove the entire length of the highway. The foliage was at peak, very beautiful. There are many opportunities to pull off the road for photos. There are also many trails along the way, easy to navigate, well marked.

reviews.name: romanrod20
reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.comment:
First time visiting the Rocky Mountain area. It was cool to see the mountains from the plane and even better on the ground. There were 3 scenic roads you could take through these mountains, that I know of, and we did just that. Lots of beautiful views of canyons, rivers, mountain sides, and cities down below.
The roads are very narrow in some locations and lots of curves in the road. Some steep drop offs may make you nervous or excited. Plenty of road side parks and trail heads to get off on and explore. The leaves were starting to change for the fall and were beautiful.
Not sure I would take kids under 8 years of age there unless they listen well and don't wander off.
Definitely worth the trip.

reviews.name: beckymichibata
reviews.title: You can spend all day here
reviews.comment:
We visited for a few hours before our flight departure
We only managed to see water falls. There are lots of hiking trails you can explore. We walked for twenty minutes quite easy walk to waterfalls, but didn’t have a time to see Silver Lake and anything else. It’s a nice drive to go up to the mountain. Perfect for anybody who wants to spend a day in a nice, peaceful and refreshing environment. Recommend.

reviews.name: Sheila T
reviews.title: Beautiful outing
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a great place for a hike, nature walk, picnic, or drive. The scenery it gorgeous, it’s a short drive from SLC, and the temperatures are cooler than SLC.

reviews.name: lgthom
reviews.title: One of the Most Beautiful Drives Ever
reviews.comment: Beautiful scenery and outstanding panoramas abound in this unspoiled nature drive. The roadway is excellent throughout. There are beautiful aspen tree groves and amazing vistas. It’s worth a couple of hours on a clear day.

reviews.name: ceutce
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: The all is a great time to visit Big Cottonwood canyon. The fall colors are amazing. Take in a hike or a picnic at one of the various forest service picnic sites.

reviews.name: Jeffrey O
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: In Utah visiting for business and went for a drive. This area is so very beautiful, it’s hard to believe. I come for Virginia, live in the mountains and they can’t hold a candle to these. The canyon is just stunning! If you are in the Salt Lake region, take a drive up the canyon, you’ll be glad you did!,

reviews.name: Ricardo C
reviews.title: Most scenic route nearby Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon road is a short ride about 20 min. from Salt Lake City and easily accessible. Beautiful scenery along the way and if you like to hike there are a number of trails on the 16-mile route. Stop by the lodge for breakfast or coffee along the way (about 10 miles in) and keep going to Park City which is gorgeous (like Ashville NC). It’s a mid-day trip to Park City on a lazy Sunday. We ended our journey in the Visitors Center of the Great Salt Lake. Highly recommend that you start early in the morning.

reviews.name: jpuchar
reviews.title: spruces campground Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: loved the campground. we showed up early on labor day weekend on a saturday to get a walk up camp site. then we stayed till Monday. great facilities, fire pit, restrooms were cleaned daily, readily available water also. it was my kids first camping experience staying in a tent and they loved it-- so did the wife. We will be back. we had an a campground on the outside which we prefer, the inside ones usually back another site.

reviews.name: Riley Kate N
reviews.title: Lovely to view or to hike in!
reviews.comment: Beautiful place to hike with many different options. There are places to grab food and beverage as well to enjoy the scenery if hiking isn't your thing.

reviews.name: Siddhant
reviews.title: Beautiful Place.
reviews.comment: I like this place, good views beautiful garden, To escape the stifling city temperatures, we went to this canyon. It's in the Wasatch National Park and it was well worth our time.

reviews.name: Leigh Ann Corazzini
reviews.title: Retreat from the heat!
reviews.comment: After a day in SLC with 96 degree weather, it was a great escape to 60 degrees! Went near dusk to Silver Lake and did the hike up to Twin lakes. It was beautiful up there!

reviews.name: Carolyn G
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: A beautiful way to get to Park City from SLC. Likely slightly more difficult in the snow, it was idyllic in August. Stopped at Silver Fork Lodge for a great lunch!

reviews.name: Francophile84108
reviews.title: Beat the heat in Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: When the temp hits triple digits in the city, that's when I head for the canyons. I love Big Cottonwood. It's a great place to hike, has beautiful scenery and if you have little kids or elderly friends and family, there's a nice gentle walk at the top, by Brighton Ski resort, around Silver Lake. If you go at dusk, you're likely to see Moose as you stroll the boardwalk around the lake. There are interpretive signs along the way, restrooms and a small information center. If you're hungry, stop at Silver Fork Lodge for a bite to eat, just minutes from the lake as you descend the canyon.

reviews.name: Mary D
reviews.title: Escape the city heat
reviews.comment: To escape the stifling city temperatures, we went to this canyon. It's in the Wasatch National Park and it was well worth our time. It's only about a 30 minute drive from downtown SLC. We saw stunning rock formations and lush forests. It's about as scenic as it gets. While the road is curvy, it is paved and is an easy drive. There are lots of places to pull over and take photos from or to go on hikes. Unfortunately, you can't take your dogs on the trails because this is a water shed area that supplies the drinking water for Salt Lake City residents. It's a lovely place to visit even if you just drive through it.

reviews.name: Monica V
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment:
Went through on a Tuesday afternoon/evening so traffic and crowds were not an issue. Every view was nicer than the last. We had our big hikes in the morning so didn’t bring gear and water to hike here. Would have loved to though.
If not used to the elevation, this drive may bother you toward the top.

reviews.name: TINAGOOF
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: We drove Big Cottonwood Canyon on our way to Silver Lake. Beautiful views and scenery. We loved driving through and there were lots of little places to stop and snap pictures or hike.

reviews.name: Elishky
reviews.title: a must see!
reviews.comment: These are gorgeous stunning vistas if you just drive! But there are plenty of pull-offs with trails and waterfalls to visit. A truly must-see, even if you just drive through. A mere 30 minutes from downtown Salt Lake City. Pay attention to the no-parking signs. Police DO patrol the area. ;-)

reviews.name: ClaraPa
reviews.title: Crowded but pretty
reviews.comment: Not sure we'd return because the crowds were so frustrating. There is very little parking and the cars just fill the side of the road. You go up to the mountains for solitude and serenity but it was like everyone in the city decides to leave and go to the mountains. The CITY downtown seemed more quiet than the mountains! Yes it is pretty but the experience was just kinda ruined because of all the crowds and frustrations navigating steep and windy roads with cars on both sides and people fighting for their Instagram pic spots.

reviews.name: knight0200
reviews.title: a sunday drive
reviews.comment: we went up and down the mountain stopping at a couple places to view the area. fun drive but didn't see any animals

reviews.name: Rob S
reviews.title: Worth the drive, but pick the right route
reviews.comment: Just 30 minutes outside of Salt Lake City, it's worth a visit if you have the time. Be careful in picking your route. The "scenic" route is a long drive; take the shorter route.

reviews.name: Kathy
reviews.title: Great Trip
reviews.comment: Give yourself a day to explore the stops along the way. The area is scenic to say the least. Silver Lake is a nice spot to stop and enjoy the view and nature. Also stopped in Park City and enjoyed a snack. Silver Fork Resturant is a great place to have lunch.

reviews.name: Sherry W
reviews.title: Very high mountains
reviews.comment: The road is very steep and windy. The sides of the canyon are beautiful and very high. Many pine trees and quakes. The wildflowers are beautiful and plentiful. The granite is of a grey color. The air is crisp and clear. Chance of snow is expected tonight. The view to the valley is spectacular.

reviews.name: OldBroad73
reviews.title: Stunning and crowded
reviews.comment: The canyon has always been spectacular, but it has become quite crowded. The drive used to be part of the enjoyment, I was disappointed at the last visit by the number of cars on the road.

reviews.name: BJREisman
reviews.title: A rushed ride late in the day...but well worth it
reviews.comment:
I had done a hike on at the Stewart Falls trail (off the Alpine loop) and had driven up to the Guardsmans Pass lookout (that had opened the previous week for the first time in 8 months since it had started snowing).
It was getting dark, but I followed the road down from the mountains to SLC along road 190 also known as Big Cottonwood Canyon Road.
The powerful rocks on one side, the raging river of melting snow water on the other and the incredible views of snow covered peaks and wild forests all around make this a wonderful 30 minutes or so of driving. It is a shame that I was doing it late in the day and in a rushed fashion, but I had a plane to catch!
Next time I am in the area, I would definitely plan a day ride through this area….and take it slowly.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Canyon Never Fails for Beauty
reviews.comment: Drove up and down this canyon several times while visiting family in SLC. It was mid May and still snowing in the canyon! Also snow melt was happening on some of the days. The river was overflowing and sometimes the road has running water on it. Enjoyed each day in the canyon.

reviews.name: Passenger20525412193
reviews.title: See the fall colors
reviews.comment: Great sight seeing when the fall leaves are changing. Nice walk around Silver Lake. Great skiing in winter too. Lots of local wildlife visits the Nature area around Silver Lake. Cool off on a summer visit too.

reviews.name: Fhairr
reviews.title: Beautiful, Diverse Drive!
reviews.comment: If you have an extra hour or two in Salt Lake City, take this drive! You will see quite a bit of variety and when we went there was still plenty of snow when reaching the end of the road.

reviews.name: jmmendes
reviews.title: Pretty drive
reviews.comment: A very windy road up to the top of the mountain with beautiful views along the way. It's a nice drive if you have a little extra time to do it.

reviews.name: Roxy C
reviews.title: Mother Nature at Her Best!
reviews.comment: This canyon is stunning year round! Warning: Take spring run-off seriously as it is entirely dangerous. Boulders tumble down the canyon waterway like Legos! The crashing sounds are tremendous and exciting, yet don't get too close! Otherwise, enjoy the vistas and the walks/hikes in nature and all the flora and fauna there to observe. This is a beautiful drive with lots of places to stop, eat, picnic, and enjoy Moter Nature at her finest!

reviews.name: Bob S
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood, Silver Lake, Silver Fork Lodge
reviews.comment: When guests come to town, it's my "go to" to drive them up Big Cottonwood Canyon, walk around Silver Lake (look for moose) and eat at Silver Fork Lodge.

reviews.name: Jonathan B
reviews.title: great winter skiing, summer hiking
reviews.comment: There are Solitude and Brighton ski areas. Very good snow and high altitude. Good summer hiking and fall colors

reviews.name: E1963CUrobertp
reviews.title: Brunch at Silver Fork Lodge
reviews.comment:
This canyon is breathtakingly gorgeous. It is a must see if you are visiting SLC.
The food and staff at the lodge took great care of us as we enjoyed a delicious brunch.

reviews.name: Rebecca M
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: Stayed in downtown SLC and took the short drive out to Big Cottonwood Canyon. The colors are incredible - lots of green and silver with yellow and reds and of course, the blue mountains. The drive to the top was so worth it. Saw a waterfall and felt the rush of the cold mountain water.

reviews.name: siddhant
reviews.title: Good canyon drive.
reviews.comment: The canyon drive is very good, it worth a shot. Beautiful place good for a family visit.Road was very well maintained.

reviews.name: CorpSpy
reviews.title: A Refreshing Spring Hike
reviews.comment: The drive from Park City to Big Cottonwood Canyon was filled with beautiful scenery. The route was easy to navigate and the directions are clear. This is an outdoor recreation area with plenty of hiking opportunities. While we enjoyed our hike, it was cut short by the amount of snow we encountered - note: it was mid-May. If you are into hiking, Big Cottonwood is a must.

reviews.name: DailyHiker
reviews.title: Great Hiking
reviews.comment: Definitely worth the drive up the Canyon to hike. So many choices from easy to difficult. Beautiful landscape. Plenty of snow still on the trails. A fun challenge though. Silver Lake is an easy hike with or without snow.

reviews.name: Don H
reviews.title: Very scenic
reviews.comment: This canyon drive is very scenic and worth a visit. Road was very well maintained and don't worry about being in the "wilderness" as there were 19 cell towers along the winding road.

reviews.name: bettypP8797JU
reviews.title: Great Scenic Drive
reviews.comment: We spent the day driving through Big Cottonwood Canyon and enjoyed it tremendously. It’s a place to relax and enjoy God's creation.

reviews.name: Belen A
reviews.title: A place to come back
reviews.comment: Beautiful place, we even plenty snow with a warm weather the perfect combination. the ride to get there is absolute amazing, it might get a little hard for people with low curving tolerance, for the rest enjoy the adventure

reviews.name: Steven W
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: We had some extra time, so decided to explore. This is a beautiful drive. Several stops along the way for hiking. There were also lots of rock climbers along the way. Seems to be a popular climbing area. Drove to Brighton and back, enjoying the view in both directions. Worth a trip.

reviews.name: Linda A
reviews.title: Take the drive
reviews.comment: We drove up through Cottonwood Canyon and made quite a few stops for photos. Beautiful drive on a warm spring evening.

reviews.name: MarmaladesMom
reviews.title: Beautiful, But Bad For Motion Sickness
reviews.comment: This is a gorgeous canyon year round. Be aware that it is a narrower and steeper canyon than many others nearby, so the road is full of lots of switchbacks. If you are prone to motion sickness you will want to take precautions.

reviews.name: Barry M
reviews.title: Feels like being in a national park
reviews.comment:
A short drive from Salt Lake City, there's two ski resorts and a cross country ski venue. Anytime of the year taking a walk around Silver Lake is spectacular (and there's no elevation gain so it's perfect for visitors who aren't adjusted to the altitude just yet).
Be sure and stop into the Silver Fork Inn for breakfast, lunch or dinner. They also have a few rooms for those who really want to indulge in the serenity of the canyon.

reviews.name: Kapaluafan
reviews.title: SPECTACULAR!
reviews.comment:
You access this canyon from the East side of the Salt Lake Valley. The entrance follows the course of the creek,terrain elevation increases gradually . Then you enter an area with steep,dramatic rocky mountains that come down to the level of the road. It is breathtaking! There are turnoffs and a camp ground where photo moments are accessible. After navigating a series of switchbacks the landscape opens up to vistas of heavily forested mountains and you are driving toward two popular ski areas,Solitude and Brighton. Both have great skiing and numerous restaurants and shops at their base.
This canyon is popular and crowded year round.
Fishing,camping,shopping,hiking are also available.
If you visit Salt Lake City anytime of the year, this is a must trip. You will love it!
P.S. I am not employed by the chamber of commerce. I live here and hope you will enjoy this beautiful canyon

reviews.name: jas326
reviews.title: Nice drive
reviews.comment: Due to snow we were only able to drive up to two of the ski resorts. The drive though was beautiful. Plenty of pull off areas to stop and hike a trail or to take pictures. I would love to spend more time next time hiking some of the trails.

reviews.name: Rachel W
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon to ride bikes
reviews.comment: One of my favorite and most challenging road bike rides. The scenery is spectacular and the ride is long and challenging. Make sure you take 2-3 water bottles and a couple of snacks. At the top you can check out Silver Lake and use the restroom. There's also the Brighton Store

reviews.name: enviares1sowski
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Easy trail around the water...great scenery. Very family. The rest of this review is me trying to get to 100 letters.

reviews.name: fritz e
reviews.title: Great for Skiing and Hiking
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a nice long ride with lots of hiking paths on both sides of the road. Places to camp as well as two ski resorts accessible in summer and winter. Good destination for skiing at Brighton and Solitude

reviews.name: klrwg
reviews.title: Great canyon to explore and look at the fall colors
reviews.comment: Awesome canyon to go hike or walk around Silver Lake which is up at Brighton. The fall colors are awesome!

reviews.name: dmlove6191
reviews.title: Cottonwood Canyon Reviee
reviews.comment: We live at the base of Cottonwood Canyon and love to ride up the canyon to enjoy breakfast/dinner or a picnic. The view of the canyon and home from our house is incredible!!! We have lived here for over 17 years and love it! It is the most beautiful area to live, visit and raise a family!!!! Marilyn Love

reviews.name: E9110JMrichardw
reviews.title: Wonderful spring or summer hiking trips
reviews.comment: In Big Cottonwood Canyon there are dozens of wonderful hikes or mountain biking trails that can be taken to see glorious views and wild flowers and perhaps wildlife. There are trails for beginners (flat landers) to advanced mountaineers. Fall hikes are great to see spectacular fall colors.

reviews.name: Kelle R
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: This canyon is beautiful. Hiking picnic skiing or just driving through it. The fall and spring colors are gorgeous.

reviews.name: Lou H
reviews.title: A must do for cyclists
reviews.comment: Riding your bike up this canyon is reminiscent of riding big European passes. A must do for road cyclists. Great mountain biking also!

reviews.name: Davanrn
reviews.title: Gorgeous Utah Canyon
reviews.comment: We visited here in winter to ski. Beautiful canyon drive up to the resorts. Great views from the mountain tops. Well maintained but windy road. Closed if snowing heavily.

reviews.name: 502bbb
reviews.title: Great drive!
reviews.comment: We did this drive on a pretty foggy day and still had a great time with the scenery! Maybe it was even better because it was not to crowded?

reviews.name: Navigator828549
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon.
reviews.comment: Lots of hiking and picnic areas. Silver Lake is fantastic. Great ski resorts in the winter. Cool getaway during the summer time and beautiful fall colors.

reviews.name: Michele B
reviews.title: SUPER crowded, NO PARKING, take the bus!
reviews.comment:
In the past 3 years this poor canyon has suffered a POPULATION EXPLOSION!! The trail heads don't have enough parking, forcing cars to line the sides of the narrow two lane road. I'm a home owner in the canyon and often see piles of broken glass at the trail heads from nasty thieves that wait for hikers to leave so they can do a smash and run with your valuables. In the summer, selfie-taking motorists litter the road side as LOUD Harley's rumble past in large SLOW moving groups. In the winter, especially on a powder day, better plan on making sure there is a place to park at the ski area before you spend 1.5 hours in a line of traffic so you don't get turned back. When departing BCC on a powder day or a holiday or some random day for no reason, it may take you up to 2 hours to get down the canyon.
Something must be done. This is heartbreaking. TAKE THE BUS! CARPOOL! GO TO COLORADO!

reviews.name: Dmar10
reviews.title: Great place for beginner-difficult likes & to escape the heat.
reviews.comment: This canyon is appealing year round. Gorgeous in the fall, cooler than the city in the summer. Plenty of hiking trails of varying difficulty.

reviews.name: rinkrat3
reviews.title: beautiful scenery
reviews.comment: I went in November. There was snow, and seeing all of the footprints was very cool. The scenery makes for the most beautiful pictures. I bet it is amazing in the summer.

reviews.name: Sheila T
reviews.title: beautiful
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is gorgeous, and a great place a hike, walk, or picnic - easy drive from Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: Anna Maria K
reviews.title: stunning views!
reviews.comment: summer, winter or fall - this place is a photographer's dream. Steep canyon walls open up to unveil the most spectacular views. You will gasp at every turn. Each season is different. worth coming back in different times of the years!

reviews.name: Jeff Anderson
reviews.title: Living in Big Cottonwood
reviews.comment: I lived in Big Cottonwood in (BBC) for 20 years. The best things about BBC is the Cayon Itself. Hiking to Lake Blanche is only 3.7 miles up the canyon on the South side. it was my favorite in the canyon. There is also Silver Lake which is Child-friendly. They can also catch their first fish from the pier. The state stocks Silver Lake most of the summer starting just before the 4th of July. The skiing in BBC pretty good for the area. I would rank it 3rd after Alta-Snowbird and Deer Valley

reviews.name: Roger D
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Big Beauty
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a must see, whenever you are in the area, regardless of the season. In the winter, there are two excellent ski resorts, Brighton and Solitude. The snow in the canyon makes all the peaks glisten. In the summer, it is a great place to escape the heat of the valley with hikes to mountain lakes and water falls.

reviews.name: Patti J
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canton Trails
reviews.comment: Cleanest and most beautiful hiking trails ever! The fall is the best time to visit this canyon for hiking. The leaves are magnificent in a variety of fall colors

reviews.name: Cate O'Hare A
reviews.title: Love the canyon for skiing in the winter and hiking in the summer.
reviews.comment: BCC is a wonderful year round destination. Plenty of opportunities to ski, backcountry, nordic, downhill, mountain bike, hiking.

reviews.name: Dan H
reviews.title: Pleasant drive to the ski resorts
reviews.comment: Absolutely beautiful! We always look forward to our casual drives up the canyon! Every season offers new spectacular views and events! Even our three young children look forward to hiking and playing in Big Cottonwood Canyon

reviews.name: Valerie T
reviews.title: Wonderful hikes
reviews.comment: There are many trails to hike for all levels of fitness. It is a great place to go and get away and connect to nature.

reviews.name: Robert H
reviews.title: Angry moose! Avoid it! It’s unsafe!
reviews.comment: I thought it would’ve nice but all I saw was an angry moose that yelled at me. Avoid this place at all costs and go to Park City to the outlet malls. It’s a much better experience.

reviews.name: Ray V
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment: There are lakes, rivers and streams to hike and see. Great way to get out of the smog and get some exercise. Ski resorts Solitude and Brighton are both outstanding. Always a nice scenic drive especially during the fall. There are also picnic areas, rock climbing, and some mountain biking trails.

reviews.name: DerekLarsen
reviews.title: Climbing and hiking adventure
reviews.comment: Spectacular fall foliage in my outdoor adventure up this magnificent canyon. I encourage you to explore the great hiking in the wasatch canyons.

reviews.name: Mark A
reviews.title: Amazing Access to High Mountain Adventure
reviews.comment: In my opinion, there is no better place in the United States for access to a vast array of mountain adventures than Salt Lake City, Utah. Big Cottonwood Canyon is just minutes away from all the amenities of the city, but when you get there it is like getting away from it all. The hiking opportunities in the canyon are terrific. I especially enjoy Donut Falls for an easy walk or the Lake Mary Trail above Brighton for a little more exercise. There are also much more strenuous hikes for when I'm energetic. There are numerous mountain bike trails and rock climbing areas as well. I've enjoyed camping in the canyon or driving the dirt road over the top to go into Park City. In the winter, the snowsports in Big Cottonwood Canyon are exceptional. The famous ski resorts in Little Cottonwood Canyon - Alta and Snowbird - are wonderful, but the locals know that Brighton and Solitude in Big Cottonwood Canyon are just as good, are more reasonably priced, and often not as crowded. There is also an excellent cross-country ski center and miles of back country options as well. Simply put, Big Cottonwood Canyon is an outdoor paradise.

reviews.name: NachelleTrekkie
reviews.title: Absolutely Gorgeous!!
reviews.comment: Beautiful hikes. Great for families with small children (as long as you keep an eye on them). Perfect for impromptu day trips or dates.

reviews.name: Jin K
reviews.title: Special occasion visit place
reviews.comment: We are all way visit this beautiful all most top of mountain when guest come, it all ways nice place to go walk around pond trail, lots a wood and very fresh refleeling, it is ok dress shoes but camping booth will be better to walk train, you can see meadow glow from water it is great time to visit spring and fall, winter you can't walk around trail, you have to have snow shoes or rental, all way refreshing, no cost to get there, recomand visit, I go quit often

reviews.name: NanaS1980
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: I hesitate to write too much because I don’t want to overcrowd the canyon. I’ve hiked several trails many times and it never disappoints!

reviews.name: Diane-Wolf
reviews.title: Beautiful hikes!
reviews.comment:
There are so many beautiful hikes around this Canyon. Easy; Moderate and Challenge hikes. July is the Peak season to see wild flowers, Mooses; Deer etc...
Easy hike is Secret Lake at Alta, Red Pine Lake; White Pine Lake etc... More charllenge hikes like Wolverine Cirque etc... check on “Hike the Wasatch Mountain “
Photo show The Red Pine Lake and above it.

reviews.name: feistyone88
reviews.title: Dinner, walk and amazing vistas
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a place of largely untouched Alpine beauty. We took out-of-state friends there for dinner, had a walk around the lake at Brighton, and watched a moose saunter off into the sunset.

reviews.name: Ten in the Sand
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon
reviews.comment: If you have a chance make sure to at least drive through big Cottonwood canyon. If you have time get out and do some of the hikes. Most are easy with plenty of parking road side. There are several water falls you can hike to but our favorite hike is up to Mary's lake, it's absolutely beautiful!

reviews.name: Sine D
reviews.title: A view with a love
reviews.comment: This was a wonderful trip to share with my boyfriend on his first trip to the Western US, a place to share a lovely day of hiking and a lunch with beautiful views of the mountains and ski slopes in the summer,

reviews.name: Claire
reviews.title: Incredible climbing, awe-inspiring views.
reviews.comment: Experienced my first outdoor climb in big cottonwood and was so impressed. It gets very busy but its so great to see everyone take advantage of such a wonderful spot SO close to Salt Lake. Literally a 10 minute drive from my house. Get outside!

reviews.name: Rowena B
reviews.title: Great hikes all the time
reviews.comment: This area is always a great drive to its wonderful trails - Dog Lake, Lake Blanche and other trails. Many wildlife so be wary and most trails - dogs are not allowed to protect the reservoirs. Must come back again.

reviews.name: Alan K
reviews.title: Utah mountains are magnificent
reviews.comment:
Beautiful mountains are good for more than skiing. Plan to drive up the canyons when in the area.
I especially like the American Fork Canyon drive to Cascade Springs, then down the other side of the mountain into Provo Canyon, but all of the canyons are worth the trip.

reviews.name: TedL1049
reviews.title: Scenic Area
reviews.comment: Not overly impressed. Hiking trails are steep. Creeks small. Mountain scenery. Road can get winding. Didn't find map to help trail walk decision.

reviews.name: Taylor B
reviews.title: A great destination for everything from hiking to skiing to sight-seeing
reviews.comment: As retired 78-year-olds who love to travel, we are more prone to sight-seeing or walking on a beach than hiking or skiing or biking or certainly rock climbing. But all of that and more is on the plate in Big Cottonwood Canyon in Utah. Located in the Wasatch Range 12 miles southeast of Salt Lake City, the 15-mile-long canyon provides hiking, biking, picnicking, rock climbing, camping and fishing in the summer. In the winter, its two ski resorts, Brighton and Solitude, are popular destinations for skiers and cross-country skiers, snowshoe hikers and snowboarders. For sight-seers and folks who enjoy fresh mountain air, the canyon is accessed by The Big Cottonwood Canyon Scenic Byway, which runs its length to Guardsman Pass at the top of the canyon, allowing travel to Park City in the summer months. Hiking to the canyon's mountain lakes is a popular activity, with many trails leading to lakes such as Mary, Martha and Katherine. The canyon's most popular hiking trail, 3.1 miles long and very strenuous, leads to Lakes Blanche, Florence and Lillian. The canyon also is a frequent destination for Utah Native Plant Society wildflower walks and for University of Utah botanical field trips. Storm Mountain is a popular picnic site and S-Curve Area is a favorite gathering place for rock climbers. A drive through the canyon with your car windows open is as refreshing as a dip in cold water.

reviews.name: Cindy C
reviews.title: Great places to hike and enjoy nature
reviews.comment: This is one of the great canyons where you can park and take a hike for the day, or for a few hours. There are plenty of options, if you want to hike up to a lake, or just take your time and enjoy the beauty of nature in the mountains. There is something to be said about the solitude which can be difficult where so many people go here now. But it is still a great place to visit.

reviews.name: Janie B
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: Took the Big Cottonwood Canyon scenic drive from Salt Lake City to Brighton Ski Lodge. A short drive, only about 45 minutes. A beautiful and relaxing drive. The granite formations along the route are huge and gorgeous! There are several turnouts where you can stop for pictures. Definitely worth the drive.

reviews.name: Kkelly89
reviews.title: Great short hike
reviews.comment: We went on a short hike to Lake Mary. The views were amazing and the lake was a gem and not at all crowded on a weekday morning.

reviews.name: LorileanTroy
reviews.title: Beautiful Visit
reviews.comment: Such a beautiful trip with family and friends. Beautiful hiking and picnic areas and great fishing too.

reviews.name: Sharee C
reviews.title: Donut Falls & fall Leaves 😍
reviews.comment: Beautiful fun drive anytime of year but especially in the fall! Donut falls is easy for people of all ages.

reviews.name: Jeremyp80136
reviews.title: Hiking
reviews.comment: Amazing views great hikes definitely a great place to visit for any adventures u might have . Also fall time colors perfect time

reviews.name: Mike K
reviews.title: a visit up the canyon is a must
reviews.comment: Not only are the picnic and camping areas such as Spruces great places to go for an 'al fresco' meal or for a 2-3 day camping experience getting away from the haze and noise of the city but there is also the wonderful Silver Fork Lodge for a fine meal both indoors and out on the deck (when the weather permits), watching the hummingbirds flit back and forth.

reviews.name: PhantomScribbler
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon.
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood canyon is beautiful anytime of the year, but I think fall is my favorite. We went to the canyon to see if the leaves had started to change. They are trying. Perhaps in a coie of weeks the colors6 will be more vibrant. No matter what, any day in Big Cottonwood canyon is a great day. Just so you know, the road can get crowded, but it's worth it.

reviews.name: simpfan4evr
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is one of the best canyons in Utah, lots of hikes, lots of lakes and amazing scenery!

reviews.name: Bryan C
reviews.title: Beautiful vistas, great hiking!
reviews.comment: Great lakes, hikes, see wildlife such as moose, deer, chipmunks. Cool in the summer and a relief from the heat of the city.

reviews.name: 341freddyb
reviews.title: Silver lake and by all means bring a fishing pole
reviews.comment:
whether you keep or practice catch and release.....Trout is abundant to be sure, all you have to do is outsmart the fish right?
I enjoy going up there and there are a good number of nooks on the wooden trail that surrounds the lake to allow you to fish in peace while others enjoy their hikes on a beautiful nature trail. Do remember that Silver lake is located at the Brighton ski resort and that means :Beware" of elevation and temperature, even in the summertime. Brook and Rainbow trout thrive in cold waters and that should serve as a notice to you. Otherwise ….Enjoy fishing or....a day out on a nature trail mesmerized in the beauty that will surely surround you.

reviews.name: PlanetR
reviews.title: Outstanding World Class Hiking!
reviews.comment: Did the Desolation Lake Trail a 8 mile hike with about 2000 vertical climb. 4 miles up and back. The trail is very well maintained and moderate in difficulty because of the long uphill climb. The views are spectacular especially today with the colorful leaves peaking. There were other people there, but I wouldn't call it crowded. We just did the 5 southern national parks....that's crowded. This hike rivaled any hike in the parks. The drive is gorgeous. You can climb an extra 1/2 mile to the ridge above the lake and see Park City views and make this a 9 mile hike. Wonderful scenery and a great way to enjoy the beautiful area.

reviews.name: jj435Rye
reviews.title: Good Views
reviews.comment: Although the road is at times narrow and curvy, you are rewarded with spectacular views of canyons and the Salt Lake City area. Look for the pullover areas so you can enjoy the scenery.

reviews.name: confusedAussie
reviews.title: Nice drive
reviews.comment: We enjoyed the drive through Little Cottonwood more but this was still nice. Walk around Silver lake at Brighton was very enjoyable even for non walkers

reviews.name: John P
reviews.title: Hiking
reviews.comment: Awesome hiking. Some of the best hiking in the country. Easy to get to the trails; highly recommend!

reviews.name: Anna R
reviews.title: Great Hike
reviews.comment: Beautiful hike with lots of beautiful views. Make sure you go to silver lake when up here- nice walk around the lake.

reviews.name: Brenda B
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: What a beautiful place. Lots of places to pull over and get some fantastic pictures. I understand it is normally crowded but we got lucky - the canyon was closed part of the day for a race and that kept the crowds away today.

reviews.name: HK_Leesie
reviews.title: Getting too crowded
reviews.comment: This is a gorgeous road and canyon just outside of Salt Lake City. But, over the past 8 years, it's gotten increasingly overrun. On the weekend, if you're not there crazy early, forget about it. Trailhead parking is mobbed. Even parking on the shoulder gets congested. They may have to consider making it a fee area. Sadly, it's getting loved to death. We used to come for weeks every summer, but we're moved a lot of our mountain time to Colorado to avoid the hordes. When we do come, we ride bikes up from the mouth of the canyon to Brighton and back down to Silverfork for breakfast. If we hike, we get the trailhead bright and early. Try weekdays and early mornings if you want to enjoy nature without the crush of cars and people.

reviews.name: ThorvaldHansen
reviews.title: Crowded hike to Lake Catherine
reviews.comment:
I know, I know. I shouldn't have gone on a holiday. But, I did. I paid the price...the crowd going up and coming down was overwhelming. The only real wildlife we saw was a couple of chipmunks, probably because it was so noisy.
AVOID THE WEEKEND OR A HOLIDAY. I can't speak to a weekday, but I'm pretty sure that would be better. I don't think it could be worse.
Car traffic was pretty crazy, too. Safety is an issue when it gets that crowded with people parking on the side of the road.

reviews.name: AllyRCook
reviews.title: Great drive
reviews.comment: Really great drive and you could def spend an entire day just here. We chose to do the Lake Mary (4 mi round trip) hike. You can find details about it in Utah’s tourism website. Go to Brighton resort and the trail head is at the back of the parking lot.

reviews.name: BMLNewZealand
reviews.title: Breathtaking beauty
reviews.comment: We drove through the Canyon from Park City on our way to Salt Lake City. The road condition out of Park City was not the best, but once we got to the summit, it was just fine. We took our time, the road was quiet (it was mid week), and were so glad we took this route, rather than the freeway straight through to SLC.

reviews.name: Dustin H
reviews.title: It's not just a Sunday drive.
reviews.comment: It's not far from downtown. When people are at work during the weekdays. I find it nice that I can take someone I care about and head up in to the mountains in less the 25 minutes and be out of the city. There's hiking, fishing, biking, picknicking. Just zen time. It's finding yourself during the week. So if you have the time or you don't make it. It's one of the reasons that makes Salt Lake City what it is.

reviews.name: Tracy T
reviews.title: Above the fray
reviews.comment:
I managed to escape the insanity of the city one afternoon and drove up to Big Cottonwood Canyon. It is a huge area and, depending on your desires can results in a leisurely stroll around Silver Lake, of present a more strenuous activity. Even if you decide not to get out of the car (no judgement) it is worth the journey to see the beauty that is the Rocky Mountains. For those of you who do choose to do some exploring, note the elevation can exceed 8000 feet, which means the air can be a bit thin. So take your time and enjoy the journey.
Some have said that it can be very crowded, which does not surprise me, given it is so near SLC. But if you can manage a trip during the week, you will have no problem finding the peace and solitude you seek. As I was there in late August, the wildflowers were already gone, but I can imagine their Spring beauty. Regardless, it was a wonderful afternoon of trails, lakes and fauna.

reviews.name: Oskarduck
reviews.title: Spectacular Nature Close to the City
reviews.comment: Only 20 minutes from downtown, the canyon is fantastic if one likes the rugged outdoors. There are lots of spots for rock climbing and hiking. The road through the canyon is curvy and slow going. Lots to do here if you like outdoorsy stuff.

reviews.name: Mickenzie D
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: We always take a walk or bike up Cottonwood Canyon every year, especially in the fall. Be sure to pack a lunch as there are a lot of places to have a picnic!

reviews.name: Elaine K
reviews.title: So much to do in this Canyon.
reviews.comment:
You could take years of exploring this canyon. It's amazing.
Twin Lakes, Lake Solitude, Silver Lake, Lake Mary, Lake Katherine , Lake Blanche, Donut Falls, Dog Log, etc etc etc ...
Just to name a few of some of the best hiking in the valley.
Then there is "The Silver Fork Lodge" for fine dining. And if you want a very quaint get away. Perfect for an event or wedding as well.
That doesn't even touch the dining at Solitude ... or the Frisbee golf course.
Or the mountain biking trails!
