It's absolutely breathtaking.
And ... let's talk skiing. I love Brighton ... it's such a nicely groomed fun place. Solitude to me is for the real experience skiers.
To me - this canyon is great for all four seasons.
The only con ... is everyone knows about it! It's very crowded on weekends, etc.
Still one of my favorites for outdoor enthusiasts.

reviews.name: Alley B
reviews.title: Mountain view
reviews.comment: This place is beautiful any time of the year....however, I do love the colors in the fall. So many little turn offs to get out and enjoy nature.

reviews.name: zipper901
reviews.title: Greate trails
reviews.comment: Lots of nice hiking trails. Parking might be little though at popular trailheads, but not too bad...

reviews.name: Mark K
reviews.title: A beautiful canyon with trails and skiing
reviews.comment: Only 30 minutes from downtown SLC is a beautiful canyon that offers hiking and biking trails along with 2 world class ski/snowboard resorts. I love it up there anytime of the year.

reviews.name: MartinLCannon
reviews.title: Absolutely a must see!
reviews.comment: I’ve be n to Salt Lake before and focused before on Mormon monuments, but Trip Advisor’s #1 recommendation was the Big Cottonwood Canyon scenic drive, and we were totally awed and amazed by this spectacular natural wonder. The sheer cliffs and magnificent scale of this dramatic natural wonderful was way beyond our expectations. Anybody going to Salt Lake City should put this at the absolute top of their list. SO glad we went there.

reviews.name: rbbjlb
reviews.title: Beautiful, but so crowded. Get off the beaten path!
reviews.comment: My family of four, including a four-year-old and seven-year-old, went on a Saturday in August. We were on East Coast time, so we were in the canyon before 6 AM, but it was still overwhelmingly crowded with runners, bicyclists, and hikers. We hiked Donut Falls without too many people that early, but there were tons of people coming up when we were coming down. Then we hiked some trails at Guardsmans Pass. Parking was crazy, but we didn’t see too many people on the trail to the peak. The views were stunning!!! The trail to the lake was very busy and there were a ton of dogs, but it was still peaceful. Overall, a wonderful visit!

reviews.name: John M
reviews.title: Gorgeous Ride up on the motorcycle
reviews.comment: Stop for breakfast at the Silver Fork Lodge and have the sourdough pancakes with berries and a side of bacon. They have been cooking with the same sourdough starter since the 1940's and is it ever good..... not sure what brand of coffee they serve but it's not swill like nearly all restaurant coffee.. Omelets and egg dishes are awesome too, I expect so it lunch and dinner but I haven't had lunch there in years...

reviews.name: quinnt2
reviews.title: Must go and see - Absolutely amazing
reviews.comment: One of the best days of our trip was spent sightseeing this beautiful canyon!! A must drive if you are near Park City.

reviews.name: phyrman21
reviews.title: Often
reviews.comment: Kind of hard to review an entire canyon. So much to do here depending on the season. Hiking. Camping. Fishing. Picnicking. Skiing. Snowshoeing. Etc etc etc. I guess I’m just reviewing this place for the extra points.

reviews.name: Kat
reviews.title: A MUST do!
reviews.comment: You MUST go here and do a hike when in SLC! Thanks are tons of hikes to choose from, from easy to hard. We did the White Pine Lake hike and it was difficult. Took about 5.5 hours round trip, but was gorgeous. We went on a weekday and hardly saw any other people; it was fabulous!

reviews.name: mkelias
reviews.title: Great place to visit.
reviews.comment: We took the scenic drive up the canyon, then hiked to Donut Falls. A magnificent spot, walking along a steep creek and through gorgeous mountain scenery. Also, being in a national forest, not a national park, there was no entry fee.

reviews.name: Raeshel S
reviews.title: The views and the trails are worth the drive
reviews.comment: We drove to the top of the mountain to the Brighton Ski Resort and took the trail to see Lake Mary. I ABSOLUTELY would do this again. All up Big Cottonwood Canyon Road you can see beautiful places to stop, trails to hike , streams to explore, but the view from the top is my favorite!

reviews.name: SarahM1187
reviews.title: Brighton Lakes Trail
reviews.comment: Brighton Lakes Trail VERY quickly became one of my all-time favorite hikes. Moderate hike that's +/- 4 miles (there and back) with STUNNING views. Wish we had more time but were only able to complete half due to time-constraints. Start at the base of Brighton Creek lodge (about 12 miles up the mountain, via one-lane road) and ENJOY!

reviews.name: Gary S
reviews.title: Amazing short drive from Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon has something for just about anyone. Spectacular scenery, camping, hiking, summer activities at two ski resorts, day use areas. It is close to the city yet the canyon is worlds away from the urban sprawl. As a side note for those who have to stay connected there is LTE cell coverage in most of the canyon.

reviews.name: Judy K
reviews.title: Gorgeous views all year around and mounds of powdery snow in winter!!!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is worth the drive/fly/hike all the way to the top! Any time of year...but you definitely must have tire chains if you are going in Winter. Many gorgeous views on the way up too. Hiking trails and picnic areas on the way up too.

reviews.name: Andy6205
reviews.title: Spent 2 days roaming all over it--
reviews.comment: We were in the area for 5 days but spent 2 roaming around in awe of the beauty we were seeing. We went over Gaurdsman pass and saw 7 moose and a mule deer. It was amazing!!!

reviews.name: Jim A
reviews.title: Hiking
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful canyons along the Wasatch front. Numerous hikes for all ages and all abilities. From Catherine Lake to Desolation Lake they are all beautiful.

reviews.name: Danny A.C. M
reviews.title: Great hiking spots
reviews.comment: If you are in the Salt Lake area, Big Cottonwood Csnyon is a great place to hike and camp. I found some great places to hike and were not all tough. Some were challenging but some were just relaxing. It’s close to the city so easy to get to.

reviews.name: lezlim386
reviews.title: Family walk around the lake
reviews.comment:
The trail is for Any age and wheelchairs, part boardwalk, partially paved, partially dirt.
This is the place for a beautiful peaceful walk around a small lake- see fish jumping, ducks and babies, moose often can be seen. Rocks for climbing, benches for relaxing and just enjoying the beautiful mountains all around.
There are several more advanced trailheads taking off from there.

reviews.name: Rita E
reviews.title: Best Place to Hike
reviews.comment: Great Hiking trails of all levels. You can walk aroundSilver Lake, hikr to Lake Solitude , Twin Lakes, or Lake Mary. There are numerous other trails in the canyon.

reviews.name: O9437UZjimp
reviews.title: Awesome canyon
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon has it all trails, campsites, views, a stream and lakes. Spending a day with family will create great memories.

reviews.name: Stephanie N
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is beautiful and easily accessible year-round. We love to hike around Silver Lake and often see wildlife including moose. Close drive from Salt Lake City. Great Skiing options.

reviews.name: Lynette P
reviews.title: One of Utah's gems
reviews.comment: This canyon isn't just for skiing. Summer hiking, bike riding, camping, or many other activities are plentiful in this canyon. Very popular, very beautiful.

reviews.name: Michael T
reviews.title: Sumer hikimg
reviews.comment: Several nice hiking trails at 7500+ ft elevation gain. Most follow ski trails. Passing pretty lakes and Meadows. Moose often present near Brighton. Various lenghths and degrees of difficulty. Lower canyon may has trail heads as well, see quite wonderful for autn hikes. Easy to reach fr Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: Virag W
reviews.title: Beautiful hikes, amazing scenery
reviews.comment:
There are a tons of scenic hikes in this canyon, you will find something for every hiking level. We purchased a little book at the local REI with has short and very useful descriptions of all the major hikes. We also have a topographic map in case we get off the trail.
Make sure that you are prepared for the hikes, the temperature can be pretty cool in the morning and in the evening, pack an extra layer. A bug spray is also recommended, some of the shady trails have mosquitoes because of the alpine lakes.
Keep in mind, this canyon is a water shed area, the city gets its water from he melting snow, and in an effort to keep the canyon clean, they do not let dogs in the canyon. If you want to hike with dogs, you need to go to Millcreek Canyon. Make sure that you check the leash laws, dogs can go off leash there every odd day only.

reviews.name: Melissa S
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: I like the run the Revel Big Cottonwood Canyon marathon. It's beautiful! It's an awesome September run.

reviews.name: kcremerv
reviews.title: Great hike!
reviews.comment: We got a Lyft ride from U of U campus up Big Cottonwood Canyon to Brighton, where we began our hike up and over Catherine Pass to Alta where we once again got a Lyft ride back to campus. A beautiful, fairly easy hike, with wonderful views, lakes, and wildflowers!

reviews.name: StianHovda
reviews.title: A review on the Broad Fork Twin Peaks
reviews.comment:
A tough and steep hike - elevation gain of just above 1500meters. The peak is at 3457meters above sea level. The total length of the hike is around 15km. It starts of pretty soft down in the woods, but turns steeper and steeper. The last (estimate) parts of the hike consists of about 500 meters covered in loose rocks in all sizes. You won’t meet many others on this hike, but is a very rewarding and stunning view when you get to the top. We also saw a Moose a long the way - nice! See the pics attached.
Ps: don’t go this trip if you aren’t in shape. In particular the last parts of the trip is tough. Bring a lot of food and water. Water can also be refilled along the way. We spent about 7,5 hours on this hike.

reviews.name: RedHornet72653
reviews.title: Theres so much beauty here.
reviews.comment: You almost can't describe how much the scenery just lights up. It is a really nice trip over the mountain.

reviews.name: herd_of_6
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment:
Our first trip to Utah and we had to get some short hikes in with the kids. Donut falls was a fun first one. Lots of foot traffic and we still saw a baby moose.
Then we returned to do the Lake Mary and Twin Lakes Loop which was amazing! It had a steep climb so the toddler was in the pack and lots of complaints from the older kids but as soon as it leveled out it was well worth it! Also saw a large male moose.

reviews.name: 921adriank
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This canyon is beautiful and I have hiked there few times. It is cooler in the canyon than in SLC. My favorite hike is Lake Blanche.

reviews.name: bverbos
reviews.title: Great for Serious and Casual Hikers
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is an easy drive from anywhere in the Salt Lake City area. The drive up the canyon is very scenic with several hiking opportunities along the way. The real highlight is at the top end, at Brighton Ski resort and Silver Lake Ranger Station. The scenery up here is beautiful and the variety of hiking options is great. The hikes range from a flat 1 mile hike around an alpine lake behind the ranger station to long uphill treks to several alpine lakes above the Brighton Lodge. There is a small store across the road from the ranger station, and they also grill hot dogs and burgers during lunch time.

reviews.name: JennScents
reviews.title: Gorgeouos views and scenery. Worth the drive.
reviews.comment: This was defintely worth the drive to see the Utah nature, creeks and grandeur of the mountains. Places along the way to stop and hike or take photos. Spectaular views.

reviews.name: JamieB0810
reviews.title: Beautiful in any season!
reviews.comment: We love to ride our motorcycles up the canyon in the summer and have breakfast at the Silverfork Lodge. Then go up a little higher to Silver Lake and take a quick walk around the lake on the boardwalk. Plenty of hiking in the summer and plenty of skiing in the winter. It is nice to have the mountains so close!

reviews.name: Arthur B
reviews.title: Gorgeous views and beautiful wildflowers.
reviews.comment: This is an absolute must for visitors (and locals) during the early summer months for spectacular scenery and wildflowers.

reviews.name: Travelling Hiker
reviews.title: Loved it! Plenty of trails
reviews.comment:
Perfect hiking spot.... every trail has a wonderful surprise waiting for you. if you like adventure...you must hike here.
I will b back.

reviews.name: pekk
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenic Road
reviews.comment: A definite must if visiting Salt Lake City, as it is just a 10 minute drive from the city and the scenic byway provides some amazing views and hikes. Worth stopping at Solitude, Silver Lake and then continuing to Midway.

reviews.name: Mike J
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon!
reviews.comment: Although we are Native Utahns we've never visited this canyon and we are sorry we haven't before now. It is a beautiful canyon with some diverse features. If you are a lover of the outdoors there is plenty to do. Short hikes, waterfalls, fishing, camping, restaurants, lakes, unique rock formations, cooler weather than down in the valley, wild life, etc. Loved it.

reviews.name: Debbie S
reviews.title: Great hiking
reviews.comment: Big cottonwood canyon has many wonderful hikes . Absolutely beautiful views. Great skiing in the winter.

reviews.name: Jody D
reviews.title: Beautiful canyons with something for everyone
reviews.comment: Love this canyon as it has something for everyone. All kinds of hikes from beginning to advanced. Rock climbing. Lakes. Campgrounds. There really is something for all levels, abilities, and ages. I live in Utah so it’s a quick drive from home. It’s really a beautiful drive as well.

reviews.name: Z7121WTgaryh
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon near Salt Lake City, Utah
reviews.comment: This canyon is beautiful and there are many hikes of different levels that you can take. Brighton is at the top of the canyon and has restaurants and hotels to stay in. Well worth the time in the summer.

reviews.name: sundiverdb
reviews.title: Beautiful nature
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is quite a scenic drive and the home of even more hiking trails. Be ready to spend a full day if you choose to explore even one of those trails. Beautiful, pristine, and a quick break away from the day to day grind

reviews.name: Debra S
reviews.title: Beautiful Area lots to do. Take the tram to the top of the mountain.
reviews.comment: The is a majestic place, absolutely gorgeous. We saw moose, pica and hawks. The area where you take the skylift has tons of things to do.

reviews.name: phoeschs
reviews.title: Cool relief from the heat
reviews.comment: So many light hiking areas for small children. Way cooler than in the valley. So pretty, we had a lot of fun.

reviews.name: lyuba b
reviews.title: Great drive and plenty of beautiful hikes
reviews.comment: Make sure to check out Blood's Lake and Lake Lackawaxen. Also, the walk around Silver Lake is beautiful and always full of amazing wildlife to see.

reviews.name: jburns593
reviews.title: Canyon
reviews.comment:
This is one of the most beautiful canyons in the world, be it summer or winter.
You can camp and hike in the summer. In the winter there is a ski resort.

reviews.name: Scott W
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment:
As always, the canyon is cool, beautiful, close, and pleasant.
Traffic can sometimes be heavy and fast. Take your time and enjoy driver. Have a picnic.

reviews.name: Matt B
reviews.title: my home away from home..
reviews.comment: I lived many adventures in this canyon.. from Snowboarding to camping to hiking to cabing times to mountain biking.. this canyon is pure magic! I feel peace and find beauty in every nook, trail, and tree. #myhome #mychurch #natureismyreligion

reviews.name: Mark
reviews.title: Excellent scenic drive
reviews.comment: One of the best drives in America. Beautiful mountain scenery with great views at every turn. We drove the Canyon to Park City and continued south to Provo and Moab. The road through Big Cottonwood to Park City to Provo was packed with scenic views.

reviews.name: jwsong1011
reviews.title: GOOD TO HIKE
reviews.comment:
GOOD TO HIKE B.C.C.. and it will be 3 hours for round trip to peak of mountain.
it is enough if you have one bottle of mineral water.

reviews.name: Luis S
reviews.title: Smoky Mountains of the west
reviews.comment: I thought this canyon would be like other canyons, but more of scenic views of the mountain ranges. The road going to the top is 2-way and narrows some more as you go further. A rocky trail that is fit for all ages, parking a little problem so go before 9am for a good spot!

reviews.name: Todd H
reviews.title: Awe inspiring and beautiful
reviews.comment: Had only half a day free in Salt Lake City, so rented a car and drove through the canyon from to Park City. Everywhere was gorgeous, like post cards. The kind of views that pictures can't do justice. Went for short hikes on the summit and at Donut Falls. Both spectacular and not very long. Could benefit from better signage to tell you what hikes are available from the various trail heads, so bring a map.

reviews.name: boncan630
reviews.title: Wow - What a Drive
reviews.comment: We took off for a leisurely drive and this one was recommended on several different travel sights. The views did not disapoint. There are several places to stop for scenic views, to get out and hike, or to sit down for a picnic. It really is a beautiful area.

reviews.name: Shelly T
reviews.title: great places for photography
reviews.comment: This is a great place for photography anytime of the year. All 4 seasons are gorgeous and worth the drive up and stay for a picnic!

reviews.name: A103V
reviews.title: Excellent Scenic Drive
reviews.comment: Great for family outing. As you derive up the mountain, a number of spots by the creek, offer excellent areas for picnic. A number of trails dot the area.

reviews.name: vern C
reviews.title: Great Drive
reviews.comment: I grew up in Utah not far from this canyon. It has always been a favorite for picnics, skiing or just a drive. A drive up the canyon this time of year is gorgeous and there are plenty of hiking trails along the way. I love this canyon.

reviews.name: Bill T
reviews.title: Silver Lake Loop Trail/Lake Solitude @Brighton Ski Resort
reviews.comment: A group of us headed to Silver Lake Loop trail for a quick hike. Halfway through the loop we saw a sign for Lake Solitude and took it. While the Silver Lake Loop is on a boardwalk and accessible for strollers, families with small children, etc, the Lake Solitude trail has a fairly moderate elevation gain at the start, then levels off into an easier hike. This is not, however, a trail for strollers. The landscape and vistas from the Lake Solitude trail are beautiful and it is quiet. There were not a lot of other hikers out, but it was a weekday when we were there. We did run into a moose, but we left her alone and she left us alone. Great place to hike and get away from it all.

reviews.name: Daniel F
reviews.title: Hiking and walking
reviews.comment: Really beautiful place. We walked around the lake at Brighton on the board walk and hiked the 1.5 mile trail up to Lake Solitude.

reviews.name: anybeachanytime
reviews.title: Beauty at every angle - every season!
reviews.comment: There's plenty to do and see in this canyon.. ski, snowboard, fish, camp, hike, photography, take a scenic drive.. there's something for everyone of every age! We love this place!

reviews.name: Heema P
reviews.title: Gorgeous Scenaries
reviews.comment: We did 2 hours of scenic drive. It was absolutely gorgeous We went unto Silver Lake which has amazing views. I feel this place is underrated, definitely exceeded my expectation.

reviews.name: Becky A
reviews.title: Beautiful...calming...stunning views!
reviews.comment:
Short drive up to Big Cottonwood Canyon where you will think you've escaped into another world!
So many things to do at the resorts or trails to hike or bike. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes and have some rain gear just in case! Do-Nut Falls is one of my favorite hikes, easy for all family members and the falls are gorgeous! But please be careful around the streams during the spring runoff - water is VERY cold and moves very fast! Watch your kids and hold their hands.
If you want to re-connect to nature, this canyon won't disappoint!

reviews.name: Andrea S
reviews.title: Just a few miles up Big Cottonwood Canyon, the forest and our little "alps" await... breathe deep.
reviews.comment: The drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon takes you past numerous areas to have picnics or stop to paint on a canvas or photo ops or hike into a mountain lake and streams. It is what I call our little "alps" -- for the well-maintained paved canyon road takes you in just a few miles right up into the alpine vistas as well as secluded glades and mountain meadows. Numerous places to explore, especially when the wildflowers are in bloom in late spring and summer (blooms usually come on a little later due to altitude, melting snow-pack, and spring rains) and you can participate in wildflower tours of several areas near ski resorts. If you are a history buff, the Wasatch canyons including Big Cottonwood have mining history beside the skiing industry. It's rugged and serene and you get away from city rushing around. You can get used to the quick ride up to the mountains as they are so close; once there, though, it is a fresh discovery each trip, never quite the same, though familiar and attainable. Big Cottonwood is called "big" because it has the longest miles of road up the canyon compared to Little Cottonwood Canyon "next door" to the south. These are only two of the many canyons that feed the Great Salt Lake Valley, and were formed respectively by glaciers (Little Cottonwood, U-shaped canyon) and rivers/streams (Big Cottonwood, V-shaped canyon). Wander here and enjoy!

reviews.name: bonez801
reviews.title: Picnic for Fathers
reviews.comment:
Drive in the Mountains 30 mins from the City
Hiking and picnicing in the Summer
Skiing in the Winter

reviews.name: hpgent
reviews.title: Great Scenic Drive
reviews.comment: The road from Park City back to Salt Lake is worth it. Amazing mountain views and wildlife along the way. Very cool when your at the top to look around at the valley below. Many pull off spots for photos.

reviews.name: Steven S
reviews.title: Wedding Reception
reviews.comment: Attended a terrific wedding reception at the Milley Lift Chalet at Brighton on 6/17. Very beautiful.

reviews.name: Alexander H. Becz
reviews.title: Great relaxing place
reviews.comment: This is one of the major Canyon in the greater Salt Lake City area. Along with Little Cottonwood, it is easily one of my favorite "relaxed walk in the nature" spots

reviews.name: William H
reviews.title: Close city proximity, great hikes and scenery, and even lunchtime skiing in winter.
reviews.comment: A very windy road close to the city takes you to beautiful scenery, outstanding hikes of varying difficulty in summer, and great skiing in winter. Explore the one-lane road that connects to Deer Valley and Park City.

reviews.name: Carl B
reviews.title: Travel
reviews.comment: Fantastic drive with pull off spots. Follows the Price River from the dam to Provo. Do not miss the falls. It is easy to miss some pulloffs.

reviews.name: Nostalgiyeah
reviews.title: Scenic mountain drive
reviews.comment:
I had around 3 hours to kill in Salt Lake City and decided to take the drive to Big Cottonwood. The whole drive was absolutely gorgeous. There were canyons, mountains and creeks with lush flora - was indeed a very pleasing experience for the eyes. Pulled over at multiple spots beside the road to click photographs and to simply listen to the mellow flow of streams.
I strongly urge folks to do the drive. Estimate around 40 minutes one way drive from Salt Lake City with no stops in between. Of course, most likely folks will stop for photos or simply to take in the views and that will add some time. I did not have time to explore the ski resort or do any hike and hence can't comment on those but purely based on the wonderful and refreshing drive, this place gets a huge thumbs up from me.

reviews.name: Linda W
reviews.title: Very scenic drive
reviews.comment: This is a truly beautiful drive through the mountains but I was disappointed that it basically dead ends at the top of the mountain after just several miles. Given that it was not skiing season when we took the drive, the "town" was pretty deserted and we didn't stop other than to get some pictures.

reviews.name: BrianR_11
reviews.title: Magnificient drive!! Wonderful vistas!!
reviews.comment: Amazing trails,amazing views from the road. Jst 30mins from downtown Salt Lake City. Simply memmorable!! A must do if you're in Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: Karen C
reviews.title: Great drive
reviews.comment: We had an extra day in Salt Lake City with nothing to do so we drove some of the canyon drives. Great scenery here, it even snowed when we got to Brighton. Wonderful drive.

reviews.name: Larry R
reviews.title: Great Ride
reviews.comment: We rode up the canyon after talking to a park employee at Antelope Island, he was right about a great ride.

reviews.name: Becks013
reviews.title: God's Work can be seen here!
reviews.comment: Beautiful! It's hard to rate or judge scenery as beauty is in the eye of the beholder. But Big Cottonwood Canyon provided various landscapes - ice, rivers, water, snow, mountains, clouds, and wildlife. Will be visiting again.

reviews.name: coleenk122
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: Gorgeous drive--well paved, lightly traveled this time of year. Stunning roadside waterfalls and trails (plenty of safe pull-offs). Silver Lake is a wonderful flatland hike. Much of the trail had melting snow so walk/run shoes at the minimum; traction necessary; trekking poles or cane not a bad idea if you aren't somewhat fit or you happen to be a tad frail. I lost track of the number of photos but I wish my phone could have captured the aroma of dense fir and mulch and crisp air... Enjoy! (and be careful of the joggers and bikers all along the roadways, please)

reviews.name: Rob S
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: We drove up here to take the grandparents sightseeing while we were all in town for our son's college graduation. I would like to go back to take some hikes. The canyon is so beautiful. Unfortunately we couldn't head over the pass because it was still closed due to snow.

reviews.name: Jonathan R
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: This is a must if visiting the Salt Lake area. It has some of the best scenery around. I'd visit when there is still snow on the ground!

reviews.name: Craig S
reviews.title: Take the drive up!
reviews.comment: If you have the time, no make the time and take the drive up! You will not be disappointed as the scenery is spectacular and if you are hungry stop at the Silverfork lodge for good food and if the back patio is open enjoy the hummingbirds.

reviews.name: NancAnth
reviews.title: Magnificent scenery
reviews.comment: What majestic and beautiful canyons! It's early spring - we can only imagine how girgeous it will be when trees start to bloom.

reviews.name: Camille H
reviews.title: Many nice hikes
reviews.comment: Lots of hikes to do with the whole family. I carry my little guy and my husband carries our 3 year old. Each hike is beautiful! Our kids will be excited to hike again there soon.

reviews.name: glassgardener
reviews.title: Majestic mountains and moose
reviews.comment: Desperately wanted to see a moose in the wild - we did! Wonderful experience, easy to get to from SLC and many trails to hike.

reviews.name: Nicholas K
reviews.title: Whats not to like
reviews.comment: Be careful though. Dogs are NOT aloud in this canyon, even if they are in your car. It is unlikely, but you could get a hefty fine for even bringing your furry friend on a car ride.

reviews.name: Kinner P
reviews.title: nice camping place.
reviews.comment: The place has lots of cabins around and nice hike and camping grounds ..The sunset views were great and preservations of waterlands is great to stroll.

reviews.name: Motivator535
reviews.title: Year around fun at Big Cottonwood canyon
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood canyon is picturesque year around including winter with tons of powder, spring and all the green, hiking on the cool during the heat of summer, and the fall colors!
This area is great for hiking, biking, all types of skiing, and snowshoeing to say the least. Check at the beginning of the canyon for restrictions, or seasonal access.
Great place to enjoy. Have fun!

reviews.name: nanacs1962
reviews.title: beautiful scenery
reviews.comment: I so loved looking at all the beautiful scenery. I highly recommend anyone going to saltlake city to take the trip over to see all the great place has to offer.

reviews.name: Susen T
reviews.title: Great connection with nature
reviews.comment: Great hiking with many choices and all levels. It's a great place to hike with family members or yo go solo. It's a clean fresh place to enjoy and to re center yourself.

reviews.name: Jolene W
reviews.title: Great Mountain Retreat
reviews.comment: If you enjoy hiking, camping, spontaneous picnic lunches, skiing in the winter, or just being in the great out doors Big Cottonwood Canyon has it all. The road is paved and adequate with only one lane in each direction. It is medium steep with lots of curves, but easy to drive at safe speeds. There are many places to pull off to enjoy a picnic breakfast,lunch or dinner with tables, fire pits. Hiking trails are well marked. There is a lake at the top of the canyon that has a boardwalk all the way around it. It's an easy walk for anyone. In the fall the colors are spectacular. There are a few restaurants along the canyon drive, but bringing your own food is the best way to enjoy a meal in natural beauty.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Snowy canyon
reviews.comment: We drove up this canyon several times during our stay in SLC area. Enjoyed seeing the snow. Visited Brighton ski area and the Silver Lake area. Did some shopping at Brighton ski resort store and went snowshoeing at Silver lake. The canyon is always beautiful anytime of the year.

reviews.name: UFPAGator
reviews.title: Beautiful even in the snow
reviews.comment: Drove to Big Cottonwood Canyon with the intention of hiking to a waterfall that wasn't too far off the road but it was snowing like crazy and super cold outside and we weren't prepared for hiking in that kind of weather so just drove and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. The roads were well kept even in the snow.

reviews.name: Steve N
reviews.title: Solitude is the Best
reviews.comment: We have made an annual pilgrimage from North Carolina to Big Cottonwood canyon and Solitude Mountain Resort for the last 10 years. The canyon is absolutely stunning with a beautiful stream that follows the canyon floor. The rock formations are majestic and speak to amazing forces that formed the canyon long ago. We have only been during the winter time when snow can get quite deep further up the canyon. Compared to Little Cottonwood Canyon, home to Alta and Snowbird ski resorts, Big Cottonwood Canyon is far less crowded, thus the name Solitude. We love the Inn at Solitude where we stay for the slope-side accommodations and friendly staff. The mountain has something for every skier. Don't miss the first tracks skiing on Sunday and Monday for Inn guests as well as the rescue dog demonstration on Saturday afternoon.

reviews.name: chervew
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is the prettiest canyon around Salt Lake City. The drive up to the top (Brighton Ski Area) gives great vistas around every turn of the twisty road up. The rock formations, streams, forests, and mountains are breathtaking. Don’t miss the chance to take this drive.

reviews.name: JRWarburton
reviews.title: Most beautiful of Salt Lake canyons
reviews.comment: There are a number of canyons out of the Salt Lake Valley. Parley's Canyon leads to Park City, Millcreek is great for hiking, but for sheer beauty Big Cottonwood is the most beautiful and has the best ski resorts in the winter.

reviews.name: Taiamac
reviews.title: LOVE to Run here
reviews.comment: The view is breathtaking! So much to look at and challenging trails in every direction. Every season has something different to offer.

reviews.name: 904bkel
reviews.title: Can't miss
reviews.comment: Anything in Big Cottonwood Canyon is great--the views, the resorts, you name it and it is there. Stunning drive up from the Salt Lake Valley.

reviews.name: rmorri235
reviews.title: purple mountains majesty and more
reviews.comment: from the valley down below to the 15,000 foot peaks,Big cottonwood canyon has something amazing for everyone.wheather it be mountain climbing, hiking,camping, hunting,fishing,rock hunting or just plain sightseeing,there are breathtaking sights around every corner.You might see deer or elk,mountain lions, black bears,mountain sheep,beavers marmots,moose,lizards, or trout. they can all be seen within minutes of a population in the millions! Check it out jusy fifteen minutes from salt lake city. Come discover our hidden treasure.

reviews.name: Jillian S
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: If you like hiking and being blown away by beauty then bring yourself here! This place is made to reconnect with yourself.

reviews.name: Kathy C
reviews.title: Incredible!
reviews.comment: Mesmerizing! So beautiful and serene. A great place to reconnect with nature and all it's beauty. Especially beautiful in the Spring when all the wildflowers are blooming. If you want to see wildlife plan your trip early in the morning or early evening.

reviews.name: DPaulsenD
reviews.title: Silver Lake Dream Lake
reviews.comment:
Silver Lake at the top of Big Cottonwood Canyon is a dream for all ages —a stroll around the lake for nature lovers and photographers.. It’s a beautiful meander in the spring, summer and fall, and a cross country dreamland in the winter on snow covered frozen ice. On the spring through fall hike, there are wildflowers, docks you can fish off, .and moose to photograph.
If you’d like a more rigorous trail that heads up and overlooksl the lake, take the transecting trail that heads upwards.
When you return to the parking lot, there are lavatories, a map and explanation of how the Mormon pioneers celebrated the 24th of July at the lake, and across the parking lot is a nice, woodsy shop with ice cream and other eatables, as well as great books on the flora and fauna of the region.
Of course if you still have energy, across the way is Brighton Ski Resort with many more lakes and trails.

reviews.name: mburbidge
reviews.title: Perfect day in paradise
reviews.comment: Take a hike in Big Cottonwood Canyon - many side trails or hit snowbird and you can hike up and take the tram back to the resort - it will take a little time so pack a lunch and water and wear good socks and shoes. It's great to take your lunch but plan to stay for dinner at one of the local restaurants, the steak pit, Mexican restaurant and many others located right in the resort.

reviews.name: Danielle H
reviews.title: Beautiful sights
reviews.comment: The Big Cottonwood Canyon has a lot to offer for all ages. If you are someone who Loves snow the resorts are great. Someone like myself I love the summer time up the canyon and there are a ton of hiking trails and waterfalls to get to. The canyon is perfect anyone to explore

reviews.name: Scott S
reviews.title: Love coming here - amazing
reviews.comment: Have been here a few times now while in Salt Lake. It is just so beautiful. Whether in the winter or summer. Trails are fun and vary from easy to more difficult. Or just drive through the canyon. Love it

reviews.name: beijoes
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This canyon is spectacular. There are so many different hikes of all levels! Brighton and solitude are both top resorts for skiing in the winter! Brighton is my personal favorite! In the spring and summer and fall the hiking is the best with all its brilliant colors! The mountain comes alive with nature!

reviews.name: randyt848
reviews.title: A piece of heaven.
reviews.comment: Just minutes from Salt Lake is an escape that is treasured by locals. Great Skiing at Brighton resort and Solitude. Weekdays are best as there is so much less traffic. Hiking is awesome off of Guardsman pass and then you can take the back roads into Park City during the summer months. I love it here!!

reviews.name: rcdmstarnet
reviews.title: Great Hikes and Snow Shoeing
reviews.comment: We just love Big Cottonwood Canyon. We visit there all year long... great hikes in Summer and Snow Shoeing in Winter. We have family picnics, by the river and have built great memories over the years. We just love the quick access to many different activities. Our favorite is the short hike around Sliver Lake with the grandkids.

reviews.name: utahsalmon
reviews.title: Fantastic Canyon
reviews.comment: Definitely one of the most beautiful and versatile canyons in the world. Rock climbing, skiing, touring, hiking, camping. Has it all!

reviews.name: Ray D
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: I grew up on Utah and I know of few places that have so much land diversity than Utah. 45 minutes from my house I can be in Big Cottonwood canyon. It is a beautiful place full of hiking trails and places to explore. It has great ski resorts and most of all, beautiful scenery. I go up there at least 4 times a year and more just to get away from the city below it. I recommend it as a great place for whatever kind of adventure you are into. The only reason give less stars is because of the areas you can’t go into because of private ownership.

reviews.name: MeganCollins06
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon is BEAUTIFUL!
reviews.comment: It was a beautiful drive! I wish we could have done more hiking. The kids enjoyed the snow. We would definitely go back. Note: the bathrooms are closed during the winter!

reviews.name: altaman55
reviews.title: Great spot for photos
reviews.comment: Hit the canyon in the afternoon for about an hour. All of the picnic areas were closed but if you are a geology buff or like rushing water, this is a must see!

reviews.name: loyalcustomer08080
reviews.title: awsome hike trails and ski resorts
reviews.comment: We got a pass to brighton and solitude, both great ski resorts. during the off ski season we love to hike donut falls, dog lake, lake blanche, to name a few. There's so much to do and we never run out of places to hike, no matter time of year.

reviews.name: DrKoob
reviews.title: Drop dead gorgeous in the fall
reviews.comment: We loved the gorgeous scenery. Drove out from downtown (around 40 minutes one way) and the fall foliage was amazing.

reviews.name: Lee S
reviews.title: Beautiful Mountain scenery
reviews.comment: I love Big Cottonwood Canyon for its beautiful mountain sidewalls, ski resorts and some good hikes. The Fall is particularly a great time to go.

reviews.name: Mike B
reviews.title: Georgeous Canyon
reviews.comment: The beauty of this canyon is year round. The spring is exciting, the summer, warm and inviting plus fall is filled with wonderful spectacular colers to present you with winter vistas, vast and marvelous winter experiences from slediing and tubing to the 'warmest snow on earth' for skying delights.

reviews.name: erica
reviews.title: Beautiful wilderness right by the city!
reviews.comment: This is one of my favorite places in Utah. It's a short drive from SLC, is easily accessible, and has something for everyone: day hikes; backpacking trails; short, flat trails even kids can do; fishing; snowsports in the winter.

reviews.name: Donna F
reviews.title: Mountains
reviews.comment: The Wasatch mountains boarder the east side of Salt Lake City. The little Cottonwood canyon is easily accessible. Breathe taking scenery. Two ski resorts. Many hiking trails to be hiked. Great day for a family picnic at Silver Lake at the end of the canyon.

reviews.name: Becki P
reviews.title: Year Round Beauty!
reviews.comment: I've hiked many trails up Big Cottonwood Canyon. One of my favorites is Donut Falls. It is a family friendly hike where a watefall flows into a cave at the end. It is even more spectacular in the winter when the waterfall freezes. It is a little more treacherous with ice and snow to contend with at the end but well worth it if you go prepared with proper gear. Young families often go sledding by the parking lot. Hiking and skiing are great! Something for everyone to enjoy! Year round fun and beauty!

reviews.name: LBHANS
reviews.title: Beautiful fall day
reviews.comment: A little chilly at first, but a beautiful day to wander through the canyon. No oppressive heat like you often find in the summer - snow covered peaks, quiet and relaxing.

reviews.name: MyFavoritesPlaces
reviews.title: Beautiful every time we go
reviews.comment:
Close enough and wonderful scenery. The drive is quite enjoyable and the hiking trails are wonderful.
Each time of the year brings a different beauty, but certainly fall is my favorite. Summer is a good choice too when temperature there is cooler than in the city.

reviews.name: R0semary66
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon and great Skiing.
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a wonderful place to visit in all seasons of the year. Great skiing and winter sports. Beautiful mountain flowers in the Spring. An escape from the heat in the summer with fun hikes. Colorful trees and shrubs in the Fall.

reviews.name: Chris H
reviews.title: Hiking
reviews.comment: Simply wow! The nature is breath taking, the hikes clearly signed, so you can’t get lost if you don’t want to.

reviews.name: cmrdan
reviews.title: Beautiul scenery, crazy drivers
reviews.comment: Would hate to drive this canyon during the winter if drivers were as crazy then as w hen we visited. Very tight curves, roadside parking, pedestrians, and crazy drivers made this a less than enjoyable trip. The scenery is wonderful, but you wonder if people actually take the time to enjoy it as fast as they drive.

reviews.name: ZekeMarsh
reviews.title: Fantastic for walk in the nature
reviews.comment: With plenty of hiking routes and it's wonderful sights, the Big Cottonwood Canyon is a must-visit if you are around in my opinion. It offers hikes from very beginner level to hiking veterans.

reviews.name: JimDeBerry
reviews.title: What a sight!!
reviews.comment: God's great gifts make this canyon amazing and unique. Looks like its straight out of a Disney Movie of Magic! Hike or Bike, sit and view

reviews.name: judithw886
reviews.title: Colors are amazing
reviews.comment: The granite cliffs and fall foliage with running streams makes this a perfect place to relax and take photos. Climbers, bikes, hikers and just strollers enjoy the elevations.

reviews.name: George N
reviews.title: Amazing landscapes
reviews.comment: We were traveling back from a disappointing stop at Snowbird when we saw the signs for the canyon. A quick turn up the mountain and we were amazed by the views. This is truly a beautiful place. There are places to park and hike, but we weren't dressed for the occasion. It was enough to drive up the road and stop for pictures. We hope to come back soon for more exploring.

reviews.name: Stacey654P
reviews.title: Fun/Beautiful
reviews.comment: It was a little chilly out, but my family and i had fun, it was beatiful, we also rented nearby so it made it easier to get there, the only inconvenience is how far out it is from downtown salt lake.

reviews.name: Y5350XSkathyc
reviews.title: Nice, Easy Scenic Mountainous Drive
reviews.comment: This is a nice easy mountain drive starting about 15 miles from downtown Salt Lake City. Very scenic with ski resorts at the upper end of the drive. We are from Florida and on September 20 saw snow on the ground, amazing.

reviews.name: Karin H
reviews.title: Fall Foliage & waterfalls
reviews.comment: Great place for nature photography. Outstanding fall foliage, waterfalls. Nice hiking trails and scenic views.

reviews.name: WanderingGrammy
reviews.title: Great Day in Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment:
After hearing about the great hiking near Silver Lake, my husband and I headed from Park City through amazing Guardsman Pass and down into the Big Cottonwood Canyon. We spend some time strolling around Silver Lake (sad to say, the visitor center was not open) and then decided to hike up to Lake Mary.
For those not in the know, there is parking for the Lake Mary hike right near the Brighton Ski Lift.
The hike was FABULOUS. It's not a long distance from trailhead to lake, but it is rather vertical. The lake itself is an alpine gem, with snow covered mountains in the back and wonderful views.
I should warn others that there was already ice on the trail in mid-October, some of it hidden by dirt. But if you watch your step (particularly on the way down), you'll find this a truly memorable hike!

reviews.name: the8js
reviews.title: Spectacular fall colors
reviews.comment: The vivid, bright fall leaves made an awesome background for family pictures. Gorgeous scenery throughout the whole mountain. Many, many hikes, picnic sites, lakes, ... everything and anything you can enjoy!

reviews.name: RipleyLake
reviews.title: Fall colors are great
reviews.comment: Great area to take pictures, fall and spring are most colorful. Good hiking trails and the scenary is outstanding

reviews.name: Liz Malay
reviews.title: Early Fall
reviews.comment: My husband and I went to Big Cottonwood Canyon for hiking. The weather was nice at the beginning, turned a little bit ugly because it was rained. However, nothing stopped us from hiking for awhile to see the beautiful trees and colorful leaves. As we hiked up, I can see the tall trees surround and oh the air was so fresh and clean. I loved it. I planned to collect some leaves but as it started pouring, so we went down. I took some pictures so I can share with you guys.

reviews.name: stu_uk
reviews.title: Beautiful drive and scenery
reviews.comment: This is such a lovely place to visit. The scenic drive is beautiful and we really enjoyed the walk around Silver Lake with it's scenery and wildlife.

reviews.name: JKD1313
reviews.title: Wow
reviews.comment: Wow is all I can say. We did a drive through the canyon on our way from SLC to Park City. Some areas are a little scary. Amazing!

reviews.name: Portland222
reviews.title: Early snow !
reviews.comment: Beautiful drive this time of year . There is a posted sign that says snow tires from Oct 1. We were driving a rental car which did not have snow tires. It was raining lightly but as we climbed higher, the temp dropped to 34 very quickly , & the rain turned to light snow. We had no problem, but just wanted to give a head’s up to tourists from other areas who are not used to driving in snow— check the forecast before you go, as the temp can drop quickly! The scenery is lovely w reds, golds, & greens.

reviews.name: Wayne K
reviews.title: Nice drive in the country
reviews.comment:
Easy drive through the canyon up to the ski fields.
Interesting countryside, it is a canyon after all (and quite narrow in parts).
Pretty colours in Autumn (Fall).

reviews.name: CalifDoug
reviews.title: Canyon Bonanza
reviews.comment:
You can do just about any canyon activity in Big Cottonwood. Beautiful and dramatic geology.
Right now (October) is the best time to view fall foliage. It is also not too late for a good hike--try Dog Lake up Butler's Fork and down Mill D north fork for a great half-day moderately strenuous one. Or Donut Falls for an easy hour. Or Cecret Lake for moderate.
July is best for wildflowers.
Of course, skiing in the winter!
Go most of the way up and then over Guardsman Pass into charming Midway and get some ice cream & cheese at Heber Valley Artisan Cheeses.

reviews.name: Tony d
reviews.title: Fall beauty
reviews.comment: We live amongst some of the most beautiful places I have seen. Our canyons are just amazing during the fall as they change their colors. Then, when winter comes, they are blanketed with the best snow on earth. Then in summer, there are thousands of trails to walk or bike. Just awesome!

reviews.name: PJ G
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: I like this canyon because of the variety of rock layers visible. It's a mild drive with a pretty creek near nice picnic areas. At the top are two ski resorts and the beginning of Guardsmen pass which will take you over the mountains to Park City.

reviews.name: rbonosconi
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: This beautiful canyon never disappoints! Many great vistas and opportunities to pull off the road and enjoy the view. A nice Sunday drive, or Saturday park and hike kind of place. I get up there as often as my schedule permits.

reviews.name: April W
reviews.title: Get away from the city
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a lovely place to get away from Salt Lake. Go and walk around Silver Lake. Silver Lake is wonderful in summer with wildflowers and in the fall when the aspens change color.

reviews.name: Debra E
reviews.title: I love this canyon
reviews.comment: Right above the Brighton Resort, you can hike to 4 lakes in a short amount of time. stunning views & scenery. I you want to see more, continue up & over to Little Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: Rodneyrogers
reviews.title: Many options to hike, camp or sight see!
reviews.comment: There is a short hike up to a waterfall that is great year round! If it is not snowbound in the winter, the frozen waterfall is incredible! Always a great hike in Fall with the beautiful colors!

reviews.name: SquirrelGirl39
reviews.title: Brighton Lakes Trail
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is beautiful. We chose to do the Brighton Lakes Trail and it was a great hike. I would have given 5 circles but I had read that the hike started at the Lodge instead of the Center and the sign for the hike was just placed against a tree. We followed a path for about fifteen minutes before we decided it wasn't right and we turned around. We did get to see a deer on that trail so it was worth it. On the correct trail, we saw a moose at Dog Lake and I had never seen one before, so this was definitely a highlight!

reviews.name: Kristine M
reviews.title: Great hiking!
reviews.comment: I have been up the canyon so many times since my children were little that I've lost count. It is one of my favorite places on Earth. Silver Lake to Lake Solitude is a perfect hike for me alone or with children. Donut Falls is also a mild hike. Lake Mary has to be one of the most beautiful lakes on this planet -- a deep blue that took some dedicated workers to build. You can still find the building implements left at the site. There's Dog Lake, Lake Blanche, and the Albion Trail if you want to cross over into Little Cottonwood Canyon. Even in the middle of summer, I frequently find snow patches so the temps are quite exhilarating.

reviews.name: Dave B
reviews.title: Great hikes and incredible views
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of my favorite places to go. A beautiful drive followed by a brisk walk, enjoying the views and the fresh air.

reviews.name: Adriana S
reviews.title: Quick Scenic Drive but OH SO beautiful!
reviews.comment: My husband and I didn't have enough time to check out all the amazing sights BCC has to offer but wow, what a drive! Just 15 minutes in and we were drooling over the sights. Pulled over for beautiful photos and made a promise to go back some day! Even if you can only swing by for a bit, do carve out some time--it's one of the most scenic drives we've ever done.

reviews.name: DBearNC
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: My wife and I drove down Big Cottonwood Canyon on our way from Provo to SLC. While we did not have time to do any hiking, we saw lots of trail heads along the way. The scenery got better as we went down the canyon. The road is in very good condition with lots of places to pull over and take photos.

reviews.name: Magnus
reviews.title: Lake Mary, Lake Martha & Lake Chatherine
reviews.comment: Wonderful trip in Big Cottonwood Canyon. A sunny day in September. What views and landscapes! Go there!

reviews.name: mothership1
reviews.title: Spectacular Rocky mountains at their best
reviews.comment: Take the time to stop at the Silver Lake visitors center and go for a hike. The views just don't stop.

reviews.name: carriejane777
reviews.title: Lake Blanche Mill B South Trail
reviews.comment: I think this was about nine miles round trip with a 2,800 ft elevation gain. There's a good amount of shade but it still was pretty hot, so I definitely recommend starting early and bringing lots of water. There's nothing challenging other than the really strenuous elevation gain. I was really sore for days! Make sure you don't go fast on your way down because the steepness murdered my legs.

reviews.name: ERFSU82
reviews.title: Scenic drive, beautiful vistas.
reviews.comment:
Less than 30 minutes from downtown SLC, the drive up the canyon makes for a nice escape to nature. The drive itself is beautiful, with amazing rock formations the first few miles, followed by wildflowers, waterfalls, and green meadows. There are many places along the way to pull over for better views and to get some great photos. There are some amazing hiking trails and some nice spots to simply sit, relax, and take in nature. The drive takes you to Solitude Resort, then to Brighton Resort, about two miles further up the road, where the canyon ends. During the summer, I highly recommend taking the drive up Guardsman's Pass, which is an incredibly scenic drive that takes you up to the backside of Jupiter Bowl at Park City, then down into the Deer Valley Resort area. At the top of the pass, there's a small dirt parking lot, where you can park and spend some time taking in the amazing views. If you want to stand at the top of Jupiter Bowl and look back over Park City, there is a small dirt road that curves up the hill across the street. It's about a 1/4 mile uphill walk, but it's relatively easy and you'll be rewarded with some terrific views.
If you're short on time, the drive up and back through Big Cottonwood Canyon will take less than two hours round trip from downtown SLC, assuming no stops along the way. If you have several hours, it's well worth making the Guardsman's Pass drive, then exploring Deer Valley and Park City before returning to SLC via I-80.

reviews.name: Barbara S
reviews.title: Beautiful, Short, Hike
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is an excellent place to spend a summer day, see fall leaves, ski during Utah's winter months or see spring wildflowers. The road is narrow in spots with a few tight bends, but it is well maintained and paved. I was in the canyon most recently to beat the heat with a short hike to Donut Falls on a hot summer day. The trail was crowded, as there were many people who had the same great idea, but it was still a lovely jaunt into wildflowers, meadows, and over a few rocks. There was plenty of wildlife to see despite the humans. The falls are pretty, but a little underwhelming, but in this case, it's about the journey as much as it is about the destination.

reviews.name: Mary K
reviews.title: The Drive down Big Cottonwood Canyon was Stunning.
reviews.comment: After visiting Park City for part of the day, we chose to drive Big cottonwood Canyon road back to the Salt Lake City Area. The switchbacks were fun and views were worth it.

reviews.name: turbotrevor
reviews.title: Amazing and Beautful and So Close to the City!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a beautiful drive that's worth it just to see. But it's also a cool way to get up to Park City that's a little more interesting than the highway. There are a few great hikes right off the road, especially Doughnut Falls. Love this place!

reviews.name: jblackeagle555
reviews.title: Amazing hiking
reviews.comment: Beautiful views! Great place to spend time hiking and enjoying the outdoors! Very relaxing. Fun for the whole family or just to get away by yourself. Nice for a romantic walk!

reviews.name: Seafolly
reviews.title: Glorious views and wildflowers
reviews.comment: Took a late afternoon hike here and was a good 10 degrees (celcius) difference to down town. Abundance of wildflowers and views all around. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: erocker73
reviews.title: Best hiking ever!
reviews.comment: My wife and I have 2️ boys. A 4 year old and a 1 year old. I work retail, so I'm always busy. But on my days off, we always go hiking. Big cottonwood in general is our go to place for a variety of hikes. Mellow for the kids, beautiful scenery and plenty of waterfalls to cool off in. We love it!

reviews.name: Linda095
reviews.title: A must visit if you are in the area!
reviews.comment: Spent a fabulous couple of days in Big Cottonwood Canyon. Trails are easily marked and even the up hill trails were worth the views :)

reviews.name: Bryon M
reviews.title: My beautiful gem
reviews.comment: I have been visiting this canyon for the past 45 years. It has been a quick get away and a means of reconnecting with the beauty of nature. It has some of the best hiking trails, camping, fishing, skiing and dining anywhere in the world. Unfortunately as the Salt Lake Valley swells in population, so do the canyons. Please respect this fragile ecosystem and leave no trace. Make it a place our families will enjoy for the next thousand years.

reviews.name: Ken J
reviews.title: Great getaway to the Spruce Camp Ground
reviews.comment:
Every year we rent you the camp ground for a dinner event that feeds 150 people.
We love the area
Very photogenic and awe inspiring

reviews.name: SECYANKEE
reviews.title: Big, Beautiful, and Accesible
reviews.comment: It's the fastest, easiest to access canyon in the valley. The ski resorts are only about 20 minutes up the mountain and there is plenty of hiking in the summer. Winter, unless it's snowing hard, is also accessible, but recommend 4X4.

reviews.name: SunDancer1
reviews.title: Must see while visiting Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: It's hard to believe this tranquil canyon is only minutes away from a major city! The scenery is beautiful and there are many things for every member of your family to do. Hiking, biking, fishing, climbing, camping. The wildflowers are beautiful in the summer, the leaves breathtaking in the summer, and the skiing phenomenal in the winter. Don't miss it!

reviews.name: wendybird5
reviews.title: So many trails so little time!
reviews.comment: Hiking trails galore. Fields of flowers clear until august! You can't go wrong pulling over to one of the many trail heads up Big Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: AM7D
reviews.title: Beautiful drive and lovely canyon.
reviews.comment: I love Big Cottonwood Canyon. The drive is beautiful, especially in the fall. Nice walking trails and yummy restaurants close by.

reviews.name: Forest W
reviews.title: Awesome Vistas
reviews.comment: If you can keep your eyes on the road this is a great drive. Careful there are tons of vehicles parked on the side of the road where they have off loaded for hikers. There are several pullouts where you can take photos.

reviews.name: Polina K
reviews.title: Lots of choices of outdoor activities - beautiful!
reviews.comment: Beautiful drive up with many stops full of hikes, bike trails, climbing spots, and disc golf course at Solitude. One of the local favorites!

reviews.name: Desistarr
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery
reviews.comment: We were able to witness the most breath-taking double rainbow in this canyon. Excellent views with plenty of wildlife.

reviews.name: dyerta
reviews.title: Nice day trip from Salt Lake City.
reviews.comment: It was a nice day drive through the canyon with a number of places to stop for short or longer hikes. One hint: being from Maine we started at sea level and noticed some fatigue trying to hike at over 8000 feet the next day.

reviews.name: Kevin P
reviews.title: Lot's of hard climbing in this place!
reviews.comment:
Which is a shame really as there seemed so much to do here. Not really for the average climber, the routes are way too hard, and the gradings seem to be off by about 2 grades compared to elsewhere (a 5.7 feels like a 5.9). As the median grade here is about a 5.11b, you will get crowded out in the weekends as there aren't relatively that many easier climbs here.
The climbs are on quartzite, a type of metamorphasised sandstone, which normally is quite strong (see the Arapiles in Australia). However this place seemed to have a lot of loose rock, and it was hard to place nuts/stoppers. So you need quite a big rack of cams to climb here (20?). Having said that, the quartzite here is an excellent challenge for those who want to be a truly international climber, but seems to be stuck on granite which dominates 70% of USA crags. It can have a slippery surface, and it will take a while to read where the holds are!
The routes are typically 1-3 pitches long so not a big day out/adventure. And you need to start early so you don't get caught by summer afternoon thunderstorms.
Good luck :)

reviews.name: HoleySneakers
reviews.title: Stunning Views Within Minutes of Salt Lake
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of the two canyons that end at the Salt Lake area's famous Wasatch mountain ski resorts (Little Cottonwood Canyon is the other). In the summer, they are stunning scenic drives that provide access to many hiking trails. In my opinion Big Cottonwood Canyon is the more dramatic of the two, and if you're only going to explore one of them, I say choose this one. Not only is the scenery awe-inspiring, but the drive ends in a loop through the tiny but picturesque ski resort town of Brighton. In Brighton, you can stop at the cafe and relax and enjoy the view of the mountain amphitheater that surrounds the town. Important note: there are no dogs allowed in the canyon at all (for protection of the watershed).

reviews.name: hflores2
reviews.title: Great views, hiking trails and lots of hawks
reviews.comment: Leaving Park City with extra time before a late afternoon flight home, we took Guardsman Pass through to Big Cottonwood Canyon road as an alternative route to Salt Lake. The vistas along this route are fantastic, and there are several trailheads along the way if you have time for a hike. In one spot, we counted 20 hawks flying over a meadow and enjoying the mountain breeze - gliding up, diving at high speed and racing by us - that was a treat. I will use this as a slower but much more beautiful route to/from Park City (season permitting - parts of this route are closed during snow season).

reviews.name: dgbg100106
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive and Lots of Trails
reviews.comment: Lots of hiking trails for all skill levels and endless sights. It will take longer then you think to go all the way in and out of the Canyon, but well worth your time.

reviews.name: Stephen W
reviews.title: Drive and hike in Big Cottonwood
reviews.comment: Great area, with obvious elevation for a scenic drive. Best to pull off at one of the available trailheads and take a hike into the mountainside trails. All have restrooms and designated parking areas. Most hikes have a lake at the end or spectacular views along the way. Trees, creeks, rocks, vegetation, and wildlife guaranteed. All of this is 30 minutes or less from downtown SLC.

reviews.name: 834bettye
reviews.title: No Pets
reviews.comment: Since we grew up in Salt Lake, we were anxious to show our grandson the beautiful canyons around Salt Lake City. We we've turned away by signs stating no dogs in campsites. We had our golden retriever along, so couldn't share the canyons with our grandson. I still don't understand!

reviews.name: satish r
reviews.title: Casual
reviews.comment: Big cottonwood canyon ride is wonderful. The ride will take you to Park City through Guardsman pass. Especially wonderful experience during the fall season.

reviews.name: tbacus
reviews.title: An Easy Drive to Natural Beauty
reviews.comment: Just driving up BCC will give you a great view of the Wasatch mountains. Stop at one of the numerous trailheads right off the road and wander up to great views and alpine lakes. In the winter, BCC is the home to Brighton and Solitude ski resorts

reviews.name: Carey H
reviews.title: A prime example of why I moved to Utah
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon has it ALMOST all: Wonderful ski resorts (Brighton and my favorite Solitude), breathtaking scenery, easy to difficult hiking trails, inexpensive and quaint campgrounds and more. HOWEVER, and this is a big drawback, canines aren't allowed up there because it is a watershed and the waste presents a problem. Now, I am arguably one of the biggest dog lovers on Earth, so when I want to take my Australian Kelpie hiking, I avoid this canyon and the potentially hundreds of dollars in fines I might face if caught with Lyla up there. So, instead I tend to go to nearby Millcreek Canyon. I LOVE the atmosphere and terrain at Solitude Resort and the group of characters, called the FOGS (check for the group's Facebook Page) who congregate and tailgate there mostly on Sundays and Wednesdays. It has changed a bit since it was bought by Deer Valley Resort in 2015. But it's still got the least crowded lines and coolest patrons and staff in my opinion. So if you want to hike or camp there, leave Fido at home (bummer, I spend as much time with my dog as I can, and aside from skiing up there I don't go very often). Oh, and the nordic skiing is excellent there too and snowshoeing.

reviews.name: Mizwidget
reviews.title: Great Hiking Locations
reviews.comment:
There are many hiking trail heads along this canyon, with hikes of varying lengths and degrees of difficulty. This is a good reference book to help you decide where to go and what to see--"60 Hikes Within 60 Miles: Salt Lake City: Including Ogden, Provo, and the Uintas, 2012
by Greg Witt

reviews.name: Bonita A
reviews.title: Beautiful Year Round
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon hosts the beautiful Solitude and Brighton Ski Resorts. In addition, the canyon has great hiking, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing. One of my favorite hikes is to park near The Pines and hike to Donut Falls. It is an easy hike at any time of the year. In the winter, the fall comes down the mountain under the snow at the end of the roughly 2.0 mile hike through the woods (on marked trails). Visitors climb up a somewhat steep, but short canyon wall and then slide down into a cave that opens into a large cavern. The waterfall flows through a hole in the ceiling. Rimmed in ice, it is absolutely stunning. To get down from the cave, most people sit down and slide on their ski pants or even haul up sleds and use them. This is a very popular spot for families. The views are great in winter and summer.

reviews.name: dmattrobinson
reviews.title: Beautiful Vistas
reviews.comment: We are in the area for a conference, but took advantage of the breathtaking views and scenery nearby. I cannot wait to come back for further exploring in the area.

reviews.name: ana1210
reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment: We just went through here on our way to locate a waterfall for our daughter, but we had to stop and hike a little it was SO beautiful. Very pretty area will be back one day to hike some of the MANY trails they have.

reviews.name: Jenna L
reviews.title: Great Way to Spend the Day
reviews.comment: We went right here after our flight from Chicago to kill some time before heading to Yellowstone the next day. What a beautiful canyon! We enjoyed driving through and seeing all of the amazing scenery. We then went on a hike to Lake Blanche and throughly enjoyed it. Spending time here made us put Utah on our list for an upcoming vacation spot!

reviews.name: seliyakim
reviews.title: The ride to the tram as well as the tram ride were very nice
reviews.comment: I purchased the tour from Viator and since I was not told that the cost fee for the tram was not included I got a refund for that service. I wish to let all you know that I did not see any special wild fauna as listed in the tour but some friendly rodents at the top station. The bread served with the soup at the restaurant is very tasty.

reviews.name: Fencin
reviews.title: Lovely views Lots to see
reviews.comment:
In town for USA Fencing's National Championship, my visit to the canyon was enjoyable!
Driving up to the canyon takes you ~8000' above the valley floor and the temperature drops 30 degrees. Our visit was during July so the temperature difference was wonderful!
We saw rock climbers, bicyclists and hikers along the way. Beautiful cliffs and overlooks.
Don't miss the walking tour of Silver Lake at the top of the mountain. A ski resort in winter, the area around the lake in covered in wildflowers in the summer
Restful and beautiful!

reviews.name: Angela_Wollongong
reviews.title: A nice drive
reviews.comment: This is a really scenic drive if you have some time in Salt Lake City. There are lots of hiking trails with parking area. It does get very busy on the weekends.

reviews.name: snorkelingfan46
reviews.title: Cool Locale for a Hot-Day Hike
reviews.comment: With the temps hovering at about 100 in SLC, we drove up to Big Cottonwood Canyon where we were rewarded with a sunny day in the low 80's. We hiked to Blood Lake for a swim in the refreshing (but chilly) waters. For the adventerous, there is a rope swing, but be prepared to wait your turn. The trail up and back is a moderate climb with only a couple of places steep enough to make you consider where best to plant your feet. Ideal footwear is anything with some tread. Wildflowers are near peak there now, though not quiet as many as Little Cottonwood Canyon... nonetheless, and rewarding hike.

reviews.name: AZnanix4
reviews.title: WOW!! Spectacular scenery, fun hike
reviews.comment: Fabulous drive/hike through the forest, with the rushing creek right beside us. Picnic areas, hiking trails for everyone from beginners to experts, rock climbing, all within a few minutes of Salt Lake City. My daughter and I visited with her daughters, ages 5 & 7, who had never hiked much before. We enjoyed hiking the Lake Blanche trail (not all the way up) and watching/hearing the small waterfalls and rapids in the creek. Beautiful way to spend the day, and lots of opportunities for picnicking too. Limited parking...I imagine it's packed on weekends. Very accessible with paved roads all the way, and easy to find from Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: Kristin H
reviews.title: Oh. My. GOODNESS.
reviews.comment: If you are in Salt Lake City or the surrounding area, do yourself a favor and go visit Big Cottonwood Canyon. Don't let the distance from the city intimidate you, it's just an Uber ride away. We were dropped off at Mill Trailhead D, which takes you on a gorgeous hike along a clear mountain stream. Follow the (uphill, rocky) path and keep to the left, and you'll make it all the way to Donut Falls. The natural beauty here cannot be described in words. Definitely, put this on your "to see" list!

reviews.name: KeeponPedaling
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: It is one of the most scenic roads in the world. Often closed in the winter. We drove over the mountain to and from Park City. Don't go with a camera.

reviews.name: svjpac
reviews.title: Stunning canyon with a variety of outdoor adventures await
reviews.comment: Multiple levels of hiking trails are available. Both family and experts can find something to stay busy doing. Fishing, Rock climbing, skiing, snowboarding... the list is long. Just remember that it has been discovered so start early to get any parking

reviews.name: Hannahbears_mom
reviews.title: Fabulous Drive!
reviews.comment: Couldn't get enough of the beautiful scenery! Such a beautiful sight to behold - we went early in the morning and it wasn't crowded at all. I'd love to do it again!

reviews.name: spellotape
reviews.title: Totally worth the drive, beautiful!
reviews.comment: There are multiple trail entrances to the lake - loved walking around the lake here. Went in the summer so was lucky to have reached there by 11am when the sun was not as strong plus most of the trail has tall trees around it. Many families visit this place and some even brought their picnic basket!

reviews.name: Hazzkodiak
reviews.title: Worthwhile Drive
reviews.comment: We went for a drive through Cottonwood Canyon early on a Saturday. There were a ton of runners and bikers coming down the mountain! That was great to see but just make sure to take it slow when driving as there are quite a few blind corners. The scenery was beautiful and the temperature change, about 20 degrees, was great on a 100 degree day is Salt Lake. Would like to go back when we have more time.

reviews.name: dcpixier
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Wonderful drive from the city. Breathtaking views of the mountains and lakes. A must for hikers and nature lovers!

reviews.name: e s
reviews.title: DON'T MISS this canyon if you are in Salt Lake City !!
reviews.comment: This canyon is SPECTACULAR for hiking, walking, strolling, camping, fishing, eating, taking pictures, or just having a picnic!!

reviews.name: TessaPN
reviews.title: Beautiful trail and water fall
reviews.comment: There are trails to go up to the top and you can see water fall it is beautiful. Depending on what date of the week you go there are a lot of people there.

reviews.name: Peter K
reviews.title: Utah's beautiful mountains
reviews.comment: Big Cotton Wood Canyon is beautiful in every season. Skiing is great at Brighton especially great night skiing. Hike during the summers are a wonderful experience. I highly recommend a summer hike or a winter skiing trip up there.

reviews.name: Rich L
reviews.title: Awesome snow, great hiking
reviews.comment: Winter, spring, summer or fall Big C is our go to canyon when we need a mountain fix. Highlights: Brighton, Solitude, Silver fork restaurant, middle D north fork hike, grizzly gulch hike, silver fork lake, Lake Mary's hike, Wasatch crest mountain bike trail, doughnut falls hike and guardsman's pass drive.

reviews.name: John G
reviews.title: Breathtaking vistas only minutes from downtown Salt Lake City.
reviews.comment: The reason our family moved here was for the proximity to some of this country's most breathtaking scenery. Big Cottonwood Canyon is only a few minutes from downtown and is absolutely stunning in any season.

reviews.name: 2travel4now
reviews.title: Beautiful Mountains
reviews.comment: The canyons of the Utah front are beautiful. Coll summer, great skiing in winter. They are within 30 minutes of downtown. Wonderful drive. Don't miss this one.

reviews.name: olliedawg
reviews.title: Wow -- this is some kinda country
reviews.comment: You can keep Park City and Salt Lake City. We'll take Big Cottonwood Canyon and everything about it. Just beautiful.

reviews.name: Marlynne P
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: This canyon is close to Salt Lake City and an easy drive. There are some nice hikes and good food up at Solitude, if you wanted a nice lunch.

reviews.name: Ray H
reviews.title: Worth the Drive
reviews.comment: A beautiful drive up the canyon. Only 30-40 minutes from downtown Salt Lake City. We were there in July but one lift was open at Solitude Ski Resort along with their Honeycomb Grill. So, we rode the lift to the top of the mountain and back, then had a great lunch with wine at the Grill. Leisurely day with a good stop and GREAT secenery.

reviews.name: Stephanie H
reviews.title: Incredible!
reviews.comment: I love this canyon and its beauty. At the very top of soldier summit is a great short little hike to bloods lake, I especially love driving in the canyon and doing hikes in the fall with the leaves.

reviews.name: Carol C
reviews.title: Beautiful and great hiking trails
reviews.comment: We love this place! Lots of trails for various abilities. Parking can be a challenge at the trailheads. At the top of the canyon, a walk around Silver Lake is easy, short and pleasant. You can take a trail into the mountains off the trail that circles Silver Lake.

reviews.name: MattIowa
reviews.title: Great drive, found a couple cool hikes
reviews.comment: Highly recommend a trip to the canyon, the drive is very nice. Two recommended hikes. Donut Falls. Spectacular waterfall if you reach the top of it. It's a moderate hike. Kids can make it to the base. Adults can climb some rock to get to the best spot to see it. Great easy hike around Silver Lake in Brighton, perfect for kids with a large percentage of it done on a boardwalk.

reviews.name: Parissa A
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Hands down my favorite canyon to be in. I love hiking, snowboarding and riding my motorcycle up this canyon.

reviews.name: Cam P
reviews.title: What's not to love?
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon has many attractions for all kinds of people. Get in the outdoors, go for a drive, have a nice hike, look at the excellent scenery, go skiing in the winter....plenty to do!

reviews.name: mini
reviews.title: Beautiful Views, Nice Hikes; Nice Drive Through Big Cottonwood Canyon, Utah
reviews.comment:
We enjoyed visiting and hiking in Big Cottonwood Canyon over Fourth of July weekend 2017.
There was still snow on the mountain tops.
We enjoyed our drive through very scenic Big Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: tropicalvikingspete
reviews.title: Amazing, but...
reviews.comment: Amazing hike, about 4.5 miles up and 4.5 down. We were told 3 miles by a couple that looked like professional hikers. It's NOT! 2/2.5 hours to get up and 1.5 hours back. We're not avid hikers but I would highly recommend to come prepared. 2 litters of water per person, hiking shoes, hat and sunglasses a must. Mosquitos near the lake and at dusk. Parking is easy, just drive up until you see Mill B South trail and park. I'll be back to Utah for another great hike!

reviews.name: D S
reviews.title: Beautiful Escape from the City
reviews.comment: Not just a winter ski get away. The Spruces Campground is a cool pine tree oasis with crystal clear Big Cottonwood Creek flowing through. We also love attending the Brighton Branch for church on Sundays - the only LDS chapel I know of that has view windows inside the chapel (that face the impressive mountains).

reviews.name: Mitch M
reviews.title: Beautiful area!
reviews.comment: Had some time to kill in the area when I came out for a job interview and this scenic byway blew me away! You could hike for weeks here and still not do the same one. Even without the hikes, you still get the beautiful views.!

reviews.name: AllSpin
reviews.title: One of the nicest drives in SLC
reviews.comment: This is our 2nd time in SLC. Took the drive through the canyon up to Solitude Mountain.
