Stunning views, lots of narrow switchbacks though, so if you're not comfortable (or don't have a good, stable vehicle) don't attempt the off road part. One of the most scenic and relaxing drives. Take one or more of the hikes off the drive, or just put on some bluegrass and relax!

reviews.name: Kalisa J
reviews.title: Huge variety of activities
reviews.comment: I like to hike up the canyon. I could spend all summer and not go on the same hike twice, so that is cool.

reviews.name: 259Nancy_
reviews.title: Stunningly Beautiful
reviews.comment: What a drive! Just a short distance out of Salt Lake City, and what views and scenery, from huge rock formations, to spruce forests, to the beautiful flow of the creek. I traveled in June, and there was still plenty of snow to be seen. It is a paradise for photography. My time was limited but there are lots of opportunities for hikers, bikers, and climbers.

reviews.name: jdlakeshore
reviews.title: Take a drive in the mount
reviews.comment: We spent one of our days in Salt Lake City driving in the mountains, going to both Big and little Cottonwood Canyons. The scenery is beautiful and it's definitely worth the time. It was in the low 100's in SLC when we were there and it was much cooler up in the mountains. Be sure to go to Snowbird Ski Resort and ride the tram up to the top (11,000 feet) - views are amazing.

reviews.name: Mayur M
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment:
I am staying at a hotel in "Park City" and the client is in SLC downtown. 30 minute commute is not bad for me as I love the “ME” time while I drive to-and-fro from work.
One evening from work, I took the scenic route to Park City via Big Cottonwood Canyon, passing through Solitude, Brighton Ski Resorts and up the Guardsman Pass. The ski resorts are closed but yet there was just enough snow on Monday, June 12 to take some good photos and feel the 35+ wind in your face.
The total distance was about 47 miles and took 2 hours including stops to take photos. I am planning to do once more in July to see how the peaks look without the snow this time.
Did not come across any wild-life on my first trip and I was lucky that the pass was just opened in the first week of June.

reviews.name: Wendy K
reviews.title: Nice drive
reviews.comment: It is a beautiful scenic drive. You see all different kinds of rock formation. What I found great was that there was still snow on some of the mountains. We also drive through little cotton wood on the way to Salt Lake City. You get the mountains on one side and city on the other. It was majestic.

reviews.name: cctraveller77
reviews.title: Very, very crowded.
reviews.comment: This place is so popular on the weekend, that the hiking part is not a quiet nature experience. We did find a little enclave with more quiet and solitude, though.

reviews.name: justkeepingtabs
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon and Silver Lake
reviews.comment: A few friends and I were in Salt Lake City over Memorial Day Weekend and we took a quick trip (~45 min to Big Cottongwood Canyon and another ~45 min to Silver Lake) to Big Cottonwood Canyon where you can see gorgeous mountains as well as Silver Lake which was still covered with snow at the end of May. Both were gorgeous and it was nice to see the great nature away from the city.

reviews.name: Jane33Kent_England
reviews.title: Awesome scenery
reviews.comment:
We drove the Big Cottonwood Canyon scenic drive and the scenery was amazing. We saw lots of animals and the snow still on the mountains.
Would definitely recommend.
Easy to find from downtown Salt Lake City

reviews.name: Michael J
reviews.title: Come for the outdoors, stay for the views
reviews.comment:
It seems a little weird reviewing a canyon, rather than a business of establishment, but this canyon is worth it. We went on a week day evening last month, and had a fantastic time.
It has been an odd spring this year, with lots of snow and lower temperatures, and then heating up fairly quickly. As a result, the stream is running very high. We stopped just below Storm Mountain and did some exploring, and it was amazing to see the power and beauty of the river cascading down the canyon. Further up, by the "S-curve" we got out to see the waterfalls, but didn't have time to hike to Lake Blanche (one of our favorites) this trip. We continued up the canyon to Brighton and saw a moose by Silver Lake, and were planning on going up over Guardsman Pass to Park City, but it was still closed off and had several feet of snow on the road. Can't wait until a little more melts so we can get through. Will definitely be back through the summer and fall to hike Lake Catherine, Mary and Martha as they are a great couple of hour hike.

reviews.name: Docmartin52
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery any time of year
reviews.comment: Spectacular vistas, best to visit in summer, as the ski traffic will not allow you to meander in the winter. The air is fresh and clean, and the resorts up the canyon offer the opportunity to eat well and soak up the ambience.

reviews.name: tbird62_12
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: We drove through on our way from Park City to Salt Lake. We needed to kill time before our flight. We weren't prepared to hike but were able to take an easy hike. We noticed a lot of cars parked on the side of the road and decided to stop. We took a trail which had a strong stream running along it.

reviews.name: dianaelms
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Big and Little Cottonwood Canyons never fail to capture my heart and to make my spirit sing! Utah's canyons are each beautiful in their own special and unique way throughout each season of the year :-)

reviews.name: Demeter33
reviews.title: Beautiful landscape
reviews.comment: Half an hour driving from SLC and it pays off. Beautiful landscape, scenic road, fresh air, easy to park.

reviews.name: flemingmaf
reviews.title: Great escape from the city
reviews.comment: I drove though the canyon, though did not have much time for hiking. I stopped at a few places for short hikes. Clearly one could spend a lot of time here! The area is very scenic and peaceful. Next time I will allocate more time!

reviews.name: lyngraz
reviews.title: Hidden Gem
reviews.comment: Even after visiting Yellow Stone & Grand Tetons, Big Cottonwood Canyon was just gorgeous and we wished we'd had more time to see more of it.

reviews.name: boktasofplainville
reviews.title: Beautiful scenic drive
reviews.comment:
Leaving Park City we wanted to take this drice back to SLC but the road from Park City was closed for the winter. We had some free time before our flight so we took the road from the SLC ride.
Beautiful scenery with pull off spots for hiking, picnicing and picture taking. We drove almost to the top past the ski resorts. Beautiful drive with a river running down canyon. Nice place to stop and look for treasures in the river bed.

reviews.name: drdoug3930
reviews.title: GREAT OUTDOORS
reviews.comment: Great for year round outdoor activity. The canyon has many hiking trails that can be accessed from spring through fall. In winter their are 2 ski resorts, Brighton and Solitude with many runs for all levels of skiing on the "Greatest Snow on Earth". It is also within 30 min. of Salt Lake Int airport.

reviews.name: Louise K
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery
reviews.comment: Only having ever seen mountains on the East Coast, I was in amazement at the size and grandeur of the scenery in Big Cottonwood Canyon. Just Beautiful.

reviews.name: Tim P
reviews.title: Beautiful.
reviews.comment: Lovely drive with some interesting hikes.There was still snow when we reached Brighton.Well worth the trip.

reviews.name: Juvina2028
reviews.title: Very Scenic Place
reviews.comment: We just dove by the Big Cottonwood Canyon, before heading the the airport and it was very scenic and majestic - a good drive around, and close to the airport, so thats why we chose to do it then, before returning our rented car at the airport.

reviews.name: Primexchange
reviews.title: Adventure Awaits You
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is well known for Outdoor Recreation with an abundance of Backcountry Skiing in the Winter and Hiking in the Summer. It is also home to Brighton and Solitude Ski Resorts. Known as BCC to the locals it has a rich Mining History as well. Bus Service is available during Ski Season and Lodging is very limited.
For those who are driving from downtown Salt Lake City, it is about 16 miles to the mouth of the Canyon; it is another 16 miles to Brighton. About 13 miles up, you will approach a Cabin Community where lunch and dinner is available at the Silver Fork Lodge. A few miles further, you will see the main entrance to Solitude Ski Resort. Further on, you will see a village of private condominiums.
As you pass the Fire Station, you will be entering another Cabin Community, Brighton. On Brighton Loop Road, you will first see the Solitude Nordic Center. Once the snow melts, there is a popular boardwalk around Silver Lake also accessed at the Center. If you continue on the Loop, you will see Brighton Ski Resort. In the summer, there are several lakes that make for great destinations for hikers. Lake Mary tends to be the better choice for families. Mt. Wolverine and Sunset Peak are reserved for the more ambitious.
As you begin your descent down the Canyon, there is one additional road worth a look, Guardsman's Pass. It is closed for winter but is usually accessible Memorial Day through Labor Day. At the pass you can look into the Heber Valley and if you choose proceed over the pass; use caution as the grade is steep and although rare, some vehicles have driven over the side. This route is quite scenic and does take some time, but eventually you'll reach Deer Valley and Park City (stay left), or Midway and Heber (stay right).
If you continue back down BCC, take note that Mining for Silver and Gold was quite active during the late 1800's; a good eye will be able to spot some of the mine entrances. While many of these entrances are closed or collapsed, it is not advised to venture inside as there is the potential risk of injury and death. If hiking, you will often find remnants, such as tailings, structures and equipment. One other historic structure of interest is the Utah Power Stairs Plant, which is still in use to date.
While skiing is the rave during the winter, Hiking is the bomb during the summer. Popular hikes include, Doughnut Falls, Dog Lake and Lake Blanche, where you will gaze at Sundial Peak. Aside from Delicate Arch, Moab... Sundial Peak is the second most featured photograph for the State of Utah. Due to its popularity, this trail can be quite crowded and parking hard to find if you get a late start to your day. Rock Climbing on quartzite slabs is also quite popular in the Storm Mountain area.
Whether you are a Powder Hound in the winter or a Rock Hound in the summer, Adventure Awaits you in Big Cottonwood Canyon, where there is something for everyone. From a fantasy of fall colored leaves in September to the cold smoke powder in January, you won’t be disappointed. In July, you may be fortunate to see an array of wildflowers about the meadows; beware of Moose, they can be very aggressive. And if you are really adventurous, consider Mt. Superior along the Cottonwood Ridge or the Broad Fork Twins, breathtaking summits that exceed 11,000 feet in elevation.
There is more than meets the eye, so plan ahead. There are numerous publications describing the hiking routes and official websites for both resorts. The Canyon is well patrolled, so watch your speed and passing zones; there is also a volunteer Search and Rescue Team. Please Stay Safe and Enjoy Responsibly!!!

reviews.name: Mykin H
reviews.title: One of the most beautiful canyons!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of the most beautiful canyons in Utah. Visit in Spring, Summer or the Fall to see breathtaking views and beautiful colors. Plenty of hikes, awesome ski resorts in the winter (our whole family LOVES Brighton) and even a great canyon for a marathon (in September).

reviews.name: Aaron P
reviews.title: Amazing hikes and views.
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is an amazing place for all seasons. Winter is great for skiing at a resort (Brighton or Solitude) or back country. In the spring and summer great beutahful hiking to lakes or peaks. Good opportunities to see Utah wildlife (deer and moose). Fall get up and check the fall colors as the leaves change.
Located 10 miles from downtown SLC it is easy for a quick afternoon drive or hike. The hikes range from easy to difficult so you can find something at your ability level.
You will not regret getting up into this canyon.

reviews.name: Michael G
reviews.title: Amazing Canyon - so much to do in the Summertime
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is incredible. The top places to visit include:
1) Silver Lake - This is lake at the base of Brighton Ski Resort. It the summer it is stocked with Trout and is great for fishing. I fish from the shore using Jake's spinner's and always catch fish. The lake is shallow and tends to get lots of growth as the Summer get's later. You can bring a float tube, canoe or small boat and fish from the middle. There is a mile trail walking around the lake that is beautiful and very easy (my 78 year old mother enjoyed this walk).
2) Spruces Campground - This is located ~ 2/3 up the canyon. It is a Federal Camp Ground and books up early, however they have campsites that can be reserved only by walk up so even if the website says it's full if you go early in the morning you can almost always get a campsite. These campsites are well taken care of with access to bathrooms and some of hookups. It is a great campground with full shade and very mature trees.
3) Guardsman Pass - This is located at the top of Big Cottonwood canyon. Take the turnoff just before Brighton Ski Resort. This road takes you to the top of the mountain and down into Park City or down into Midway/Heber. This is a gorgeous drive in the fall. On Holidays it gets very crowded and there is much room on the road and people park on the side and there are cars coming up and going down. Just be patient and you'll be fine (or go on a weekday and there won't be any traffic).
4) Solitude Disc Golfing - Solitude has a great disc golf course. You can ride the lift or just hike (I've always hiked and it's a good little hike). The holes are well marked. Be careful to keep an eye on your discs as they can be lost in the woods and grass very easily. You'll see moose and all kinds of birds on this course. Excellent!
5) At the base of Solitude there is a little Pizza Place that serves the best pizza! I only get it when we are camping or playing disc golf because it's quite the drive to the top of the mountain...but the pizza is well worth it.
There are lots of other hikes up Big Cottonwood Canyon and Storm Mountain is a great place for a picnic.
Big Cottonwood Canyon is the Canyon to play in for SLC.

reviews.name: David L
reviews.title: Home away from home
reviews.comment:
I have spent many seasons in this beautiful canyon. As a child I lived with grandparents here. As an adult, I have skiied, hiked, and camped here. This canyon has the beauty of the Swiss Alps. It is very comfortable, with rental condos, camp grounds, and some homes that can be rented.
Even with 6-8 feet of snow some of us live here year round.

reviews.name: Jonathan N
reviews.title: Great hike here with my wife and grandparents!
reviews.comment: A beautiful place to hike and see Moose! Safe trails and abundant wildlife! We will definitely go back.

reviews.name: SFCole
reviews.title: Snow Research for May Visits
reviews.comment:
I went hiking further south in another canyon and after lunch decided to visit Silver Lake on a whim with the intention of hiking to the other lakes nearby.
Before I made my way I checked the road conditions and it was open so assumed the trail was open also. When arriving at Silver Lake there was still snow cover for which I wasn't equipped to hike upon. Oh, well. This was a 8 May visit and signs along the canyon road indicate that snow can be an issue up to mid-May.
I do recommend this place but in early May try to find out about remaining snow cover and don't go on a Sunday afternoon as most of the parking at the various trail heads, etc. fill up quick.

reviews.name: Olga
reviews.title: Choose for yourself!
reviews.comment: We drove on this road just to see how it looks and for photography. It was OK. If you plan to hike, bicycle or ski - then it would be totally different story! It is very nice place for the local people to spend day or two or even the week of vacation. But just for a drive? I wouldn't go back.

reviews.name: Caleb J
reviews.title: Beautiful and Enjoyable
reviews.comment: This canyon is beautiful. I enjoyed my visit. Lot of things to do. The scenery is beautiful. Great hiking place as well.

reviews.name: Jazz Gumbo
reviews.title: Interesting Place
reviews.comment: We had a few hours to kill before our flight home, this is very close to the SLC airport and is a pleasant and picturesque place to visit and enjoyable to see. Utah has so many spectacular locations that this will only ever be a footnote to visit but its worth a couple hours of your time.

reviews.name: Scott L
reviews.title: A great scenic drive through the cottonwoods and aspens
reviews.comment: If you have a couple hours and are looking for a great scenic drive, this fits the bill. Starting just outside the city and finishing up at Brighton/Solitude ski area, the drive up starts in a narrow gorge flanked by the river and cottonwood trees. As you climb you['ll cross meadows, pass through the aspen zone and even have a chance to pull off and enjoy nature. During our trip, we saw beaver preparing for the winter and a moose nestled into the willows along the river.

reviews.name: kjf27
reviews.title: Outstanding Place for Year-Round Recreation
reviews.comment:
If you are looking for outdoor recreation, Big Cottonwood Canyon has incredible options for all seasons. In the winter, it offers world-class skiing at Brighton or Solitude resorts. You can also enjoy the myriad trails on snowshoes during the winter.
In late spring to early fall, the hiking and mountain biking trails are fantastic. Some of my favorites include Brighton Lakes, Hidden Falls, Donut Falls, and Willow Heights.
In summer, you can also climb a number of mountain peaks. Sunset Peak and Clayton Peak are both fun summits and don't require a lot of experience to climb.

reviews.name: Kathleen D
reviews.title: Beautiful summer or winter
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful canyon all year round, but particularly nice to hike in during the summer when it is hot in the valley. There are a number of great hikes at various locations in the canyon.

reviews.name: Cat99
reviews.title: Canyons + SLC = Close
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is not only close to the City - it has some of the best hiking, skiing and just plain "getting out of the city " that you can experience. Depending on the time of year and what you are looking for you can find it all. There are some wonderful trails to hike and both Solitude and Brighton Ski Resorts are located in this canyon. I highly recommend a visit no matter what time of year. It is beautiful.

reviews.name: Karla J
reviews.title: One of my best hikings alone
reviews.comment:
The place is beautiful, even with snow!!! I felt really safe, found the trails easily, strenuous but not impossible.
It made me fell in love with SLC, love it is so close to the city.

reviews.name: wade s
reviews.title: beautiful ride
reviews.comment: great canyon summer or winter in summer there is hiking fly fishing a lake at the top of the canyon that you can bait fish at. take you camera there is beautiful scenery and wild life. in winter the skiing is the best in the world.

reviews.name: 649kenth
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment:
We enjoyed traveling up this canyon. The draw to us, besides the beauty and variety, is the fact that in the summertime travelers can drive through the canyon and connect into Heber City or go north into Park City. We also enjoy the walk around Silver Lake.
The main challenge is burning your brakes swerving through the "S" curves.

reviews.name: tricia c
reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.comment: Fun for all outdoors adventures! We go snowmobiling, hiking, and biking here. It's clean, fun and a lot to see!

reviews.name: patterson5j
reviews.title: My family and I love to visit Big Cottonwood canyon. I love camping in this canyon.
reviews.comment: I love the camping in Big Cottonwood. The area is beautiful and in the summer heat it is nice to go up into the mountains go hiking or fishing and camping.

reviews.name: Kurt H
reviews.title: Nice Drive, but Getting More Crowded
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon (BCC) is one of the 2 of the largest canyons fronting the Wasatch Front/SLC Valley. This canyon is mostly water eroded, V-shaped sedimentary rock and not glaciated other than the upper stretches of it (in contrast with Little Cottonwood which is starkly different with U-shape from both glaciation and metamorphic rock). Both of the canyons are great scenic drives. Know the kind way to drive in the West is to pull off if blocking up traffic, as you can then soak in the scenery (makes it more enjoyable for all). 2 of the main ski resorts are in this canyon (Solitude, Brighton). There are multiple hikes ranging from easy to hard. There are easy hikes with minimal elevation gain. Realize hard/strenuous means not for younger kids, or low or average shape folks. BCC is becoming progressively more busy over the decades and now most popular hiking trails have no parking by about 0900-1000. There are only a few restaurants in the canyon, but they are good ones.

reviews.name: LouieWorldTraveller
reviews.title: A must see beautiful forrest.
reviews.comment: We have gone skiing in the winter and hiking the rest of the year to this glorious area. The vegetation and wildlife are so very beautiful. It is someplace to be enjoyed repeatedly.

reviews.name: Shauna S
reviews.title: Fun hiking
reviews.comment: I love hiking in this canyon. No dogs allowed. A favorite pretty easy hike is to Doughnut Falls. The walk around Silver Lake was perfect with my 90 year old mother-in-law.

reviews.name: 323joshua
reviews.title: Great for Hiking Skiing camping
reviews.comment: I love Big Cottonwood Canyon one of the most beautiful places in the world. Weather you love hiking or camping or Skiing. Lots of great hikes for every level. Day hike up to lake Blanch and sun dial peak it's breath taking and worth the climb fairly steep in a few places a good 5 hours up but you'll want to stay once you get there for the scenic Beauty. Skiing Brighton or Solitude both Great Skiing and always the greatest snow on earth dry light fluffy. Can't go wrong here

reviews.name: LolaBean55
reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.comment: Beautiful canyon, great drive to a small lake you can walk around at the top as well as day use campsites for cookouts.

reviews.name: Ann P
reviews.title: Snow Rescue course
reviews.comment: A beautiful place to be. Great powder snow and a nice peaceful and challenging environment for our course

reviews.name: Tanyalo726
reviews.title: The Prettiest Drive in this part of the the state!
reviews.comment:
What a perfect Sunday drive, so many gorgeous views all the way up to Solitude! You typically aren't able to get through to Park City until May, same with not being able to stop on the side of the road after a certain point due to avalanches.
Be sure to stop at The Silver Fork lodge for a bite on your way through! BEAUTIFUL! In my opinion, it's prettier than Little Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: Phayao13
reviews.title: Natural experience even for drivers
reviews.comment: If you choose to drive during the winter, be sure to have a four wheel drive alternative is to have snow chains available.A recreation area that offers almost every activity you can think of summer and winter.Big Cottonwood Canyon is a quick 40 minutes away from Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: Caroline C
reviews.title: So close, yet so amazing!
reviews.comment: Come here for skiing at every level. Come here for summer hikes for everyone. Come here for from Salt Lake and Park City. Come here to smell the hint of mint beside a mountain creek. Salt Lake's Wasatch front Big Cottownwood Canyon offers a glacial bowl at the top and a spectacular river-carved canyon to the views of Salt Lake City below. It's close. It's fresh. It's the mountains!

reviews.name: T&H
reviews.title: Superb views and spacious room
reviews.comment:
We had a large room overlooking the snow capped mountains. the room had a gas (wood look alike) fireplace, a microwave, utensils and a bed so comfortable that it induced a fabulous night's sleep. The staff, in particularly Pattie, were super friendly and very accommodating. The breakfast had everything and was fresh and well presented. We only spent two nights at this Marriott but would happily return as it's well located and has large, clean, well appointed rooms.
An added bonus was a free shuttle service to the light rail which goes directly into the city.

reviews.name: royalbluedolphingirl
reviews.title: Beautiful, grat place to camp!
reviews.comment: Both big and little Cottonwood is a beautiful drive! Little Cottonwood has a lake at the top called Silverlake. It is small and you can easily walk around the boardwalk in 30 to 45 minutes max. Little Cottonwood is more closed whereas big Cottonwood is very open and very scenic. It is also less populated then Little Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: psblin
reviews.title: So close!
reviews.comment: We are staying in SE SLC but we're still surprised how fast we made it to the 8500' top. Great drive and views. They say Brighton is the oldest in the state.

reviews.name: Melissa M
reviews.title: Wrong type of car for the drive!
reviews.comment: This was a wonderful scenic drive outside of Salt Lake City. I should have taken my time more to appreciate the scenery, but with high snow banks with was difficult to pull off the road. It's worthwhile to note that the area can be restricted to AWD with snow tires/chains if there is fresh snowfall. I lucked out and was not restricted in early February, but my Nissan Sentra rental car definitely struggled up and down the hills. I was missing my AWD Subaru during this drive!

reviews.name: dcisive
reviews.title: Amazing IF You Pick The Right Day
reviews.comment: Having lived here beginning in the later 70's this place was magical and set the tone for what it was like to live near a area that provided wilderness experience close in. Over the years of course Salt Lake in general has grown leaps and bounds and this place is only amazing on NON weekends and NON holidays as it is over run with tourists and locals alike. Traffic is a drag as is the load of people about. If you are fortunate to pick the right day you'll be treated to an experience unlike other places will typically provide. The flavor of wilderness close by. Fresh air and amazing flora, fauna, wildlife, small lakes and mountain terrain. Be sure to bring good comfortable shoes and more if hiking. Water as well. Just soak it up and you will love it.

reviews.name: Lisa H
reviews.title: Beautiful, all year
reviews.comment: I regularly visit this canyon, pretty much all year (though access after a snow storm is limited.) There are great hiking trails (suitable for all levels of fitness), great picnic locations, beautiful scenery for photography or just to enjoy nature.

reviews.name: 33franzf
reviews.title: So much to do
reviews.comment:
Winter or summer, so much to do. You like to ski? Solitude and Brighton offer world class skiing. You prefer cross country skiing (Nordic Skiing)? Solitude as one of the nicest locations for thin air 20 km of groomed trails. Skimo is also an option for the more adventurous people. Too many options to list here.
Summer offers great hiking for all levels of abilities, whether a short stroll around Silver Lake, or more strenuous hikes up to higher lakes in some of the most beautiful settings of the Wasatch.
At only 30 minutes from Salt Lake City, the question is, do you have the time to enjoy all that this canyon has to offer?

reviews.name: Jody M
reviews.title: Best canyon!
reviews.comment: This is my favorite canyon's in Salt Lake! Open year round! Beautiful scenery. Really pretty drive and tons of beautiful hiking options. Don't miss this drive. You can drive to the top, I think its about a 15 mile drive up to the ski resort with pretty hikes and picnic areas around the lake and then you can go across Guardsman's Pass into Park City. That's a really pretty drive too. :D

reviews.name: Colin R
reviews.title: Great powder
reviews.comment: We skied three days and it was great. We used the bus service for one day as the road was only open to 4x4 and chains and the but was very handy.

reviews.name: Nad B
reviews.title: amazing snow
reviews.comment: It's so arctic and apparently always snowing and Alta ski area has a really terrific atmosphere of locals with no snowboarding permitted

reviews.name: Tony d
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
reviews.comment:
This is a stunning canyon and I love it. It's amazing in winter, spectacular vistas of snow, trees, blue skies and crags. In summer it sheds its white cloak and turn green and is another kind of beauty.
Skiing, hiking, cycling, sledding, running and fishing are some of the activities available there.

reviews.name: Mike M
reviews.title: BCC Baby!
reviews.comment: This canyon is awesome. Lots of hikes, fishing, climbing, picnicking and relaxation. Plenty of lakes, both easy and challenging to see. Two awesome ski resorts, Solitude and Brighton, although Brighton would most likely choose to be called a snowboard resort, in my opinion. Please pack out everything you bring in, don't litter!

reviews.name: Heidi H
reviews.title: Great Escape!!
reviews.comment: This canyon is beautiful and has it all: hiking, skiing & snowshoeing in the Winter, incredible in the Fall. If you want a break from the city, this is a wonderful place to visit.

reviews.name: BurtonT1964
reviews.title: Camping, skiing, Hiking
reviews.comment: You can do just about everything here that an outdoorsy person would love. From the numerous camping sites open during the summer to snow skiing at Solitude and Brighton in the winter. It's a beautiful canyon just to take a drive. Lots of places to pull over and hike and take some amazing pictures.

reviews.name: Adrienne B
reviews.title: Bypass in Winter
reviews.comment: This Canyon was #1 on so many to-do lists I read about. No matter what, I wanted to check it out. I see the potential for the Canyon in summer.....trails, picnics, river, etc. However, in the winter everything is snowed over. No parking available and chains block off trails. A pretty drive, but that was about it. Will try again once the snow melts!

reviews.name: winyan48
reviews.title: Amazing scenery
reviews.comment: The walk around Silver Lake is so beautiful, easily accessible, and a great walk for young and old. There is a boardwalk for most of the walk, but side trails and walks through deeper forests are very peaceful and beautiful. Lots of wildlife as well.

reviews.name: jefforylong
reviews.title: Mountain biking the Wasatch Creast
reviews.comment: Take a 6 hour bike ride a cross the rocky Mountains. It's a must during the summer month's. 2 miles up hill and then down hill until you get to the bottom of Mill creek.

reviews.name: brent396
reviews.title: Spectacluar Vistas in Any Season
reviews.comment: I love the Wasatch Mountains! The peaks are majestic as any you will see in the world. The canyons offer wonderful vistas of both mountains and valleys. The seasons change and with the changing seasons, the vistas offer uniquely varied perspectives. Absolutely wonderful!

reviews.name: maureenmiles
reviews.title: Very beautiful place
reviews.comment: I went hiking with friends in this canyon. It's very beautiful, with lots of nice trails for walking or bike riding.

reviews.name: Sherry W
reviews.title: Great Hiking, skiing, and snowshoeing
reviews.comment: Great hiking in the summer and some trails you can snowshoe on in the winter. Of course it has great skiing/snowboarding in the winter. Beautiful canyon with things to do year round. The is even some great sledding hills. Around Solitude lake you will find the boardwalk trails suitable for young children or the elderly

reviews.name: Jeffery W
reviews.title: A beautiful day trip
reviews.comment: This canyon has alot to offer from its scenic drive to its many hiking trails a beautiful lakes. And you can take off on guardsmans pass and cut over to park city it too is a beautiful drive in itself.

reviews.name: Carol C
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: For visitors and locals, Big Cottonwood Canyon is a must see/often visit place. The drive up the canyon is lovely in spring, summer and fall. Hiking trails are common on the way up. These days it costs money to visit a campground even for a picnic. At the top of the canyon there is a big parking lot at the base of the ski lifts. Stopping there just to smell the air and look at the mountains is wonderful. The hike to lakes Mary, Martha and Katherine is uphill but worth the effort.

reviews.name: Santacruztrainer
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: So many things to do up here. The outdoor activities and the natural beauty is fantastic. The ski resorts, the hiking and snow shoeing up and down the canyon. This is must do if your a outdoor enthusiast

reviews.name: Sandra L
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: A lovely drive and a beautiful place. Only minutes away from downtown Salt Lake City but feels like a world away.

reviews.name: chilestew
reviews.title: Full Moon snowshoeing
reviews.comment: Beautiful Views and hikes any time of the year. Try snowshoeing when there's a full moon. Can't beat it.

reviews.name: James2035
reviews.title: Beautiful for your mind and body
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of the best spots to visit when in Utah. Being outdoors in such a beautiful setting refreshes your mind and body. The air is clean, the view is fantastic, and the landscape is wonderful any time of the year. Bring your camera and take pictures that will remind you of a wonderful visit to Utah.

reviews.name: CMoge
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Amazing place to hike. It's absolutely beautiful! Skiing in the winter too. Beautiful any time of year.

reviews.name: s j c
reviews.title: fun to hike
reviews.comment: I love exploring this Canyon. many fun places and small lakes to check out. beautiful in spring and fall especially. just wish I could take my dogs, on a leash of course! then it would be 5*.

reviews.name: majenkins1
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Always gorgeous. More beautiful n the summertime to me. Well worth the drive, and great skiing, of course.

reviews.name: Alexandre Kroiss Vieira
reviews.title: Increadible view and perfect to walk
reviews.comment: If you come to Salt Lake and you must go to the mountains, even for a quick couple of hours. It´s so beautiful and relaxing. ENJOY!

reviews.name: lminshew62
reviews.title: God's Gift
reviews.comment: If you come to Salt Lake and you don't go to the mountains, even for a quick couple of hours, you might as well not come to Utah. It's my favorite, FAVORITE thing about this city. No matter which direction you turn, you are not far from the clean air and beauty that are waiting there. Don't miss it.

reviews.name: hrld2717
reviews.title: quick get away
reviews.comment: Nice summer/fall drive. Excellent food at Silver Fork Lodge near Solitude. Often see deer and Occ. moose the the small lake near Brighton

reviews.name: Debby T
reviews.title: Fall scenery
reviews.comment: This place is beyond words, especially in the fall. We always take a motorcycle ride up through these canyons every year. We'll stop for a walk, then go up the road a little more and find a place to have lunch. Always dine outside if that's an option, you won't regret doing this. It would be a real nice hike too, for those of you so inclined to do so. A camera is a must, We think we've got all the pictures to be had, but we always seem to come up with one we don't have. BEAUTIFUL!!

reviews.name: Darin F L
reviews.title: Day Canyon Dive
reviews.comment: Take a leisurely drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon and see the beautiful fall colors as the canyon trees turn brilliant Reds, Oranges and Yellows, against the contrasting evergreens and white bark of the Quaking Aspens who's colorful leaves shimmer in the sunshine. It is best to make the drive when the change is in full effect. Ask the local news stations who usually keep track of this event for the local canyons. Little Cottonwood Canyon is another favorite (see map).

reviews.name: Vivid12345
reviews.title: Beautiful view, enjoyable hiking and good exercise
reviews.comment:
Five of us went hiking on Days Fork trail which is behind spruces campground. The park lot is quite small. Fortunately we carpooled and we're able to find a space. The toilet at the beginning of trail is open with heater. Today was cold even it was a sunny day. I wore regular hiking shoes , which is not enough for this kind of cold weather. Snow boots are a must.
This is my first time hiking in the winter. The scenery was great. Even though couple sections of trail were very steep, I really enjoyed.
We just finished 2.4 miles (one way). The snow was not packed on the rest of miles. We were unable to walk on the trail with wearing snowtrax. Next time we should wear snowshoes instead.

reviews.name: Anne_PinkBiker
reviews.title: Run the Big Cottonwood Canyon Half or Full Marathon
reviews.comment: The best way to experience this canyon is running down it OR riding up it on a motorcycle. Both provide amazing views and turns.

reviews.name: Andrea R
reviews.title: Endless fun expolring.
reviews.comment: we hike big and little all the time, great trails and great rewards at the end, we always meet fun interesting people on the trails.

reviews.name: Brian M
reviews.title: Any season
reviews.comment:
Summer/spring; beautiful hikes, great place to escape the heat, hike around brighton for some easy and fun routes. Lake Mary, easy hike go there.
Fall; colors galore; go drive this canyon for beautiful colors. So many shades of green, brown, orange, red!
Winter; snow show, skim, snowboard, ski. Brighton is the local resort, understand its a place with chalets and some rooms, but it is not snowbird or park city or solitude. This is where locals come to rip, bbq and drink. It's becoming a little more.strict but is still the spot for good times if you can meet some dope locals. Solitude has places to stay for sure, they have a lot of rooms and cabins for any size of party.
I can tell you more if you need more specifics! The above is just a brief seasonal review. Photo below is me at the top of brighton close to pioneer ridge in winter and summer! Tried photo is the backside of brighton from crest lift. Some backcountry that is probably insane but sketchy. Sorry for the instagram pictures.

reviews.name: touchstone277
reviews.title: up into the mountains, away from the smog
reviews.comment: December with a red alert for smog meant we drove up and out and the canyon is simply beautiful. Brighton and Solitude traffic to some extent but did not deter from the pleasure of being up there.

reviews.name: Ryan O
reviews.title: Great hike and we saw a moose!
reviews.comment: It was well worth the trip up to go hiking here. It was coolto the the moose and the hike had great views

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Snowshoed At Silver Lake
reviews.comment: Drove up this canyon twice while visiting family during the Christmas season. The first day we snowshoed around Silver Lake. We had our own equipement so our cost was $14 for 2 people. You can rent equipment.We enjoyed the scenery. We took our time and hiked for about 1 1/2 hours. We drove up the canyon again on Christmas day to see the 2 feet of snow the canyon had received. Beautiful!!! Love this drive any time of the year. Take time to see the beauty. Takes about 30 min to reach the Brighton area once in the canyon.

reviews.name: Adam R
reviews.title: Beautiful...Summer/Winter/Spring or Fall
reviews.comment: If you love the outdoors, then you will love this area of our great country. There are virtually unlimited activities, places to stay, delightful attractions, delicious food...What more is there to say?

reviews.name: William S
reviews.title: Paradise in the high mountains
reviews.comment: We are lucky enough to live here and we love it. You have some of the most beautiful hikes all over the canyon in summer along with fishing and mountain biking. Fall brings incredible colors as the leafs change. Winter brings massive amounts of the best powder. Average 500 inches, Brighton and solitude ski and snowboard resorts are some of the best in the USA. Come visit you will love this very special place

reviews.name: PhlegmMaster
reviews.title: Peaceful & Beautiful!
reviews.comment:
My wife and I drove here from Park City, which took us less than 40 minutes to get to the entrance to the Canyon.
It was such a gorgeously serene area! The weather was perfectly crisp and clear!
We drove in a ways, taking short hikes here and there, but our main hike was up to see Lake Blanche. Pictures from the hike up Lake Blanche Trail can be seen in that review.

reviews.name: Dr_MikeK
reviews.title: A very beautiful place to visit
reviews.comment: This is well worth the short drive our of Salt Lake City as the views are stunning. I visited in October and went at 8:00 am when no one was around, it was extremely cold but the lake was just stunning. I also took a walk to Horseshoe Falls and this was just fantastic as there was so much wildlife (birds, der, moose, etc.).

reviews.name: Thmack
reviews.title: Just a cool drive
reviews.comment:
Really neat drive, looks
Like a lot of great hiking too. Wish we had been there in the summer when things were green!

reviews.name: jmho4u
reviews.title: Nature at its finest
reviews.comment: Loved this easy drive. Seeing nature at its finest. Went in off season so could drive at a leisurely pace and absorb all the beauty.

reviews.name: Rebecca N
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: We decided to take a couple drives after our business. Well worth the time. It put that harrowing storm experience behind us!

reviews.name: mef514
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Drive all the way through and enjoyed the scenery. Beautiful views of canyon, mountains, and wildlife. Although I didn't camp, I noticed quite a few areas that would be perfect.

reviews.name: Michele B
reviews.title: Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful
reviews.comment: The drive up this canyon is spectacular. Trees, rivers and granite cliffs everywhere you turn. We went up to Brighton and walked the Silver Lake trail. Great time. Pretty harsh in the winter, but fall is great.

reviews.name: Wladmir F
reviews.title: Beautiful trails, really nice views, there is a trail for everybody
reviews.comment: I went there alone and it was great. Put Brighton Sky Area on your GPS and it will take you through the Canyon. When u get to Brighton in the closed loop, there is a parking lot at the right and a nice easy trail around a beautiful pond. Easy to walk for a family with kids and elderly people. There are other larger and harder trails too :) I recommend for everybody.

reviews.name: airjennie
reviews.title: A great Drive
reviews.comment: We had hoped to take Guardsman Pass to Park City but it was already closed. The drive itself is fun, though all the leaves were gone by the first week in November. Late September or early October would have been best. There were still a lot of people out hiking and biking in the canyon as the weather was unseasonably warm.

reviews.name: Yvonne W
reviews.title: Gorgeous scenery!
reviews.comment: My spouse and I grew up in Salt Lake so we went up the canyons a lot. The scenery is breathtaking and is never tiring. The views are revitalizing and calming all seasons of the year! Highly recommended!! Moved to another state to be near grand kids and deeply miss the Utah mountains....

reviews.name: tibet71
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment:
We stayed at the based of the Canyon at Residence Inn. When you drive on Cottonwood road, it will split at 7- eleven, Big Cottonwood and Little Cottonwood. The sign clearly marked for which way. If you are going to Big Cottonwood Canyon you will make a left turn on Cottonwood Road. If you are going to Little Cottonwood Canyon you will go straight.
As you drove along the Big Cotton, there are many places you can stop and hike. Our purpose was to go through Guardsman's Pass and into Park City. Unfortunately, Guardsman's Pass was closed for the season, so we make a U turn back down.
If your goal is Guardsman's Pass, as soon as you pass Silver Lodge Place, you will need to make a left turn up the hill and onto Guardsman's Pass. There will be sign for Guardsman's Pass.

reviews.name: Sweet0ne
reviews.title: Wonders of Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is an all around place to visit. Summer time beautiful camping with wildlife going through your camp. Loved seeing the moose outside of our trailer. Wonderful places to go hike. Winter the skiing is great.

reviews.name: Mo1962
reviews.title: Beautiful scenic drive
reviews.comment: After visiting BYU, we wanted to see how far the slopes were from campus (less than an hour). This was an amazing scenic drive up to Brighton (there was some snow on the ground at the top in November). The canyon walls are huge. Along the way, we saw a beaver dam and stopped to see the beavers swimming around. They also had a lodge/hut built there and we saw a moose hanging out in the reeds.

reviews.name: Alicia M
reviews.title: Twin Lakes Hike
reviews.comment:
We decided to go on a hike in the Big Cottonwood Canyon. I piked the Twin Lakes hike because it was rated as "easy". The hike would have been easy, if it wasn't for the snow and ice on the trail. We made it up and down fine, but just slower then normal. It look us about 2 hours round trip with a little time at the top too. The surroundings for the hike were great! The lake at the top is nice, as long as you don't look at the cement reservoir wall. We heard that there is also a possibility of moose sightings on this trail, but didn't see any on our hike.
The drive through the Canyon was great! I was really glad we made time for it!

reviews.name: Melinda C
reviews.title: To amazing to miss!
reviews.comment: Just get in the rental car and drive up this canyon. It is beautiful any time of year! Bring some hiking gear. It is impossible to drive up and not want your boots on the dirt.

reviews.name: Rick D
reviews.title: Great drive
reviews.comment:
Great ski area in winter time. But each for snow avalanche. They are great at getting road open after words
But other times of the year it's still a beautiful drive. A must in the area

reviews.name: DanM003
reviews.title: Great Drive in the Fall
reviews.comment: A great way to escape from the city for a quick hike - of course, you can also go skiing/riding in the winter - in the summer/fall, you can drive all the way up the canyon and then cross over and come down in Deer Valley and Park City...

reviews.name: camerpin
reviews.title: Stunning Canyon
reviews.comment: Definitely worth a visit no matter what time of year you travel. Solitude is a great ski resort: quiet and tucked away. There are fewer crowds than other resorts with the same quality of skiing. Brighton has amazing skiing as well with great deals for families with children. If you come in the summer make sure to visit Silver Lake. If you're up for it a hike, go to Donut Falls or Mary Lake. Each provides spectacular sights and sounds. You'll feel great because you're in the great outdoors getting some mild exercise and some fresh mountain air. Enjoy!!

reviews.name: Mike W
reviews.title: Must see in Salt Liake City
reviews.comment: The route is a byway and it is a must see when you travel in Sal Lake City. However, you need a very good car brake to travel this route.

reviews.name: Mark P
reviews.title: Awe inspiring views :-)
reviews.comment: We visited with our 3 children on a holiday from the UK and loved the brief time that we spent here. The views were amazing and if we were to visit again we would definitely spend more time exploring. An awe inspiring snapshot of the grandeur and beauty of Utah canyons. :-)

reviews.name: Thumpurr3
reviews.title: Great relaxing time
reviews.comment: We stayed at Spruces campground. The mornings were crisp and beautiful. The hosts were friendly and helpful. We were at a spot that accommodated 4 tents and a tent trailer and there'd was still plenty of room. The best part about it was we were visited every morning by 3 or 4 moose! Beautiful creatures!

reviews.name: Amanda S
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful- a must see
reviews.comment: Absolutely beautiful. There are multiple hikes for multiple skill levels. We saw deer, moose, and an abundance of other wild life. If you visit in the fall, be sure to bundle up! It can get very cold.

reviews.name: Jud W
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: Great to be so close the a major city and in a half hour be in the middle of gorgeous mountain scenery.

reviews.name: Eric060
reviews.title: Beautiful mountains surrounding
reviews.comment: There are many trails there. Do not go for the very steep ones in the forest with little view. Go further to Nordic Center. Tried to go to Park City from here, but the road was narrow and steep and a bit scary. Better to go from hghw 80.

reviews.name: smederlet
reviews.title: Stunning and magnificant
reviews.comment: A beautiful 15 mile long canyon with endless hiking, biking, picnicking and fishing. It is such a gorgeous place to visit you won't want to leave

reviews.name: joyhope
reviews.title: Epic hike!
reviews.comment: We made the treck up to the Spine. Again. Even though there was some snow we were sweating by the time we got to the top. The views were breathtaking. Desolation Lake is always so peaceful so enjoyed stopping by on our way back down. It's about 5miles up. And 5miles back. Always feel like a mix between Tarzan, Superman & Moses standing up there! No dogs allowed on trail.

reviews.name: Olga I
reviews.title: A great outdoor activity even for an indoor types
reviews.comment: A beautiful scenery (especially on a nice warm day). A good activity for families, couples, or groups of friends. Beware, it gets much colder than the rest of the Salt Lake City (even in summer you might need a fleece jacket). Awesome photo ops. Nice places for hikes and strolls. Certain areas do not allow dogs. Totally worth the trip.

reviews.name: rlmcnary
reviews.title: Any city in America would be proud to have a canyon like this. We,have seven
reviews.comment:
Every canyon in Salt Lake County is unique. This is a gem. Whatever the season, there is a place to recreate, to picnic or just meditate.
Hiking to the falls at the "S" turns, Donut Falls, dining at Silver Fork and strolling along the board walk around Silver Lake, even stopping at the Heber Valley of Overlook along Guardsman Pass, plan to spend hours.

reviews.name: Jmorrison10
reviews.title: Amazing drive
reviews.comment: We drove up Big Cottonwood Canyon this fall to see the leaves change and I was in awe at the beauty. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Kandie Z
reviews.title: Autumn Leaves
reviews.comment: A must see of mother nature showing her colors! Go over Guardman's Pass and into Midway. You must go before they close the pass for the winter about early November.

reviews.name: KansasRev
reviews.title: GET AWAY & JUST RELAX!!
reviews.comment:
Don't think twice. Do it.
I spent 3 hours just driving the canyon, stopping to snap pictures, and walking a few trails.
Find a place to sit and take it all in. Awe inspiring!
Stay until sunset and be AMAZED!

reviews.name: Kathy S
reviews.title: Beautiful area for skiing and recreation
reviews.comment: I enjoyed several visits to this area for skiing. It has a nice climate in the summer as well. Beware of the inversion.

reviews.name: SLCAndrus
reviews.title: Must go to see Silver Lake
reviews.comment: This is one of my favorite places to visit to reconnect with nature and to just slow down. Easy hike around the lake. Picnic spots. Great for kids.

reviews.name: Emy P
reviews.title: Gorgeous canyon
reviews.comment: Love big cottonwood canyon. There are so many hiking trails to enjoy. We recently did donut falls and had a great Fall hike. so fun

reviews.name: tjschell
reviews.title: Had a great time
reviews.comment: We went up in the canyon with friends. Lots of fall colors this time of the year. They offer lots of hiking trails and lots of picnic areas. Highly advice this trip up the canyon.

reviews.name: sharkbaitWHOHAHA
reviews.title: Must mountain bike gaurdsman pass to millcreek canyon ski snowbird in little cottonwwod
reviews.comment: this canyon is a must ski, see, hike and play. Most travelers don't know this but there are allot of canyons that connect at the top of this elevation. you can (because i have) hike up mineral basin (the back of snowbird) over to brighton (in big cottonwood canyon )and then mountainbike down millcreek canyon. Snowbird is my family's favorite resort, get out of those knuckldragin a clowns at brighton or if you have to stay in big cottonwood canyon, ski solitude, it really is utahs best kept secret.

reviews.name: Heather G
reviews.title: Beautiful!!!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is most excellent in the fall for a great fall colors. It is also the way to access donut Falls, very popular yet easy hike for the whole family. There are tons of hikes! Accessing from solitude ski resort there is a hike that hit dog lake, Lake Catherine, Lake Mary and one other. Just before Brighton ski resort there is a turn off for silver lake which has a board walk all the way around the small lake.

reviews.name: Dave B
reviews.title: October is a great time to visit
reviews.comment: Drove over Guardsman Pass, and wow were the views fantastic. Leaves were turning. Totally awesome drive

reviews.name: Suzy Q
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood
reviews.comment: Just went on Oct 10th for a ride up Big Cottonwood Canyon to see the Fall Scenery. It was a great drive. I love that you can stop and get out and sit by the stream that runs through the canyon. Very relaxing and so close to home, so can access very easily. The Wasatch Mountains are absolutely beautiful!!! I am from California and miss the beach, but after 26 years here am attached to the mountain views!

reviews.name: anon8882014
reviews.title: Lake Blanche hike: not easy but stunning
reviews.comment: this is a beautiful hike, and as hikes that involve 2700 feet elevation gain in less than three miles, this was pretty good. Much of the trail was well graded and not so rocky, allowing this 58 yo to do it with not too much pain. Beautiful place in the fall, too.

reviews.name: Peter P
reviews.title: So near and yet so far!
reviews.comment: Only a 30-minute drive from downtown Salt Lake City, Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of the must-do glories for hiking and walking in Utah. There are trails from easy to frightening, fabulous views, and glorious nature.

reviews.name: Marc13510
reviews.title: Easy access from Salt Lake, lots of biking and hiking trails, beautiful fall colors.
reviews.comment: Wow, our party of four was amazed at the beauty of the canyon. Some of the Aspens still sport their yellow leaves which made for a visually stunning drive. The drive starts out next to a beautiful creek. Several trail heads provide hiking or mountain biking options. We took the turn to Park City and stopped at Guardsman Pass. We went on a short walk on one of the trails before driving back down. The return drive was equally stunning with different views and the late afternoon light on the mountain peaks meant a few stops to take some more pictures.

reviews.name: Faith C
reviews.title: Beautiful vistas and fall colors on windy road
reviews.comment: Traveled from Park City over the mountain to Big cottonwood canyon. Fortunate to enjoy the bursts of Yellow leaves on Aspen before they all fall off and the mountainous road is closed for the winter.

reviews.name: sundevil27
reviews.title: Fall outing
reviews.comment:
Great ambiance in the fall.
Wife loves the colors and mountain air.
Snowbird October fest is a fun event

reviews.name: Cinkin27
reviews.title: Excellent Drive!
reviews.comment: This drive is beautiful with many places to stop for photos, hiking or biking. It was worth it in late September with the wonderful weather. If you are heading toward SLC, be sure to stop at The Porcupine Grille and Pub 3698 E Fort Union Blvd, Salt Lake City, UT 84121-4550. It is at the end of Big Cottonwood Canyon drive just past the 7-Eleven.

reviews.name: Pat S
reviews.title: Beautiful fall drive
reviews.comment: In early October, we enjoyed the beautiful colors and awesome views. We also found a couple of geocaches along the way.

reviews.name: slc5rings
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood, (almost) wilderness 30-min from Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is coming alive. Since Deer Valley bought Solitude Resort, there are now several dining options in the canyon, where Silver Fork Lodge formerly was virtually the only dining option.

reviews.name: SherriThacker
reviews.title: Breathtaking views!!
reviews.comment: This is a breathtaking drive through the canyon in Utah. We went in early October. Even though we missed the red leaves by a couple of weeks, just beautiful views throughout.

reviews.name: Lakinhouse
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: We decided to take a drive to Big Cottonwood Canyon on a Sunday afternoon to hike some trails. The leaves were beginning to change and the views were lovely. We enjoyed an easy hike around Silver Lake. Would have liked to have stopped at a couple other trailheads, but we didn't anticipate how unbelievably crowded the trailhead parking would be. The moral of the story is to go early!

reviews.name: giovannonislc
reviews.title: Great Time Anytime of Year
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is a MUST SEE. In the winter you can ski (go to Brighton for an easier local feel) snowshoe, any winter sport (no snowmobiling). Fall, spring and summer do not disappoint. Hiking takes over after the snow is gone - with multiple trails for the beginner to the advanced and beautiful views. Big Cottonwood is home to Moose and spotting a Moose midday at Silver Lake is a really good bet. Silver Lake is handicapped accessible and beautiful

reviews.name: CJ D
reviews.title: if you enjoy the outdoors...
reviews.comment: we go up here a few times a year. ski in the winder, mtn bike and hike during summer, and drive through for "leaf peeping" in the fall. its a beautiful place with lots of things to do for the outdoors types. Doughnut falls and silver lake are nice easy family hikes. quite a few other harder hikes, rock climbing as well. wasatch crest ride (mtn bike ride either from guardsmans pass or from park city ski area) is an amazing ride (if you have the legs for it).

reviews.name: A J C
reviews.title: Nice drive
reviews.comment: If you are going to Salt Lake City, please take the time and drive the Big Cottonwood Canyon. It will take maybe 1-2 hours, depending on how many stop you make to take pictures. On the drive up to the summit stop at the lodge (sorry I don't remember the name) which is located about half way and have breakfast or just coffee and a sweet roll. The food look wonderful and it is just a nice place to stop.

reviews.name: Gayliene L
reviews.title: The Mountians are Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The Fall in the Wasatch Mountains is so very beautiful with the small lakes and the quiet beauty is a wonderful place to enjoy along with the fishing the serenity of it all is refreshing to the mind.

reviews.name: zimmys57
reviews.title: Fantastic fall drive
reviews.comment: We made three drives through the Canyon during our week in Park City as the fall colors were in their full glorious stage. We went once on the weekend and twice during the week which was less crowded with the ability to find spots to pull off and take photos much less hectic and rushed. A little fresh snow at the top made the colors even more brilliant. A true treat on our visit to Utah!

reviews.name: JB5445
reviews.title: A Trip on our own
reviews.comment:
We were not sure as to what we wanted to do on our first time in Salt Lake, our hotel desk reception suggested we rent a car and check out Park City and Big Copper Canyon
We loved the day. What a beautiful Canyon. Leaves were starting to turn near the top but rock formations were awesome

reviews.name: Calzgemz51
reviews.title: Scenic lake walkway
reviews.comment: Must do a casual walk around the Silver Lake Nature Walkway. Beautiful lake views and lots of animals. The moose and the deer have no fear of being hurt, and the prairie dogs are very entertaining.

reviews.name: Eric O
reviews.title: Beautiful Fall Hike Today
reviews.comment: My wife and I hiked from the base of Brighton Ski Resort to Lake Mary and absolutely loved it! Snow all around the lake and on the path to it. About 800 ft elevation gain. No problem for these southerners, the landscape was a great excuse to stop (rest) and take a picture... Highly recommended 1.5 hr round trip hike!!!

reviews.name: JB81ontheroad
reviews.title: Beautiful way to spend a day
reviews.comment: If you have time time to spend on a sunny afternoon, this is a lovely drive with a nice boardwalk suitable for a stroll through nature.

reviews.name: bigmouthlion
reviews.title: Not that amazing, Some what disappointed, Overrated
reviews.comment: A easy walking around Silver lake( less a mile) is high light of the trip. Not much a canyon with little foliage color changed. May be because of the cloudy day.

reviews.name: Ellencmp
reviews.title: Great Ride Close To Town!
reviews.comment: Don't have a whole lot of time, but want to get out in the nature? It's a quick drive from downtown SLC and the views are spectacular!

reviews.name: Laurie K
reviews.title: Stunning Landscapes
reviews.comment: Leaves were changing and produced vibrant yellows and orange. The rock formations seem to be shooting out of the side of the mountain. Have only experienced the canyon during the winter. This was a treat. Easy hike around Silver Lake. Take Guardsman Pass to Park City.

reviews.name: Ruchi2787
reviews.title: Little or big, they never cease to amuse you!
reviews.comment: A must drive to this canyon along with the little cottonwood canyon if you are in the city visiting or living( you got to be extremely lucky to be living in SLC!) The winding roads which quickly take you up o a 10k feet elevation with breath-taking scenery and lakes is mind blowing! Do not miss the scenic route to Deer Valley and Park City once you reach the top which is open from July 1st to travellers.

reviews.name: Lorrie C
reviews.title: Beautiful always but a don't miss in the fall
reviews.comment: This is an absolutely beautiful drive via any mode of transportation and absolutely breath taking in the fall. If you have an hour or two put it to good use enjoying be beauty! I am a local and we do this drive at least twice a year.

reviews.name: MJ_JR00
reviews.title: I LOVE our canyons!
reviews.comment: Just go. Talk to folks who can help you determine the right hike for your ability level and go. I am not a skiier, but the beauty of our mountains is rejuvenating, and as a local, I should spend more time in my backyard natural wonders.

reviews.name: Ken V
reviews.title: Backyard Beauty
reviews.comment: I feel a special connection to "Big"...as it is the first sight I see each morning. A blend of private and public land holdings, it has generally resisted excessive development, although the ski resorts have been busy in their footprint acreage. Beautiful colors in the fall contribute to wonderland hikes...as do the late spring wild flowers. In the winter, the crowds tend to be a little more manageable. And summer offers a great time to beat the heat of the Sakt Lake Valley. Lots of bikers and hikers, so be careful on your drive up,the twisting (but well maintained) road. In the summer and fall, you can take the option to cross the ridge and drop into the Park City area...beautiful in color season.

reviews.name: ArtB267
reviews.title: Beautiful place to spend the day, or just take a drive over Guardsman Pass to Park City
reviews.comment:
Several times each year, I make it a point to leave Salt Lake and drive home to Park City up Big Cottonwood Canyon to Brighton and then up over Guardsman Pass into Park City. It is one the most scenic drives in Utah. Each time we have guests from out of town in the summer time we take them up over the pass. The pass is closed in winter.
If you are visiting from out of town, head up, enjoy the mountains then drive over to Park City for dinner.
In summer, there are several hiking trailheads and many places to stop and get out and enjoy the mountains up Big Cottonwood. Stop and play with the kids or bring your camping gear and make it a weekend (or plan ahead and rent a cabin).
So much better than staying in Salt Lake.
In winter, the snow that piles up in the Cottonwood Canyons is some of the best, lightest, fluffiest, driest, amazingly fun stuff anywhere. If you don't know how to ski powder, take a lesson. It's like dancing through clouds.

reviews.name: Elouise L
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: There is a wonderful place at the end of the road at Brighton Ski Resort called Silver Lake. It is an easy walk around the lake with beautiful plants and trees. Fish jumping in the lake, and sometimes moose on the trail. You can walk around the lake in about an hour.

reviews.name: Nancy S
reviews.title: Great hikes
reviews.comment: The canyon has some of the best hikes year round. We have done a lot of them but we are always thrilled to explore a new one. It extensive mountain range can take anyone away from all problems and focus only on the beauty of it landscape.

reviews.name: David B
reviews.title: Rock Climbing / Hiking
reviews.comment: The big cottonwood canyon is a wonderful place for rock climbing, hiking, fishing, and snow sports in the winter time. There is no fee.

reviews.name: H W
reviews.title: Outdoor heaven
reviews.comment: Why I moved to Utah! If you like to rock climb, ski, hike, snowshoe, etc. this is the place to do it!

reviews.name: TheLizDiaries
reviews.title: So much beauty, but avoid weekends if possibles!
reviews.comment: This place is gorgeous and really not that far from the city, well maybe a bit, but definitely worth it. Silver Lake is a must see! Even if you don't consider yourself an outdoorsy or fit person the walk around the marsh and lake is relatively easy, but I would avoid weekends if possible as there can be lots of people and it can take away from the serenity.

reviews.name: Zialucia
reviews.title: Great fall hiking
reviews.comment:
Went to Catherine Pass. Great Lake views, red oaks and yellow aspens. The trails are well marked and offer great views of mountain ranges, lakes and valleys. Take an extra
Layer of clothing as you will be over 10,000 feet up.

reviews.name: Carrie C
reviews.title: Worth the drive!
reviews.comment: We loved the drive up to the Silver Lake Loop Trail. The drive itself is beautiful, but the walk on the Silver Lake Loop Trail is the icing on the cake. It is an easy walk, mostly on boardwalk. It is gorgeous and well worth the trip. If you have a portion of a day that you are trying to fill while in SLC, put this on your list! You won't regret it!

reviews.name: TP1234
reviews.title: Beautiful but getting there can be scary
reviews.comment:
The Big Cottonwood Canyon is located south of Park City. You can get here from Salt Lake City via Route 190 (Big Cottonwood Canyon Road) or from Park City via Guardsman Pass.
In Brighton, you can find parking in the Silver Lake Information Center or across the street by the general store. There are many lakes and trails depending on your fitness level and desire.
Silver Lake has a 0.7 mile flat, boardwalk like trail - the easiest one of them all and is absolutely beautiful. We also took the trail to Twin Lakes (a reservoir about 1.25 miles away but over 730 feet upwards - so the distance is deceivingly long. It is a bit challenging considering the high altitude (almost 9000 feet above the sea level). It took us a good 1.5-2 hours for the round trip including a nice stop at the lakes. The Twin Lakes did not have much to look at besides a dam, but the hiking was a great exercise and the view from the top was breathtaking. You can see the entire Brighton area, with Guardsman Pass road in the distance. I wish we had more time to explorer more trails and that we had brought more water with us (we thought we would be back in 30 min for the so-called 1.25 mile trail.
I would highly recommend visiting the Brighton area if you are in SLC but please use the Route 190 to get here, because the Guardsman Pass road is not for the faint-hearted.

reviews.name: furski2013
reviews.title: This canyon is IT!
reviews.comment: This canyon has everything for a single through a family to enjoy--hikes, lakes, restaurants, mountain biking, skiing,tubing. But don't bring your dogs, and it's crowded on weekends!

reviews.name: OutdoorKidz
reviews.title: Wow!!
reviews.comment: This canyon is awesome and offers a ton of very scenic sights. My wife and I did some hiking around and we were appreciative of how close to SLC this place is. We might even move to SLC now!

reviews.name: EnzoX2
reviews.title: pretty drive
reviews.comment:
We traveled through the canyon on our recent trip to SLC. It was 85 in the city and dropped to 55 at one spot in the canyon. Very steep and very scenic. We didn't see any wildlife, but we didn't linger there enough to provide the opportunity to see animals.
We went over Guardsmen pass which drops you into the Park City area. We really enjoyed touring the slopes and the historic town center. A really nice way to spend a half day in this area.

reviews.name: Joe P
reviews.title: A must Canyon to visit
reviews.comment: SLC has a number of canyons to the east, all are very scenic with ski areas in some of them. I find Big Cottonwood to be the most scenic of all of them.

reviews.name: Utah-Indy
reviews.title: Brand new paved road
reviews.comment: Took Guardsman Pass through the Big Cottonwood Canyon from Park City back towards Salt Lake. It was quite scenic. Recently paved but not well marked. Watch your GPS closely as mine wanted to turn off on some of the dirt roads. We found our way and it added about 30 minutes to our trip back to Snowbird.

reviews.name: JIMMY J
reviews.title: Now and forever
reviews.comment: Beautiful and it was peace. Naver forget the place and wsnted back again. My lovely wife and I had beautiful and beless time ever.

reviews.name: mikes970
reviews.title: Awesome drive, wish I hiked
reviews.comment: I drove through the canyon. It was a great drive. You can get to and from SLC and park city using this road. I'd recommend giving yourself time to get out and hike.

reviews.name: Ronnie S
reviews.title: The Canyon
reviews.comment: Grew up in these canyons skiin, fishin, hikin, swmin. The mountains have always been life giving. The wildlife the wild flowers, clouds floating by yea just Beautiful!!!

reviews.name: 007BigBlue
reviews.title: The Mountains are Calling..
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is calling and you must go... We drove the canyon coming back from Park City to Salt Lake and they are beautiful and called my name all day asking me to come climb them. However we did not have the time for a big hike so I will go back to Denver and hike the Rockies but will always here the mountains calling.. Do you here them?

reviews.name: ArnoldV647
reviews.title: A Nice Drive
reviews.comment: We like to take scenic drives all across the United States so we didn't want to miss this scenic byway. It is not too long, maybe 15 miles, and was very nice. It had a great horseshoe curve.

reviews.name: aprabbit7
reviews.title: Shhh! Don't tell anyone....
reviews.comment: I love to visit this canyon for hiking, and when friends are in town and new to the mountains, we often take them up here. The drive is beautiful any time of the year. And at Brighton, there are nice walking/hiking trails around the lake that can take the more adventurous visitors off the beaten path a bit. Hike the trail just above the lake and you will likely see some pika!

reviews.name: Dave T
reviews.title: Great Views
reviews.comment: Start at the top of Guardsmans Pass and you are already near the top of the ridgeline between Park City, Heber, and Brighton. Head north on the Wasatch Crest Trail for endless vistas.

reviews.name: angelabO5252AW
reviews.title: Great Hiking Trails
reviews.comment: Trails are lovely. Other hikers take pride in keeping them liter free and less traveled off trail. The wildlife and scenery is amazing. Must visit!

reviews.name: Sarah D
reviews.title: LOVE it!
reviews.comment: I love Big Cottonwood Canyon. There's so much to see. Very comfortable place to visit. Lots of hikes and camping areas. Easily accessible from I – 215. Love visiting Porcupine Pub at the mouth of the canyon when we go.

reviews.name: CapCrunch19
reviews.title: It's ok...but there are better things to do in SLC
reviews.comment:
The mountains can be beautiful, at the right time of year. June is too early, things are dead and snow still melting. July-Sept is pretty. The drive is fairly scenic and enjoyable. Some nice hikes. But I'm surprised this is the #2 in TripAdvisors Things to Do in Salt Lake City. That's just not right at all. What a screwy ranking system. There are more iconic things to do in town than a trip to these mountains, especially if you have ever seen mountains in your life. If you haven't, then sure they're impressive. But the Rockies have many many places as good or better. Try something that is actually unique to Salt Lake City. It's the #2 ranking that just shocks me and caused me to write a review. If you have already seen everything else in the city and call that #1, then sure this could be #2.
Temple Square is iconic and unique, and 35 acres (Church Office Building observation deck, Tabernacle organ recital, Family History Library, gardens and fountains, Conference Center auditorium and rooftop garden, etc.) the State Capitol, This is the Place village and Pony Express monument....these ought to be ranked higher than a trip to the mountains. Big Cottonwood is nice but it's not some iconic range like the Tetons or some national park. C'mon. Screwy ranking system here.

reviews.name: Debbie W
reviews.title: Excellent hiking!
reviews.comment: We spend a lot of time in this canyon since it is 15 minutes from our home. Almost every weekend we are there. We especially like the Brighton area, where they have several places for hiking, biking, fishing and just a great place for food and fun.Last weekend we came within 10 ' of two bull moose ahead of us on the trail. Majestic! You can also drive to the top of the summit (Guardsman Way) and go down the other side heading to either Park City or Heber. Brighton also has lodging at the resort, A little rustic, but so what you're in the mountains right! Skiing in the winter is great with snowboarding allowed and some varied kinds of trails. Also night skiing.

reviews.name: Grant S
reviews.title: Make lots of stops.
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is widely varied. It changes radically as you drive it. Geology, flora, fauna, rock formations, and views. Take your time and pull out for a view or short walk. Or hike on the exquisite trails. There are as many as 15 places to stop. When you reach the top there are a number of great restaurants.

reviews.name: tulpje07
reviews.title: Nice drive from 5000 ft up to 9200 ft.
reviews.comment: Beautifull alpine drive through the ski area of the winter olympics 2002. Ends in Park City. There you can visit the Tanger outlet centre for some shopping.

reviews.name: TwoByRV
reviews.title: Nice ride
reviews.comment: This is a nice easy ride for a day when you have a little time to spare. The road takes you up past residential homes and the two big ski resorts.

reviews.name: merryole
reviews.title: Pleasant hikes
reviews.comment: We have had a cabin near Brighton since the 1960s and love staying there. Highly recommend the Brighton Lakes hikes. Silver Lake Loop Trail is easy for anyone. The Lake Mary trail is a moderately strenuous but smooth trail; older folks can make it fine with several stops, up and down can be done in 3-5 hours. The hike can be extended to include a mountaintop as well as Twin Lakes

reviews.name: Elvira S
reviews.title: Mousse and calf
reviews.comment: Peaceful and lovely walks though mostly uphill. very BEAUTIFUL. There was plenty of local wildlife to experience .

reviews.name: barbara b
reviews.title: Snowbird
reviews.comment: Beautiful views on the way up the mountain which was 8000 feet.The uintah mountains run east and west.The only one that does that.

reviews.name: Mitch M
reviews.title: A nice scenic drive
reviews.comment: The drive takes about three hours with just a few stops and ins't hard or scary. There are plenty of turnouts and places to stop and hike. The trails are not very well marked so you need to plan ahead and get a map.

reviews.name: MTLPA
reviews.title: Worth the drive/hike to the top
reviews.comment: Although it's a fairly long drive to the top of the canyon (and back down) the views are spectacular and there is some great hiking at the top with a few lakes and lots of wildflowers in summer. Definitely worth the trip.

reviews.name: sujamohan
reviews.title: Great drive in the big cottonwood canyon
reviews.comment: We enjoyed a lovely scenic drive from park city to Salt lake city through the Gaurdsman pass and big cottonwood canyon. Worth it. I wish the hiking trails were better sign posted.

reviews.name: p2travels
reviews.title: enjoyed watching the Sunday cyclists
reviews.comment: beautiful drive. lots of photo ops. temps dropped about 10 degrees by the time we reached the end of the road ... about 9 miles.

reviews.name: NoIberostarFan
reviews.title: Go to Guardsman Pass
reviews.comment: If you go to the trouble to get up this beautiful canyon, invest the three more miles and go up to Guardsman Pass. There is some parking there to get out and look and it's a short drive down the other side to Deer Valley if you want.

reviews.name: Scajaquada
reviews.title: Hiking Gobblers Knob and Mount Raymond
reviews.comment:
I love to hike. I started this hike from the Big Cottonwood Canyon side at the Butler Fork trailhead which is exactly 8.2 miles from taking the left from Rte 210 onto Rte 190, on the left side.
The trail is very long. About 8 miles each way. Hiking to Dog Lake and then into the Olympus Wilderness from there. Do not go and take the Big or Little Water trail from Dog Lake. You can take the option of going left and forgoing the Dog Lake destination at the sign that says bear left for Mill A Basin and that takes you towards the Knob and mountain.
