The trail from the basin trail for the knob and or Mountain from Butler Fork and here is non descript. You'll have to make your own path up possibly until you get to the peak. The top is around 10,500'.
After quite albeit of time out there and a great challenging climb, with some rock scramble to Gobblers Knob, the return back down to join up with the Mills A Basin trail.
I ended up taking the ridge and then again down a dirt steep slope. After a full day of almost 5 hours hiking, the down return was quite challenging this route.
A beautiful hike. You definitely need to be in reasonable shape to do the Knob. Going to the mountain would definitely require more time or a dedicated trip and opt out of the Knob. The Goblers Knob in my own opinion is still a great destination.

reviews.name: BenjaminUnfried
reviews.title: GORGEOUS IN ALL SEASONS!
reviews.comment: Ski resorts are always fun no matter what season, and BCC offers incredible resorts for all ages. Plus, the resorts are so close to downtown and anywhere in the valley.

reviews.name: mleng
reviews.title: Beautiful and challenging hike in the woods
reviews.comment:
I did two hikes in one day at Big Cottonwood Canyon -- the Mill B South (aka Lake Blanche Trail) and Lake Mary Trail. Lake Blanche was more challenging -- took me 2.5 hours up and 1.5 hours down. Lake Mary was about 2 hours -- 1.2 hours up and 45 minutes down. You need to be in good physical shape to do Lake Blanche. But the good thing is that most of the Lake Blanche trail is in the shade, through the woods full of Aspen trees. One thing to note: 3/4 of the way up on the trail, it seemed to end at a big boulder field. There was no way to climb the bounders to the peak. I almost turned around and went back. Fortunately, my curiosity got better of me and I climbed the bounder field. 20 feet up, I saw a side trail that continued to the peak. So don't get discouraged by the boulder field -- just climb up and turn the corner.
Lake Mary trail didn't have much shade, but it's a lot shorter. For an average person who only has 2 or 3 hours, then Lake Mary would be a good choice.
Both had beautiful views at the end, with the lakes and mountains. If you are in SLC area and are an outdoor enthusiast, you definitely should make a trip to Big Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: Teresa H
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive!
reviews.comment: We loved this beautiful drive and the scenery is worth the trip!! We were there at the end of April and the snow was just gorgeous. This is a definite must if you are in the Salt Lake City area!

reviews.name: daddysizzle
reviews.title: Always a great time when you get out of the city.
reviews.comment: We spent three days at the Jordan Pines Campground in a family reunion. They only have group sites and so it was not busy with cars and only busy with the people you love. It warms up in the day, cools off at night, even when the city is above 100 degrees. The campground hosts were wonderful, fish were caught, wild life sighted, trails were hiked, campfires enjoyed and some of the best sleeping this summer. I always recommend visiting a state or national campground.

reviews.name: Sks121212
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I've lived in Utah for years and had never gone up Big Cottonwood Canyon. There are so many amazing hikes with gorgeous views. I've been back three times so far this summer. The only issue I had was all the other people enjoying the canyon. Parking is crazy. Definitely a must see!

reviews.name: ShoeLover2015
reviews.title: Magestic and beautiful!!!
reviews.comment: This canyon is gorgeous. There are hikes all the way up, lakes and trails. We ski it in the winter and we hike it in the summer. We love it!!!

reviews.name: Charity G
reviews.title: Great place for hikes and breakfast at Silver Fork Lodge & Restaurant
reviews.comment: While it has gotten a bit crowded over the last couple years it's still a favorite place to go for early morning, easy to moderate hikes and then breakfast on the back deck at Silver Fork Lodge. Mid-July is best if you want wildflowers, early October for fall colors and January-March if you enjoy snowshoeing.

reviews.name: DW B
reviews.title: Best place to get away to
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood canyon has Brighton and Solitude resorts along with side canyon trails. Skill levels for all ages and experience. Adventure for drivers and hikers. Take the drive over the top to Park City or Midway/Heber City. Pines, aspens, cottonwood and oak. Smells to delight the senses. Majestic granite peaks and shear walls give way to 100 mile vistas. Cold streams teaming with fish and calling out to you to soak for a bit. A must do Utah destination.

reviews.name: Scarhandpiper
reviews.title: A great place to beat the heat
reviews.comment:
When it gets hot in the Salt Lake valley (which it often does in summer), Big Cottonwood Canyon is a lovely place for a drive and/or a picnic to beat the heat.
Be wary of holidays, because everybody goes there, and it can get crowded. Reserve your picnic space weeks or months in advance.

reviews.name: DCockayne
reviews.title: We never tire of the beauty, but we're in danger of loving our canyons to death.
reviews.comment:
The drive up the canyon is a beautiful drive no matter what time you visit, and there's something to do for just about everyone. Plenty of trails to hike, there are several spots that get a lot of rock climbers, you can find great eats at the Silver Fork lodge and cafe, and of course there's the ski resorts of Brighton and Solitude. In Summer months, you can travel all the way up over the top of Guardsman Pass and then either pop over and drop down into Park City, or down into the Heber Valley. The turn backside of Guardsman was "paved" a season or two ago, with (I believe) reclaimed ground asphalt, so while it's not a dirt road now, it's still a bit rough. Guardsman Pass is closed in the Winter, but in the Summer, the top of the pass offers great views over the Heber Valley and surrounding mountains. Be aware though that a ton of people start their hiking and mountain biking day at the top of Guardsman, so summer weekends the parking and congestion there can get pretty crazy.
Keep an eye out in the Canyon for Moose, it's not unusual to see a couple hanging out around the Beaver Ponds. Make sure you stop to read about the "Blind Miner" that worked his claim in the Canyon. And with the popularity of drone photography, the "S Curves" are becoming a much "drone photographed" area. The S curves are also the parking area for several trailheads, so as with the top, parking here can get pretty busy.

reviews.name: TRA2
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon
reviews.comment: This is a very nice day trip if you are staying in Salt Lake City summer or winter the climb up is steep and be sure to use a low gear on your way down so you don't overheat your brakes. When your done with Big Cottonwood canyon head up Little Cottonwood Canyon it's just a short drive away and just as beautiful. If your in town during later September through early November the fall colors are spectacular you won't be disappointed remember use a lower gear on your way down enjoy....

reviews.name: NoMadsen
reviews.title: Beautiful Hiking
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a short distance from downtown Salt Lake City. The hikes are incredible in the summer and range from beginner to expert. For those interested in fishing, rock climbing, camping, and more — it's all available. A great place to start your adventures would be Donut Falls, an easier hike that is great for the family.

reviews.name: BRosswog
reviews.title: So lovely- but crowded year round.
reviews.comment: So close to Salt Lake City and worth a quick drive, but be prepared to have a tough time finding a parking spot during the busiest times of the year. Lots of wonderful hikes to choose from, wildlife aplenty and even some great places to eat.

reviews.name: pfefmeister
reviews.title: Can't Beat the Scenery
reviews.comment: We hiked the Lake Blanche trail - 2.8 miles one way - and were impressed with the alpine scenery and plentiful wildflowers. The hike is moderately uphill and rocky, so be prepared with plenty of water and grit. With so many hikes in the area, we pulled into the large parking lot and just headed up. Much cooler than SLC valley.

reviews.name: keeks623
reviews.title: My favorite place!
reviews.comment: Big cottonwood canyon is heaven on earth! So many awesome trails to hike and beautiful places to explore. July is a good time to see beautiful wild flowers and the fall colors are amazing too!

reviews.name: Bettandra
reviews.title: My Gorgeous Mountains!
reviews.comment: This is one of the most beautiful canyons in Utah. It's all green and full of pine trees and aspen trees. They have many picnic areas and several places higher up the canyon you can overnight camp. It has some amazing hikes. From easy to difficult you can find all you want. In this canyon you'll see Solitude Ski Resort. At the top of the canyon is Brighton. It's a popular ski resort. Silver Lake is up near Brighton. In the summer you can walk around the lake on the wooden walk path they have built. You'll see some of the most beautiful views in this canyon!

reviews.name: Larry F
reviews.title: What a fun place to visit!
reviews.comment: We took the tram to the top at Snowbird - to 11,100 feet above sea level. The scenery is magnificent!

reviews.name: Angie L
reviews.title: Easy walk, and pretty!
reviews.comment: We walked around the lake on a man-made boardwalk that was very easy. My five-year-old boy even wanted more of a challenging hike. Very pretty, and very busy on a hot Saturday. It was nice and pleasant up here compared to the 97 degree valley though. Next time...lake Blanche trail!!

reviews.name: Phyllis H
reviews.title: Nature's Beauty!
reviews.comment: What a beautiful ride up Big Cottonwood! Lots of places to stop, hike & breathe the fresh air. FABULOUS in the FALL! When you get to the top, you can take an easy hike around Silver Lake, sit on some benches & check out the scenery! On the way up or down, stop at The Silver Fork Lodge for a big or small meal, sit in or out & enjoy the view. If you are in the area, Big Cottonwood is a definitely worth the drive. Also, there are scenic pull overs! ENJOY!

reviews.name: Docsbob
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment:
We did the silver lake & twin lakes hikes. Silver Lake is super easy & amenible to strollers. The twin lakes hike was deceptively challenging for our 5 and 11 year old girls. ...pretty steep and rugged terrain with rocks. ...but they made it.
Didn't do any of the other hikes in the canyon. There are too many to count. But there should be something for everyone.

reviews.name: John P
reviews.title: Beautiful>>>>>>
reviews.comment: Take in the beautiful views along Guardsman Pass Road. We started along Big cottonwood road and ended up in Park City a quite little town build into the mountain side, we had already eaten lunch but there were many places to eat and shop.

reviews.name: Scott G
reviews.title: Bring a camera
reviews.comment: I have been up and down this canyon in all four seasons and it is simply stunning! Evening, about an hour before sunset is my favorite time to to enjoy the scenery and take pictures. There are plenty of hiking trails and if you are a fit cyclist, you can ride to the top. Just be sure to pack a windbreaker for the descent. Locals go up in the morning while it's cool and ride down once the temps rise.

reviews.name: cannonater
reviews.title: The Marys lake trail is a pretty good hike
reviews.comment: Went on this adventure with my daughter on a daddy daughter day hike. The run up to Marys Lake is about a third of the way up the total trail. It gets very steep towards the end. Total round trip about 6 miles and plan on about 4 hours.Its a good hike and not for a novice hiker..

reviews.name: Carol B
reviews.title: Spectacular canyon
reviews.comment: The majestic granite cliffs and the breath-taking vistas are impossible to describe. Don't miss seeing this if you are in the Salt Lake area. Take time to visit Snowbird and see the many attractions there for adults and families.

reviews.name: Andy
reviews.title: Great hike
reviews.comment: It was a great hike up to see Lake Mary. Well worth the hike. We had to take several breaks on the way up. If you are out of shape at all, then take some water and don't be ashamed to take those breaks. The lake is beautiful! Lots of little trails once you are there that you can explore. Trail was easy to follow.

reviews.name: educatorbks
reviews.title: Oasis Amid Heat
reviews.comment: Who knew that the two weeks I spent watching grandchildren would break record heat? It was hotter in Utah than it was in Texas, so visiting cool, beautiful Big Cottonwood Canyon provided a welcome respite. It is an easy drive from Salt Lake off 215 with beautiful picnic areas, hiking trails, and even caves. Silver Lake is not only beautiful but easily manageable even with young children. A boardwalk circles the lake, and signs provide interesting information. Park rangers were friendly and knowledgeable and added to the visit. While moose are in the area, we didn't see any during our visit. We did see a beaver dam, ducks, and beautiful flowers. It was 103 in the city but a cool 63 in the canyon. I highly recommend spending time in this beautiful area.

reviews.name: Tina H
reviews.title: Family Hike
reviews.comment: Our hike to Lake Mary was perfect for us & the kids. Elevation gain at the begining, but evens out. Views are fantastic!

reviews.name: TXAggies99
reviews.title: Pretty area short distance from SLC
reviews.comment: Not too far from Salt Lake City (SLC), this was a nice afternoon excursion. Partially shaded paths and a boardwalk area provide a good area to view some local birds and enjoy the scenery.

reviews.name: eliana23
reviews.title: Divine
reviews.comment: Weekends, especially holiday ones, are busy, so plan ahead. But the weather is lovely when the city gets hot. Silver Lake little trail is buggy but good for families--even with strollers. The lake is nothing to look at so don't be excited. But simply driving up the canyon is stunning and relaxing.

reviews.name: starfortune
reviews.title: What a "grand" canyon!
reviews.comment: A spectacular must drive while in Utah! Get the cameras out as I had both my Nikon and iPhone ready for action-you'll want to share with friends & family!

reviews.name: Rodney H
reviews.title: Getting out of the city
reviews.comment: Drove up to gardsman pass, was totally awesome, and the waterfall at the top of the S turn, fantastic

reviews.name: Carlo0647
reviews.title: Impressive and peaceful
reviews.comment: The car labored but we didn't realize why until we came down. The angle of ascent was significant! The place is beautiful, though, and well worth the drive. In Brighton is Silver Lake and the sub-alpine location was breathtaking and gorgeous. We did the plank walk around Silver Lake and, if we had had the proper equipment -- water supply particularly -- we probably would have taken the walk to Twin Lakes or to Lake Solitude. This truly is God's country and, if you're lucky, you'll see wildlife -- hopefully a moose.

reviews.name: GrandTour563191
reviews.title: Challenging but fun!
reviews.comment: There are several stops that you can choose to walk, we hiked Lake Blanche trail. There are bathrooms at the beginning of hike and a beautiful cold stream that leads you to a lake that is almost 3 miles one way up hill mostly and some bouldering. Bring plenty of water and enjoy all the wild flowers. It's worth every step.

reviews.name: Letsgonow65
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: It's an easy and short drive from SLC. The traffic was minimum and there are plenty of places to pull off the side of the road and look at the beautiful scenery and flowing water/water falls. Bring a lunch with you and have a picnic at Silver Lake. It's nice, easy walk if you aren't prepared to go on a true hike.

reviews.name: 1120ralph
reviews.title: Skiing at the Bird!
reviews.comment: What can I say. If you like great snow, this is the place to ski. Close to SLC and other major ski resorts. What's not to like? And if cold weather isn't your thing, nothing beats summer in the mountains in Utah.

reviews.name: Elishky
reviews.title: Incredible views!!
reviews.comment: This is such a beautiful area! Then, I've never been anywhere in the Rockies or the west that isn't. But this canyon is not overly steep and walking back the half mile trail to see the Donut Falls is a must! It's an easy to moderate hike that should take between 20-40 minutes depending on your speed. Try to park in the upper lot so you don't have an extra 2 miles of walking. Once you reach the falls, prepare to do some dangerous climbing if you actually want to get up to the falls. You WILL get wet if you want to get there as well. But you certainly don't need to to enjoy the beauty of the scenery!

reviews.name: captronz
reviews.title: Be nice to Bullwinkle
reviews.comment:
I go up into the Canyons on my Harley a lot during the summer to beat the heat. Big Cottonwood is one of my favorite Canyons to ride and go play in. The run up there is a sweet ride and posses scenic overkill at every turn. You can stop in at Solitude and snoop around. There are great opportunities to mountain bike or disc golf or hike till your legs give out. There are events at Solitude like the Sunday - 8/7/2016 Taste of the Wasatch. Check Solitudes website. If you go to the top at Brighton there is Silver Lake to see with a great Eco path around the lake to take a short hike around. There are other trails off the main one if you wish to hike up further to other mountain lakes to fish and enjoy. You may see Moose up there and some Japanese tourists frantically taking pictures of Moose foraging. I have seen bull and cow moose up there. Keep your distance and don't try to pet them or feed them. Just take pictures and enjoy them ... at a distance. I fired up my bike with Bullwinkle about 150 yards away and that got his attention as his head popped up with that huge rack to see if I was a threat. Their eyesight isn't all that good but he can smell real well. I dropped it into gear and made way for the exit.
Go up, cool off, have fun and enjoy the squirrels and chipmunks also(bring nuts and sunflower seed).

reviews.name: caraamcgee
reviews.title: Downhill Run
reviews.comment: I participated in a downhill run in Big Cottonwood Canyon. It was a steep decline for 13.1 miles and I was certainly sore for several days, but the view was absolutely worth it. It was absolutely gorgeous. I arrived at Solitude at about 0430 and watched the sun rise while waiting for the start of the run. It was easily one of the most beautiful locations I've found on my quest to run a half marathon on each of the 50 states.

reviews.name: ptquelet
reviews.title: Amazing Sites! Good Verizon cell service in canyon!
reviews.comment:
--Amazing drive. Close to Salt Lake City.
--One lane road, but enough room to pull off or pass someone many places.
--Many hiking trails. Several lakes to see at the top.
--Ski resorts up there.
--Great cell service all the way up the canyon! Great plus to use GPS or Google Maps to find your way!

reviews.name: Dave H
reviews.title: Beautiful Wasach Canyon
reviews.comment: The drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon and over the summit to Park City is beautiful and well worth the time.

reviews.name: Mike F
reviews.title: Mountain biking
reviews.comment:
If you want some of the best cross country mountain biking, you have to ride the Crest trail. You can do an out and back starting at the top of the canyon, or you can meet a shuttle and do a one way (mostly downhill from the canyon over to Millcreek canyon). A few of the large
Mountain bike magazines have rated the Crest trail as one of the top trails in the nation. (This review won't even talk about the amazing skiing)

reviews.name: Marci H
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: So much to do!!!! There are many hikes ranging from easy to wayyyyy difficult. It's beautiful all year, easy to find and navigate.

reviews.name: Perthenia
reviews.title: Lovely Escape to the Mountains
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood provides a lovely and quick escape from the heat. We went up to see the wildflowers, and although we were a little early for the season, there were several different types of forbs. The parking areas can get busy on the weekends - get there early for hiking/picnicking.

reviews.name: jorosie1
reviews.title: Beautiful, beautiful...any time of the year!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is one of the most spectacular canyons in Utah. A short 15 minute from SLC center, you enter into an amazing deep canyon with a wonderful river running right next to the road. There are many picnic areas and overnight sites on the way up. Pack up a lunch and explore! There are several trails that take you to waterfalls and beautiful open areas of wild flowers. If you have time, stop at Silver Fork Lodge and have breakfast, lunch or dinner...their patio is amazing! There are 2 ski areas up this canyon...Brighton and Solitude. Both have amazing skiing and great lodges.

reviews.name: Karin K
reviews.title: gorgeous canyon
reviews.comment: This is my favorite of all the canyons. There is an S curve and a cut through that are photographable. At the end is Sliver Lake, great from good weather walks on a boardwalk or for cross country skiing in the winter.

reviews.name: teacher_rossi
reviews.title: Gorgeous Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment:
What can I say about this canyon? Living in Colorado, I can safely say I have seen some beautiful outdoor venues. Cottonwood Canyon definitely ranks up there with the best of what Colorado has to offer.
The canyon is easy to get to from I-15. The entire drive up the canyon is beautiful. And to top it off, their website is easy to navigate and makes finding trails a snap.

reviews.name: Jackiegh
reviews.title: Good hiking- close to SLC
reviews.comment: This was a good activity in the 2-3 hour window we had available. There are going trails alongside a river. It's beautiful.

reviews.name: MelissaL0715
reviews.title: Beautiful, but a steep drive. Close to city. Worth the drive
reviews.comment: My daughter & I recently visited Salt Lake City and when it became busy downtown during rush hour, we opted to drive through Big Cottonwood Canyon. As you can see in the photos we are submitting, it is very beautiful. We stopped to take photos with the creeks/streams, as well as the mountain views. Worth the 20 minutes outside of downtown. Our rental car had a bit of a tough time climbing the steep mountain, but if you have a stronger car, you can probably go all the way to the ski area at the top (we did not).

reviews.name: pedsnephron
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: We drove over Guardsman Pass from Park City narrow winding road, would not recommend taking a camper. We enjoyed the Donut Falls hike. We parked on the highway (cottonwood canyon road). Took us 75 min round trip, but at a modest pace. Easy to do with kids.

reviews.name: dragonflytw65
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: A friend from the area took us here for a short hike/walk. The drive through the canyon was stunning. It was around 7:00 in the evening and the temperature was cool in spite of the fact that that it had been close to 100 degrees in the valley during the day. Our walk around the lake was short, but what we saw was varied, big pines, aspens, flowers and views of amazing rocks. It was wonderful to see so many people enjoying the outdoors. I didn't want to leave. I am looking forward to visiting more often and exploring this canyon from corner to corner.

reviews.name: Ann S
reviews.title: Like driving through a postcard
reviews.comment:
Soul food, pure soul food
I live in Virginia, Northern Virginia, where life is busy and we live compressed.
The foot hills and mountains in this part of Utah are soul food. The fresh clear space graces one with unconditional peace.

reviews.name: RDB2004
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is an easy drive into the mountains. By continuing on the road through the canyon, one passes ski lifts that offer scenic rides in the summer and then on to Park City itself.

reviews.name: halilley
reviews.title: Get out more!
reviews.comment: Stunning scenery, this is the road to Brighton (s ski resort) and Silver Lake. Still some snow about.

reviews.name: LizzyB01
reviews.title: Silver Lake and Guardans' pass are my favs
reviews.comment: hiking around Silver lake to all the nearly lakes are very rewarding. Fishing is fun in the Silver lake as well. Guardsmans pass is always an exciting drive with rewarding views!

reviews.name: TheSuze12
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment: We drove to the top of the mountain and had the wonderful experience of snow in June. The drive was beautiful and there were many spots to hike and take beautiful photos. Be sure to stop at Silver Fork Lodge for a wonderful lunch on the deck.

reviews.name: darlis73
reviews.title: Go with Salt Lake City Guided Tours
reviews.comment: We had a wonderful tour with SLC Guided Tours to the Wasatch Mountains. Brett was our guide and he was knowledgeable, fun and ver accommodating. If you want a great tour with great customer safety and satisfaction, I highly recommend this company! We went on 3 tours with this company and they are fantastic. Brett went above and beyond to give us a great experience!

reviews.name: scotiajim
reviews.title: Worth a drive up
reviews.comment: Amazing drive up through the canyon to Brighton or over Guardsman's Pass to Park City. Lots of hiking trails and scenic views along the way.

reviews.name: Jemmerson
reviews.title: Escape the city smog and heat!
reviews.comment: Leave the smog and the heat of SLC behind and enjoy a quick drive to one of the many many hiking trails available up Big Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: Becky D
reviews.title: Beautiful drive!
reviews.comment: We always drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon when in the Salt Lake City area! Beautiful drive! Solitude and Brighton ski areas are beautiful even without snow!

reviews.name: Bill S
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views
reviews.comment: We drove through the canyon on a rainy day and it was still absolutely beautiful! Bring your camera! You can just take a drive or you can drive and hike the many beautiful trails. Plan on at least an hour if you want to drive and take a few pictures otherwise take your time and get out and hike and spend the whole day there! It's hard to beat free!

reviews.name: Roni E
reviews.title: Breath taking scenery and hiking!
reviews.comment: This amazing canyon is home to some of the best hiking in the world. The Brighton lakes, including Lake Mary, are some of the most beautiful alpine lakes in the world. The hike is not too difficult. I rate it as a moderate hike.

reviews.name: Tomas W
reviews.title: ski in winter trail on summer
reviews.comment: At least 20 degrees cooler than Salt lake city. It is the best place to stay in Summer There are many walking trail in the area. Some of them are difficult and some of them are short and easy, which are suitable for seniors

reviews.name: Silverwoods
reviews.title: Incredible hiking in the Wasatch mountains
reviews.comment: This beautiful canyon on the way up to Solitude and Brighton is a hiking paradise. We did a 2.6 mile hike (1 way) up to Dog Lake. It was beautiful and serene. It was also a bit of a challenge which I really liked. The payoff at the end was the quiet, remote and tranquil dog lake. Very much worth the effort. When you get back down, go to the Silver Fork Lodge for a pint. Sit on the back deck.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Visited this canyon 3 times in 1 week!!
reviews.comment: Always love driving up this canyon. We went three times! Had one beautiful sunny day and two snowy days. Loved the snow days! Had so much fun walking in the Silver Lake area. The lake area still had LOTS of snow! You need to take this FREE drive. Stop often to enjoy the views. Silver Lake charges during the winter for cross country skiing and snowshoeing ($5/adult).

reviews.name: Still Crazy after all these years
reviews.title: Awesome scenery with great hiking trails
reviews.comment: We were very impressed with the trails and scenery in the area.. definitely would visit again. We hiked for 4 days and had a marvelous time

reviews.name: RayMiami
reviews.title: This place is amazing
reviews.comment: The snow was melting and the skiing resorts were close for the season but the place kept its beauty. If you are in Salt Lake City for a day and have a car take the drive all the way to the end of the Canyon it is breath taking.

reviews.name: Jennifer J
reviews.title: Alpine Splendor in the Wasatch
reviews.comment:
Whatever your outdoor activities, this canyon has it all in spades--best Skiing in the world, gorgeous hiking, biking and whatever your fancy in Autumn, Spring and Summer.
Snowbird Resort has fantastic amenities for everyone in the family--catch Octoberfest in the fall and ride the tram to the top. Mountain majesty that compares to the European Alps.

reviews.name: pray4powder
reviews.title: Great skiing in the winter; hiking and mountain biking in the summer
reviews.comment: In addition, stop at the Silver Fork lodge for breakfast. I recommend the corn-beef hash, but they turn-off the breakfast menu at about 11:00 am.

reviews.name: loielee
reviews.title: So Beautiful here
reviews.comment: I love going up this canyon. My most favorite thing to do is walk around Silver Lake. It is so peaceful here, it makes me feel like I'm on vacation even though it's close to home. The mountain air is awesome.

reviews.name: walkingjudi
reviews.title: Spectacular hikes
reviews.comment: The hiking trails are well maintained, and there are hikes to suit every level of fitness. It's especially beautiful in the fall. I hike there frequently.

reviews.name: Clark H
reviews.title: Classic Canyon Experience
reviews.comment: The largest and most varied canyon in the Wasatch with miles of hiking trails, two ski resorts, great cross country skiing, and a variety of lakes. The Best of the Wasatch!

reviews.name: bbfgator
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Enjoyed our ride through the canyon last week. Was surprised that Guardsman Pass still closed. Silver Lake was beautiful but boardwalk still covered in snow....we walked on the snow around though. Some of the lake was melted but 75% still covered. Beautiful area. Donut Falls hike was a nice hike although we thought a little tougher than easy but then we're flat-landers from Florida.

reviews.name: WasatchDave
reviews.title: Wonderful mountain get-away a few miles from the city
reviews.comment: We drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon several times a year. Especially enjoy hiking around Silver Lake at Brighton and spending a few nights with family at Solitude Ski Resort during the summer. The Spruces campground can't be beat. A road over the mountain from Brighton takes you to Park City or Heber Valley.

reviews.name: HeyRossi
reviews.title: Rock climbing and hiking playground
reviews.comment:
This canyon is just a short drive from Salt Lake City and no matter your skill level, you can find a great activity.
The ski resorts Brighton and Solitude are located up this canyon, as well as popular hikes such as Lake Blanche and White Pine and Red Pine Lakes.
There is also incredible sport rock climbing ranging from easier routes to belay into to more challenging routes.
Don't miss this canyon if you're in the area.

reviews.name: RoNeh
reviews.title: Nice place to drive/hike
reviews.comment: My friends had a few hours to spend in SLC. We drove around Big Cottonwood Canyon and admire the beauty of Mother Nature! Winding roads and big canyon mountains. People hiking and biking. It's peaceful and beautiful to observe nature!

reviews.name: Tyler Wall
reviews.title: Hike up to the Lakes at Brighton!
reviews.comment: The lakes up at Brighton ski resort are great summer activities! If you are visiting in the winter, this canyon holds two ski resorts (I would recommend going to Brighton)

reviews.name: jdms33
reviews.title: Breathtaking drive....
reviews.comment: We drove both Big Cottonwood Canyon and Little Cottonwood Canyon. Both are awesome. In Big Cottonwood Canyon there are many more trail heads and places to stop. Can you not help but feel insignificant in the scope of the deep canyon and high rock faces.

reviews.name: JonLVL
reviews.title: Beauty All Around
reviews.comment: Spent two days taking pictures and hiking to water falls. Natural beauty except for the litter. In two days I picked up over a hundred items including a tire. If I hiked down to take pictures I always carried out someone else disrespect with me. I dose not take much to clean up after yourself.

reviews.name: Richard F
reviews.title: A Fun Daytime Activity
reviews.comment: This was one of the most enjoyable things we did when we visited Salt Lake City. We drove all around and hiked some of the trails. There are plenty of places to pull in and park. Some of the trails are fairly easy to hike and the scenery is just gorgeous.

reviews.name: Kjay200
reviews.title: One of the reasons I moved here!
reviews.comment: You cannot beat the beauty of the mountains surrounding Salt Lake city. Within a twenty minute drive, you are in the foothills full of hiking trails and gorgeous views.

reviews.name: Tara T
reviews.title: Nice get away!
reviews.comment: Our family of 7, kids aged 4-19 love to visit Big Cottonwood Canyon. Lots of good parking, great hikes and picnic areas. Overnight camping in the Spruces is enjoyable. Great family time!!!

reviews.name: Alebert G
reviews.title: Great place to snowshoe
reviews.comment: Hiked up toward White Pine lake and found a nice open spot with a view. Dug a picnic table in the snow for the 5 of us and had a wine and cheese party. Beautiful!

reviews.name: Toadhollowtravellers
reviews.title: The scenery never gets old
reviews.comment: We travel to SLC two or three times a year to visit family. We always drive up through the canyon, usually stopping at Silver Fork Lodge for a bite to eat or to sit on their deck and view the mountains. This canyon is beautiful during all seasons!

reviews.name: Emilee C
reviews.title: Beauty right outside of the city.
reviews.comment: If you are looking for a place to hike, a place to ski, or just in need of a scenic drive this is the best place to do so. I love the drive up to Brighton from here. It is beautiful in winter, spring, summer or fall. Although I have not tried many hikes, the few I have been on are exquisite and I find any excuse to be up in the canyon and in those beautiful mountains.

reviews.name: zoltan p
reviews.title: An all season paradise
reviews.comment:
From Spring's awakening through Summer , Autumn and Winter; thousands of different
adventures from hiking, walking or simple nature outings make this canyon so much more than a sights for ski-resorts....and the skiing it's absolutely unique , definetely
not a ' run of the mill !

reviews.name: Aubreestravel
reviews.title: What a beautiful way to spend a day
reviews.comment: We so completely enjoyed our day in this beautiful canyon!!! Gorgeous place! Visually stunning everywhere you looked. I can't wait to go back when we have more time!!!

reviews.name: Travelista Joy
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon: A Nature Lover's Wonderland
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a dramatic scenic drive with picnicking, camping, hiking, biking and stunning beauty all the way along. After you've driven about 10 or 11 miles, you arrive at Solitude and Brighton Ski Resorts, both excellent in their own ways. If it's spring, summer or fall, I highly recommend a 30-40 minute walk around the nearby Silver Lake boardwalk. It's good for baby strollers, wheelchairs and all ages and fitness levels. The more adventurous can also take a hiking trail up the mountain. We have often spotted Moose and deer right around the lake. This is a fabulous place to snap family photos.

reviews.name: phyrman21
reviews.title: The Whole Canyon?
reviews.comment: Kind of strange that I am being asked to rate an entire canyon. Big Cottonwood canyon is a great place to visit with many natural attractions to offer. During the winter months, two wonderful ski resorts are located in the canyon. In the summer months, mountain biking, hiking, camping, etc activities are available high and low. Many rock climbing routes are scattered throughout the canyon as well. Great mountain scenery, especially in the fall as the leaves change color. There are many day route hikes of varying degrees, great fishing holes along the river, and on and on.

reviews.name: ERFSU82
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon any time of year.
reviews.comment: I've visited Big Cottonwood in the summer, fall, and winter, and it's beautiful any time of year. Whether you simply want a scenic drive or are looking for more adventurous outdoor activities, you'll find it here. Just 20 minutes from downtown SLC, you'll feel much further away once you enter the canyon. The road up the canyon is about 15 miles long, taking you past sheer cliffs, soaring peaks, and amazing rock formations. There are several spots along the way for hiking, viewing, and photo-taking. At the end of the canyon sit Solitude and Brighton ski areas, both of which offer outstanding skiing at a much lower price and with far fewer crowds than the Park City ski areas. In the summer, fall and spring, you can drive the Guardsman Pass road up and over the mountain to Deer Valley and Park City. The drive takes about 20-30 minutes and provides some incredible views, especially as you cross over the pass. At the pass, there is a small dirt parking area, where you can park your car and go for a hike. From there, you can hike up the backside of Jupiter Bowl and have a beautiful view of the Park City ski area, looking down through Thaynes Canyon.

reviews.name: Jannette Z
reviews.title: Outdoors persons, this is the place to go
reviews.comment:
The beautiful canyons around in Utah, each has his own beauty, none alike.
Go hiking, ride a bike, or just stroll , what ever you feel like, there special paths you can take, it tells you how far it will be, enjoy the creeks, flowers, trees, deer, birds, even eagles, if your in the right spot and other animals. But of course remember these are wild animals, careful there also might be bears, mountain lions and cougars, and moose's, so stay together, keep dogs on the lease, little one close by.
As of now there is SNOW, so dress warm, always bring something, like water to drink, and know what to do, when you get lost, charge the cellphone, just in case.
DON"T play games on your devices or listen to music, so you can ENJOY everything around you, and be aware of your surroundings. Inhale the fresh air and enjoy the views, it's a pure delight, I love the mountains and the seasons that change them, don't just take my word for it, GO and SEE it for yourself.

reviews.name: Richard H
reviews.title: Summer's Air Conditioning
reviews.comment:
Imagine a sweltering day of 90 degrees outside.
You want to be outside, and you want to relax...what can you do?
Head to the canyon! The air temperature suddenly drops nearly twenty degrees as you ascend the canyon road into the mountains. From here, you can bike, jog, walk, hike...its wonderful!

reviews.name: Carol G
reviews.title: Great Summer Hiking Trails
reviews.comment: Hiking for every level of energy and experience. Various lake hikes and paths through mountain meadows.

reviews.name: dstante
reviews.title: Something for all seasons
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is about 20 miles or so from Salt Lake International Airport. Whether you're looking for hiking trails, rock climbing, mountain biking, skiing, or just a scenic drive, Big Cottonwood is well worth a visit.
Two ski resorts, Solitude & Brighton, are in Big Cottonwood, as well as mountain bike trails, hiking trails and several beautiful picnic areas. And even if you're not into any of that, its a beautiful drive to the top and back.

reviews.name: 467kristia
reviews.title: Gorgeous Canyon to Explore Any Season
reviews.comment: I grew up near Big Cottonwood Canyon and still think it is one of the most beautiful places to get out and explore nature. During the warmer months you'll find hikers, bikers and runners enjoying the canyon. Our kids especially love the hike to Donut Falls, an easy walk with a very rewarding and unique waterfall at the end. Those training for a downhill marathon will find Big Cottonwood Canyon a great place to train!

reviews.name: Janice G
reviews.title: Skiing, hiking, biking, running, walking 15 minutes from downtown Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: Don't miss it! Solitude Ski Resort and Brighton Ski resort are just two of the reasons to enjoy this spectacular canyon right in the heart of Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: Dan W
reviews.title: How can you not like beautiful scenery?
reviews.comment: It doesn't matter what kind of outdoor experience you are looking for; you will find it in Big Cottonwood Canyon. You can rock climb, ski, hike, picnic or just on your duff and enjoy being outside. DON'T BRING YOUR PETS. This is a watershed for the Salt Lake Valley.

reviews.name: Ann S
reviews.title: Mountain Getaway
reviews.comment: We live 45 miles away from Big Cottonwood Canyon and go here to soak up the natural beauty. We always bring our guests to visit this beautiful canyon! It offers XC and downhill skiing in the winter, a handicapped-accessible trail around Silver Lake, and a quaint eating establishment called The Silver Fork Lodge, which has a patio with a gorgeous view! Bring your cameras!

reviews.name: Bonnie W
reviews.title: What is not to like?
reviews.comment: All the canyons in Utah are spectacular. Scenery is breathtaking no matter what season you are lucky enough to drive up. Each visit will be different.

reviews.name: teuscher3
reviews.title: This canyon has it all.
reviews.comment: This canyon has it all to take in. Hiking, Skiiing, Snowshoeing, bird watching. It is a great place to go and get lost.

reviews.name: ssmlutah
reviews.title: A picnic with a walk
reviews.comment: At the top of BCC on the right hand side of the road right before Brighton park is a great place to take a walk with your family (teens or young children)or a date. You can pack a picnic and take an easy casual walk on a path that circles the pond and goes through the trees and around the park. There are places your kids can explore, go fishing or just look at the ducks. It's also a beautiful place to take fall pictures. This is one of my husbands, you can see his landscape pictures on Instagram or smugmug Steve Schaefer

reviews.name: pickling
reviews.title: Beauty and options for exploring
reviews.comment: A natural retreat from the haze or heat of the city. Plenty of options for hikes, long, short, steep, less steep, but all have a view of something or another, if only the peaks surrounding the canyon. Go frequently.

reviews.name: Scott B
reviews.title: Completely different terrain
reviews.comment: We hiked big cottonwood canyon and thought it was beautiful! There is a wide variety of rocks and just breath taking views. We would recommend this to all outdoorsy people in the area!

reviews.name: bearitcee
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: Big cottonwood canyon offers many sights for taking it all in. There are many hiking options as you go up the canyon and then at the very top you have Brighton Ski resort and just down the hill, Solitude. Both are wonderful during the summer or winter. Winter is the more popular option - as it is skiing, in Utah. Summer offers some serious hiking though and should not be understated. I would definitely recommend taking this beautiful place in. Bring your camera!

reviews.name: Gae93
reviews.title: Awesome Canyon
reviews.comment: In the fall the colors are magnificent. There are may hiking trails going up the canyon. The ski areas are among the best in Utah. Fresh powder is great to ski. They are camp grounds up the canyon that are large and lead to great hiking,

reviews.name: Kaye N
reviews.title: Beautiful drives - best in spring or fall
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful canyon to drive through, especially in spring when the wildflowers are blooming or fall when the leaves are spectacular!

reviews.name: K S
reviews.title: Best part of your trip
reviews.comment: Just spent the weekend in SLC and found this road on my last day. Was a beautiful drive and loved hiking up the mountain trying to find the falls in the snow (thank you to the gentleman who escorted us to them since all the signs were covered with snow and we were way above them on the mountain). Will definitely go again and spend more time next visit. The views and stops along the way gave us more impressions of the area that we were expecting.

reviews.name: Lisa P
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery
reviews.comment: This canyon is beautiful, no matter what time of year you go! during the summer months, there are great hiking trails for all ages and skill levels. There are a few different day use and overnight camping sites that are well maintained and easily accessible; however, they do fill up quickly. One of my favorite things to do in the canyon is to take a walk around Silver Lake. The trail is easy to navigate, even with young children, and there are benches and tables along the way so that you can sit and enjoy the scenery.

reviews.name: JP M
reviews.title: Wonderful mountain views, great hiking
reviews.comment: You want to step out of your car and into the great mountains of Utah? Take a drive up Big Cottonwood canyon. There is awesome hiking to be had at almost every turn, and there are good local places to grab a beer and some food, including at the Solitude and Brighton resorts. My favorite hike is the Brighton Lakes trail (just under 7 miles round trip, not terribly challenging).

reviews.name: JudgeDredd76
reviews.title: One of the more popular canyons along the Wasatch Front
reviews.comment: Some of the best winter and summer outdoor activities can be done up this canyon. Hence the reason why it is getting so overly crowded these days.On the really crowded days I avoid this canyon.

reviews.name: R L
reviews.title: Beautiful for ALL Adventurers
reviews.comment: Whether it's taking it easy or making it a true test of endurance you can find it in Big Cottonwood. Beautiful in the summer and amazing in the winter as you hit the slopes for a skiing adventure. A MUST see and do for everyone

reviews.name: Jeff R
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: Have had the privilege of driving through here in winter and summer and it's beautiful. Winter can be a little sporting with the traffic of buses and cars come and going from ski resorts

reviews.name: Jennifer P
reviews.title: good hiking
reviews.comment: Go up to donut falls. Its a nice hike. The top broke off. But its still a great waterfall. Take a bottle of water, its a bit of a walk.

reviews.name: Donna J
reviews.title: Views that can't be beat!
reviews.comment: This is one of several canyons in the area, but Big Cottonwood is one of my favorites. There's amazing trails, waterfalls and lakes, along with amazing skiing on some of the greatest snow on earth. During the warmer months you can hit Guardman's pass and drive over the mountain into Park City. Whether you're a camper, hiker, skier or just love to get out of the city, Big Cottonwood is just minutes away.

reviews.name: runsuerun60
reviews.title: Incredible Hiking and Amazing Views
reviews.comment: This is one of my favorite places in the Salt Lake area. The drive alone is worth your time but if you can stop and do some hiking you won't be sorry. Donut Falls is quick and easy and Lake Blanche is longer but worth it. Storm Mountain is imposingly beautiful and the two ski resorts are worth your time - Brighton and Solitude. Walking around Silver Lake is a great activity for young children at the Brighton Resort.

reviews.name: MondoViaggio16
reviews.title: Best Place Ever LOVE IT
reviews.comment: If you are in the area you have to go up and hike the many hikes around the canyon. It is amazing. Hike to Lake Banche it is stunning. You can even get to the top of the canyon at Brighton and hike around the lakes up there. My Millicent is pretty awesome, it is a hard hike though just be advised.

reviews.name: John N
reviews.title: Best Moose viewing in the Salt Lake City area.
reviews.comment: I live two minutes from the entrance to the canyon. A 20 minute drive up the canyon ends at the little town of Brighton. In winter a great little ski resort. Year round a greast place to look for Moose. Early morning hikes it is almost a sure thing to come upon a family of moose. Excellent photo opportunities but do not get too close when you see females with their young. They do get mean. Always keep a tree between you and the moose. Walking around the boardwalk at Silver Lake is a great hike. Do look on both sides of the road during the drive up and down the canyon for all the other fauna. A side trip up Gardsman pass will lead you into Park City or Heber Valley if you want to make a day trip.

reviews.name: 901Annie
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: We love Big Cottonwood Canyon! There are so many things to do! In September is an awesome marathon and half marathon down the canyon. The canyon contains many hiking trails, beautiful campgrounds and the ski resorts are amazing not only in winter but Spring, summer and fall. You can find Silver Lake at the very top of BC which is a simple and flat place to walk. The lake is beautiful and surrounded by paths and Boardwalk. It is a perfect hike for children as you can even push a stroller. If you are lucky you will catch a glimpse of one of the local Moose.

reviews.name: Sira G
reviews.title: Beautiful View of Mountains
reviews.comment: We visited here in the Winter so we did not see the Lake however the view of the snow on the mountains is beautiful and breathtaking.

reviews.name: psoulliere
reviews.title: Panoramic & Close-In Views - Superb
reviews.comment: visited several areas including: breathtaking views from "Snowbird", followed by a drive east on the 190 (Big Cottonwood Creek road) which had an awesome stop area 3 - 5 mile east of hwy 215 where we took excellent pictures looking upward of each other after walking up a good rocky trail The HIGHLIGHT for me. The drive further east crossing over to Deer Valley Creek to the 224 was fabulous. Drive north to Park City was great, driving south afterwards to Midway was not really interesting better to drive east towards the 189 or north to Park City. Hope this helps. You can ask for more info at paul.ageloc at gmail dot com. Thanks.

reviews.name: Hartimage
reviews.title: Great, in both the Summer and Winter.
reviews.comment: Snowshoed up from Big Cottonwood toward Cardiff pass. Beautiful scenery, lots of snow, super nice people on the trail. Going back with our tele skis and skins!

reviews.name: ScubaSteve801
reviews.title: Gorgeous canyon in the SLC area
reviews.comment: If you're in the SLC area, definitely make time to take a drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon. Gorgeous views and a really fun drive!

reviews.name: Melissa S
reviews.title: Beautiful anytime of the year
reviews.comment: Such a beautiful canyon, a great place for hiking or just a drive in the fresh air. It is VERY busy during the summer months, plan ahead for parking.

reviews.name: giovannonislc
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood is a must see!
reviews.comment: Beautiful, varied outdoor activities, every age will love it. Every season is a new experience in Big Cottonwood.

reviews.name: Randy R
reviews.title: Beautiful Winter Scenery
reviews.comment: We enjoyed a beautiful drive through Big Cottonwood Canyon on the way to a ski area. The canyon is rocky and filled with pine trees and views of craggy peaks. The road condition is excellent and clean restrooms are located along the way.

reviews.name: Michelle B
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: So much to do and see! Great for a nice Sunday drive, several hiking trails with various difficulty levels, camping spots. Absolutely beautiful!

reviews.name: John W
reviews.title: The American Alps
reviews.comment: Driving and stopping along the way was the way to go for us. The narrow road is very beautiful to drive, but stop often. Look up and see the scenery of the sky against the shadows of the trees and mountains. It is holy and makes you feel like reading Henry David Thoreau as he would also be impressed. This canyon is still unspoiled by the public such as the roads in California and Aspen near Denver are always mad with traffic. This is a quiet and exciting place to visit.

reviews.name: Cody S
reviews.title: Always Great!
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is always amazing! Summer, Fall, Winter, or Spring, it never disappoints! It is always beautiful. It is also a fun drive. It is the gateway to adventure in Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: agbs
reviews.title: Take A Basic Geology Class On Site!
reviews.comment:
One travels through eons of geologic formations while driving, biking or hiking Big Cottonwood Canyon, one of Salt Lake's sources for culinary water as well as a premier skiing area in the winter.
A favorite camping and picnic and hiking area, there are endless things to do in this beautiful Wasatch Mountains canyon.
One can stay at Solitude or in cabins along the canyon or eat at the old Silver Fork Lodge, famous for its sour dough pancakes and elderberry pie. Sit on the deck and bird watch while enjoying wine and a great meal!

reviews.name: Wenny L
reviews.title: beautiful canyon with lots of hiking trails
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful canyon with lots of hiking trails. However, one thing to be cautious is that both Big Cottonwood Canyon and Little Cottonwood canyon are water shed for salt lake county. Dogs, even on leash, are not permitted due to concern of polluting the water. If you bring your pets and get caught, you could be fined $100. Otherwise, it's a great place for great hiking.

reviews.name: Scott S
reviews.title: lovely, beautiful, spectacular all year long
reviews.comment: Fabulous place for hiking, rock climbing, skiing, walking, and anything related to nature. A real delight.

reviews.name: Jamie P
reviews.title: Bust
reviews.comment: Absolutely stunning area... but there are soooo many people its extremely hard to enjoy it, let alone find a parking spot on the side of a road that miles long. Sorry but when I think nature, I dont think of 5,000 people being stuffed into a canyon with me. Drove the entire road all the way up and over to Park City. Wasnt impressed my any means...

reviews.name: jonoff
reviews.title: Luscious Lakes
reviews.comment: We took a couple hours to visit Lake Blanche from the Mill B trailhead, it was well worth the time. It is not a super difficult trail if you are used to hiking, and don't go during the hottest part of the day. It took a little less than 2 hours one way, and we saw a number of others there, camping and fishing at the lake. Very gorgeous views not far from the city.

reviews.name: R0wi3
reviews.title: Great Roads
reviews.comment: We drove through Cottonwood Canyon on the way to do the Donut Falls Hike. It had snowed pretty heavily the night before, we were heading out there about 9 - 9.30am & the roads were amazing. No slippery sections or anything. Although there was a few spots to pull over, we didn't want to stop & take any photo's because there was a lot of cars heading up towards the ski resorts & everything was just white anyway. It's great to see that the area is so well maintained.

reviews.name: Jim L
reviews.title: Just missed the fall “peak” colors, but it was still gorgeous
reviews.comment: By buddy (local) drove me (tourist) all around this area, and I loved it. Absolutely awesome scenery, and I was able to get some good photos. Careful if you stop on the side of the road (narrow); better to wait for turnouts, but there are many cars parked on weekends when the weather is good (trail heads abound). Note: portions of the scenic roadways are closed during winter.

reviews.name: jennstar79
reviews.title: Slesding and hiking
reviews.comment: We had a fabulous time driving in the snowy mountains, went to a sledding spot, and also did a short water fall hike. Our kids and we enjoyed the visit with my sister in law and her family.

reviews.name: Richard B
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: We drove this wounderfull Canyon and the scenery was well worth the trip we wher lucky because it was just into fall and some of the colours were quite amazing loved id

reviews.name: Peta T
reviews.title: Lovely drive up Route 190
reviews.comment:
When we drove up it was a perfect day.. some fantastic views and a little snow. The rock faces were amazing.. especially sprinkled with a little snow.
Ski season hadn't started yet (the lifts weren't running) but the snow makers were going in some places so I assume it will happen very soon.
Good roads and some lovely scenery.. we didn't venture off the road but I am sure some of the hikes would be spectacular.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Our first snow day
reviews.comment: Our son drove us up the canyon because he knew it was snowing. We saw a moose about half way up the canyon! We walked around part of Silver Lake and watch the snow making machines making snow at Brighton(fun for us Gulf Coast living people). Silver lake has never failed to amaze us with its beauty. This is a very pleasant drive. One of the must dos when in the SLC area. There is sometimes a charge for Silver lake in the winter time because of snowshoeing and cross country skiing. $5/person. Lake is FREE the other months.

reviews.name: 88suzyq
reviews.title: Beautiful drive any time of hear
reviews.comment: We've skied this canyon, hiked this canyon, attended weddings, and picnicked for years in this beautiful setting. Brighton and Solitude are less expensive to ski in season, and summer weddings can be low key and lovely. It's close enough to the city to be convenient, yet creates a wonderful getaway.

reviews.name: Mark K
reviews.title: Best in winter
reviews.comment: Many excellent trails, and excellent access to the city. It's nice to be able to stay in town, but get out into really nice, if a bit steep, hiking in less than a half hour.

reviews.name: lunarluau
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: Absolutely awes inspiring. So much area for hiking. Did a 5 mile loop about nine miles up the mountain in search of Sasquatch. Didn't find him, but the hike was amazing. Nothing but spectacular scenery everywhere.

reviews.name: Courtney H
reviews.title: Easily Accessible Trip Outside SLC
reviews.comment: Do your homework and plan ahead! It is best to know which trails you want to take (and which are currently open). We had a great hike up from Brighton.

reviews.name: Gina S
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon offers breathtaking views and is ideal for both the adventurous as well as those just looking to take in some scenery. If you are looking for hiking, I'd recommend reviewing the types of terrain and level of difficulty of the trails ahead of time so you can select the trail that is right for you. If you just want to take in some scenery, this is a beautiful drive with several places to pull off and appreciate the beauty. Parts of the drive can be very curvy and tight and there are some steep inclines, so if you are afraid of heights or if you are a nervous driver, this might be a bit of a challenge. It seemed like folks drove carefully and were respectful of those who needed to drive a bit slower. Overall, this offers an excellent taste of the mountains and natural beauty and if you are lucky enough you might even get a peek at some wildlife!

reviews.name: Lauren M
reviews.title: Great Hiking
reviews.comment: There are some awesome hiking trails up this canyon with beautiful views! It's also just a really pretty drive if you're not into hiking.

reviews.name: 252rayh
reviews.title: If you love hiking you have to visit this place.
reviews.comment: Some of the best hiking in the world is up Big Cottonwood Canyon. Just find any of the local hiking books to find trails you can hike. You can spend weeks hiking in these mountains and never run out of wonderful things to see.

reviews.name: picky from UK
reviews.title: Very picturesque
reviews.comment: When in SLC we always visit here and usually walk around Silver Lake. This is a pleasant three mile walk on the flat around a stunning lake. Even at the weekends when the Canyon is very busy it is usually possible to find somewhere to park. For the fit and adventurous there are many trail-heads with trails up into the mountains. Since we are seniors and are not used to the altitude we stick to the flat trail round the lake. There were beautiful Fall colors by mid September as well - particularly is you drive up to Guardsman Pass overlook.

reviews.name: DeMarie H
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Even if you just drive up the canyon it is absolutely gorgeous! There are little hikes and bigger hikes all up this canyon. If you are looking for an actual hike it is better to do some research so you know exactly where to go but even if you have an hour, driving up this canyon is so worth it.

reviews.name: pamutah
reviews.title: Family hikes
reviews.comment: My son and grandson have gotten me out hiking several of the great trails available in Big Cottonwood canyon! Doughnut falls is a great short hike. As is Lisa falls. We have yet to conquer the Lake Blanch trail, is a bit extreme for my 5 year old granson.

reviews.name: Hank B
reviews.title: Endless trails
reviews.comment: We hiked 3 trails in cottonwood canyon and found always something new to see with landscape, vegetation and animal life. Will detail the trails more in other reviews here but you cant go wrong choosing any trail in this canyon and only 15-30 mins from the city depending on where you are staying.

reviews.name: Bernard F
reviews.title: Nice mountain drive, and extended walk to the twin lakes
reviews.comment: We wanted to find a good walk, not too far from Salt Lake City. This was a great mountain drive, lots of steep sharp bends and great views as we climbed . Nice easy walk around Silver Lake and then a harder climb to Twin Lakes. Nice warm day in the middle of October

reviews.name: Raymond W
reviews.title: Great drive
reviews.comment:
I had a couple of hours to kill before flying home so I decided to take a drive here. The fall scenery was excellent; lots of fall colors, flowing water, and mountainous views.
The drive gets a little more difficult as you near the top (no guard rails, narrow roads) and again as you enter the descent, but as long as you take it slow, you'll be fine.
I didn't make many stops so I was able to drive through the entire canyon and back to the airport via Highway 80 in a little under 3 hours. I will definitely budget more time and return here the next trip.

reviews.name: Ally8_12
reviews.title: Enjoyable way to spend a few hours (or more if you want)
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is an area comprised of hiking trails, ski resorts, and lakes. You can really make your visit whatever you want it to be. I drove to the top by Brighton Ski Resort and walked around Silver Lake. It's a boardwalk that can be easily walked by all ages and is really beautiful.
At the suggestion of the person at the Visitor's Center, I continued up Twin Lakes Trail until I got to the rocks. There I sat and enjoyed the beautiful view of Silver Lake and the "pikas" that were getting their nests ready for winter. The trail was rocky in places and unfortunately I wasn't wearing appropriate footwear or I would have continued further.
I would definitely recommend a visit to Big Cottonwood and as I said, you can make it whatever you want! If I return to SLC I'd definitely wear my hiking shoes and explore some of the other trails.

reviews.name: SGWEST
reviews.title: Almost as good as Little
reviews.comment: For summer months I actually prefer Big Cottonwood of Little. Its better for hiking and fishing and all around exploring. In the Winter I have to say I move back to Little Cottonwood. While I like Solitude its not Alta... but holidays and spring break Solitude is the place to be... no crowds. Out side of popular ski days I prefer to Ski the Little side... I don't like skiing with snowboarders (notice I did not say I don't like snowboarders) so I prefer Alta... but with Brighton next door to Solitude most of the Big Cottonwood snowboarders end up there so Solitude is virtually boarder free. Summer - Big... Winter - Small. There you go.

reviews.name: TWK435
reviews.title: Many interesting hiking opportunities
reviews.comment: Skier, photo taker, hiker/adventurer, rockhound, family with infant, wheelchair bound or looking for fine dining ? All these will have opportunities to get out and enjoy nature in various locations up Big Cottonwood Canyon.

reviews.name: john p
reviews.title: Breathtaking views and hairpin turns on the drive
reviews.comment: The higher you drive, the better the view. The peaks, valleys, trees, and big sky of Utah make this a wonderful day trip from Salt Lake City. But, the higher you go, the narrower the roads and the more challenging the drive, especially the tight turns with no guardrails. For us, it was worth it because the view at the top is spectacular.

reviews.name: phil52_10
reviews.title: Great side trip
reviews.comment: This is a very pleasant, scenic drive through towering cliffs and changing colours. It may not have the grandeur of other canyons we have driven ,but it does have a charm all of its own. The information on Mississippi Marble was very interesting. We don't know how long the signs have been up regarding the dam construction, but we hope it never happens, natural beauty should be preserved.

reviews.name: CJSlatt
reviews.title: Stunning beauty
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is absolutely breathtaking. Lots of great hiking trails - Mill B is challenging and can get busy, especially on the weekends. Donut Falls is easy, with a spectacular waterfall at the end. Brighton hosts a nature center that has several great trails - Lake Solitude is worth the hill at the very end!

reviews.name: A Joe I
reviews.title: So many choices
reviews.comment: When we chose to hike in Big Cottonwood we thought there would be one or two trails but we were pleasantly surprised to see more then 12 different trail heads on our trip over. The trails were well marked, the changing leaves were beautiful, everywhere you went it was spotless and because dogs are not allowed on the Lake Mary/Lake Cathrine trail, there were no droppings to dodge. All in all some great hiking.

reviews.name: Kate B
reviews.title: Worth the trip!!!
reviews.comment: Gorgeous views! My husband and I were in Salt Lake City for a conference and we were able to take a quick visit to Big Cottonwood Canyon. So glad we did - amazing!!!

reviews.name: ConnieK25
reviews.title: 3 Sisters Hike
reviews.comment: Hiked to Lake Mary, Martha, and Katherine and then to the Sunset Saddle. Gorgeous hike with amazing views from the saddle.

reviews.name: Yezman
reviews.title: Great Relaxing Hike
reviews.comment: Took a nice and easy hike on Cecret Lake. Very pretty drive. Rough dirt road to park, but worth it for a relating short hike.

reviews.name: coco
reviews.title: Wild flowers welcomed friendly
reviews.comment: It was perfect season for visiting wildflowers. I brought lots of water and hike up to secret lake. All flowers were stil blooming.

reviews.name: dawnb843
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Took the drive from Park City back to the University and it was beautiful with all the trees changing colors and great Fall weather. Worth the drive.

reviews.name: Cynthia M
reviews.title: Cecret Lake at the end of Little Cottonwood
reviews.comment: We drove up and through Big Cottonwood, then up Little Cottonwood to a hike up to Cecret Lake in early October: beautiful. Manageable hike, and wonderful scenery. Remember that is cooler in the mountains, so if you start out in SLC, wear layers.

reviews.name: SalfromIL
reviews.title: Review of Silver Lake Loop Trail
reviews.comment:
We drove to Brighton based on a recommendation from the SLC Visitors Guide. And we're happy we did. The Loop Trail is easy but beautiful. Lots of mountains in the background and wonderful reflections off the lake itself. We passed a fisherman with 3 or 4 trout from the lake.
As I said, it's not a hard walk but well the drive if you haven't done it before.

reviews.name: JoJaAi
reviews.title: Love It!
reviews.comment: Beauty found at any time of the year. Water flowing in spring, snow most winters, but i think the beauty shines in the fall. The bright yellow Aspen leafs. Highly recommend a drive through Gaurdsman Pass

reviews.name: bobkatran
reviews.title: Lovely spot for a stroll
reviews.comment: What a lovely place to stroll after Sunday Brunch at the lodge. The nature trail around the lake is a perfect place and pace for a post meal walk. The scenery is fabulous, as you can imagine, and the facilities were very good.

reviews.name: MasonMITraveler
reviews.title: Make this Drive/walk
reviews.comment: We loved our walk around Silver Lake in Brighton. The trail is paved or wooden planks for 90% of the walk. We even saw a Moose! The fall drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon was beautiful. We had breakfast at the Silver Fork Lodge and it was great (huge portions).

reviews.name: Martina C
reviews.title: Scenic ride right outside Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: We had seen Big Cottonwood Canyon listed on the top things to do in /around SLC and it seemed to be almost in the city. This was a very pretty ride up through the canyon that culminated at 2 ski resort areas. Traveling in September, we were there before the busy winter season and the area was very quiet, almost deserted. The foliage was starting to show color, and the whole trip was very scenic. There was a pretty little stream following the road, lots of places to safely pull over, enjoy the view and take pictures. Even though we drove at a leisurely pace the whole ride was done in just over an hour. It should be a not-miss ride when visiting the Salt Lake area, it is that pretty and it is that close!

reviews.name: Michaihu
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: Beautiful drive through this Canyon - stopped at Silver Lake and went for a walk. The autumn colours were already coming through. Boardwalk gives easy access to the trail - more challenging and longer walks are also available.

reviews.name: Micheal S
reviews.title: Motorcycle ride
reviews.comment: I often take Big Cottonwood canyon for peaceful motorcycle rides. It's a very beautiful canyon with lots nature. The water is extremely low right now and the road construction is finally gone. The only downside is the police are patrolling this area and pulling over motorcycles with louder exhaust pipes. So be prepared for that!

reviews.name: julie g
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: A beautiful forest. If you can go for a hike in the canyon, you would not regret it. Take plenty to drink and there are rather steep paths to climb.

reviews.name: Pam B
reviews.title: Storm Mountain Picnic Area
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon was cut by glaciers and river runoff and follows a beautiful winding road from the Salt Lake Valley to Brighton Ski Resort at the top. It follows a curving river along the side of the road graced by picnic areas and hiking trails. One of the best picnic areas is found along the river at the base of Storm Mountain. Each picnic site has a table, a fire pit, and a raised bar-b-que pit. Parking is plentiful. The cost is $8.00 per site per day for up to 8 people. Bring your own wood or charcoal.

reviews.name: KenJean2014
reviews.title: Great canyon to hike, fish and camp.
reviews.comment: We have camped and hiked in this canyon. I have fished and skied here years ago. When the snow starts to fly we will be doing some snowshoe this canyon. You can do almost anything outdoors in this canyon-mountain biking, cross country skiing, nature watching, picnicking, etc., but don't bring your dog here, it is a water shed canyon- our drinking water for the city.

reviews.name: trimic
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery
reviews.comment: On out last day of vacation before leaving for the airport we made the drive to the Cottonwood Canyon , After already touring the Grand Tetons, Yellowstone and Glacier we were really tired of seeing more mountains.But what a nice surprise. The trees were showing more color that we had see and we actually reached a higher elevation than anywhere on our trip. Even though we did not see any wild animal we are glad we went.

reviews.name: emtdpw
reviews.title: Great Drive
reviews.comment:
Beautiful mountain drive and hiking along the Silver Lake Nature trail were we saw Moose - Deer - Ducks and beaver dams.
The Aspen's were turning yellow and were great to photograph this time of the year. We met a local who had suggested this hike and also a mountain road that was a short cut to Park City. It was not for the faint of heart because you didn't want to look over the edge of the goad even as a passenger . But it was fun and a cool adventure!

reviews.name: Dave E
reviews.title: Great Place to Explore
reviews.comment: This is such a beautiful canyon and place to explore. The drive to the top of the canyon is wonderful no matter what time of year. The skiing is great, not as crowded as other places. There are several good trails to hike.

reviews.name: johncgore
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive, Especially in Fall
reviews.comment: One of the must do items in Salt Lake is a visit to Park City and the must do way to get there is to drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon. The road is not difficult and the views are fantastic, particularly when the trees are turning in September-October.

reviews.name: OregonGogo
reviews.title: Beautiful, scenic not difficult to hike.
reviews.comment: We did a few hikes. Did not complete one of the hikes, but we did hike from the ski lodge to the top of the mountain and saw 3 lakes. It was beautiful. Saw deer and beautiful sights. I would do it again. I have to get in better shape, however.

reviews.name: P P
reviews.title: Unique beauty
reviews.comment: It is a beautiful drive no matter the time of year. The colors are so beautiful when the leaves change. It curves and winds up the mountain until you reach the top, following the stream. There's a chance you may spot a deer or moose. You can stop at Solitude ski resort and experience their many activities or go to the end of the road to the Brighton ski resort and hike to one of several mountain lakes. Just a note of caution: the road is narrow and you need to watch for the many cyclists and runners that use it.

reviews.name: AeneasAtSea
reviews.title: Beautiful, Multi-use Canyon
reviews.comment:
I don't know if I'd rate big Cottonwood Canyon the number 1 attraction in SLC, as TA reviewers apparently have. I would agree, however, that it's maybe the number 1 outdoor attraction--at least, if scenic grandeur, skiing, or hiking is what you're looking for. But there are numerous downtown attractions that are more unique to the area, closer to the airport, more easily visited, etc. And Millcreek Canyon, which is much closer to downtown SLC, is in some ways more beautiful than Big Cottonwood (it has more foliage and more spectacular colors in the fall, but is not as breathtaking and rugged).
Big Cottonwood Canyon is most easily accessed off I-215 (exit 6) onto E 6200 South (Hwy 190). Travel south on 190 about 2 miles to the canyon road and turn left (east).
The canyon is a major access road during the winter for two of Utah's biggest ski resorts--Brighton and Solitude. During the fair-weather months the canyon is a spectacular drive (especially for fall colors) or a jumping-off place for numerous hiking and biking trails. Here are a few.
First, 4.5 miles up the canyon the Mill B South interpretive trail (.5 miles long, one-way, which is paved, so great for kids and wheelchairs), and the Lake Blanche trail, which starts from the Miil B trailhead just before the falls and continues for almost three miles past glacier-scarred boulders up the fork to a stunning alpine lake. Across the S-curve and up the road a few hundred feet from Mill B South trailhead is the Hidden Falls trail and the Mill B North Fork trail, which offers great overlooks of the canyon. Both trails are relatively steep and relentlessly uphill.
Second, about 8.5 miles up the canyon is the Doughnut Falls trail, named for a waterfall that flows through the hole in a rock. Take the Cardiff Fork (Mill D South Fork) turnoff, then drive 1 1/4 miles to a parking area. An old mining road takes you 3/4 mile to Doughnut Falls, and the Cardiff mine in 2 1/2 miles.
At the top of the canyon are the Brighton and Alta ski resorts, a small A-frame store, and on the west side of the Brighton loop road, Silver Lake. The latter offers a nature center, a boardwalk and interpretive trail around the lake, fishing, and connecting trails to Lake Solitude and beyond. But the real treat is the network of trails and alpine lakes (Lake Mary, Martha and Catherine are all simply breathtaking) on the east side of the loop road, above the Alta parking area. Expect to see deer, moose, beautiful wildflowers, and some of the most gorgeous scenery you'll see anywhere in the world short of the Swiss Alps.

reviews.name: Michael G
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful!
reviews.comment:
I went on a beautiful early fall day. The leaves aren't changing yet, but it was gorgeous. Got a couple of nice hikes in, and had lunch at one of the ski resorts.
Well worth the trip!

reviews.name: Care8875
reviews.title: Beautiful treasure.
reviews.comment:
Beautiful in the fall. Great hikes abound. We hiked a short distance from the parking lot at Guardsman Pass to Blood Lake. Beautiful little lake.
You can hike all the way around it.

reviews.name: oralynnq2
reviews.title: See nature by car or foot
reviews.comment: Beautiful canyon for a hike or a drive. There are several hiking trails for all skill levels You can either drive up the canyon until you see a trailhead or you can purchase a map of hiking trails on amazon. Some hikes end at a waterfall. Start in the morning so it's not too hot. Or go in the Fall and see all the trees change colors

reviews.name: Mark T
reviews.title: Beautiful hikes abound!
reviews.comment: A beautiful canyon full of hikes for all levels of skill. Easy paved hikes along waterfalls to challenging hike to remote mountain lakes. You can even hike to an old mine if you like. Also, the geology of the canyon is very interesting for rock hounds. Plenty of hike maps available online. MAKE SURE to bring Water, It is a cool dry climate.

reviews.name: Johnnykumar
reviews.title: An amazing adventure for your whole family.
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon packs a ton of adventure for a family looking for a day trip. Here is how to do it in style. I recommend first stopping at Porcupine Grill for breakfast. Then check out the trails at Storm Mountain. I would also explore Donut Falls. Be careful though. The desire to scramble up the side of the falls has led to many injuries and falls.
