Some have been fatal. It is on private property and I am uncertain about the rules of access now. It used to be no probem to park and hike. Check out Silver Lake by walking around the lake via the boardwalks, and then if weather permits, drive over Guardsman Pass to Park City.

reviews.name: Photographer801
reviews.title: A PLACE OF TRUE BEAUTY!
reviews.comment: If you are looking for a place to take wonderful pictures of nature at it's finest then look no more. This canyon is a short drive from downtown Salt Lake and filled with so many surprises. The vistas are ever changing as is the weather so the photos will never be the same. The drive is windy but not so much as to worry anyone. Each turn in the road offers a new, picturesque view and all are photo worthy. Be sure to park alongside the road and walk down to the streams along the way. You will NOT be disappointed! Big Cottonwood Canyon is awesome!

reviews.name: 208LisaR5
reviews.title: Beautiful area for hiking
reviews.comment: We visited Big Cottonwood Canyon on Monday, Sept. 7 (Labor Day). The canyon was gorgeous, and VERY popular for hiking that day. Easily 100 cars lines the sides of the road in the first 5 miles, with people everywhere getting out to hike or rock climb. I was able to google various trails, although their trailheads did not seem to be well marked. I only saw signs for the bigger ones. It was inspiring to see SO MANY people out spending time in nature and enjoying God's creation.

reviews.name: Overlook32
reviews.title: Nice vistas
reviews.comment: The drive thru the canyon is beautiful. There are lots of hiking trails. We stopped and took lots of pictures and continued all the way to Park City

reviews.name: Coolhead55
reviews.title: Great hike/bike trails
reviews.comment: The canyon begins on the southeast corner of the 215 beltway and is filled with amazing trails. Trails aren't groomed like many in Zion's or Canyonlands, it is rougher terrain, more mountainous. But given that 20 minutes from the city you can be into an alpine paradise is pretty cool. The weekends can be crowded, but week days are perfect with low volume traffic. The fall colors are spectacular. I saw some individuals climbing as well.

reviews.name: StevenC75
reviews.title: Stairs Gulch walk
reviews.comment: We did the stairs gulch walk and enjoyed the rapid assent and views. The path is challenging in places and the waterfalls went as specular as hoped but I expect would be bigger earlier in the year. It was great to find so much natural beauty near to the city.

reviews.name: Troy H
reviews.title: Nice easy hike to Twin Lakes
reviews.comment:
Been up Big Cottonwood Canyon many times, but today was my first time to visit Silver Lake and hike up to Twin Lakes.
Fun easy hike. About 3 miles round trip.

reviews.name: Danmation
reviews.title: Great Day Hikes
reviews.comment: We hiked the three lakes - Mary, Martha, and Catherine - beautiful views, even if the lake levels were not at their max. Spotted a moose! Medium-easy hike.

reviews.name: wizrn99
reviews.title: 190 up the mountains and silver lake to park city
reviews.comment:
wow what a road that leads to park city! Terrifying and beautiful. Glad we did it.! Speed limit was 15 mph and we were lucky to go that fast because it is a sheer drop to the canyon.
Stopped at Silver lake and hiked around it which was beautiful and easy. Do it!

reviews.name: Patrick M
reviews.title: Perfect Day Trip from SLC
reviews.comment: The views are magnificent and some of the best hiking opportunities in Utah. Trails for every level of hiker. Don't hike? This is also a great place to view from your car. Many scenic turnoffs for your enjoyment. Bring your camera!

reviews.name: Wendy P
reviews.title: Stunning and worth the drive
reviews.comment: Absolutely stunning. So incredible that I went back for a second day and drove slower! My husband was working the day I went. So I did the drive by myself it was so amazing that I took him here and drove so that he could relax and enjoy the beauty.

reviews.name: kendallg174
reviews.title: Beautiful! Provo Falls are a don't miss!!
reviews.comment: Take the Hwy 150 scenic byway. It's breathtaking! Be sure and stop to see the Provo River Falls. It's a nice get away when you're in Salt Lake City

reviews.name: Kaytan44
reviews.title: Great Drive Close to HOME
reviews.comment: This canyon is close to -Salt Lake City. It is great for skiing and tubing.. I love to drive up the canyon in the fall. Sometimes we go to Silver Lake Lodge for a relaxing dinner .there are many great hikes in the canyon.

reviews.name: must_need_H2O
reviews.title: The beauty of this canyon can't be told only experienced
reviews.comment:
When doing this drive make sure you plan for the whole day and pack a nice lunch so you can enjoy some of the great look out areas. if you are driving up from the front side of the Wasatch mountains, make plans to have early dinner in Park City. Don't rush the drive and get out often to enjoy the mountain air and the sounds of life you don't hear in the city. Take lots of pictures but look with your eyes more than you look through the camera lens. When the day is over mark a place on the calendar to set a point in time to revisit this scenic symphony of wonder.
The Good: When you are out in nature enjoy the moment
The Bad: After coming back to the city, missing the quite of the mountains
The Ugly: some people don't know how to drive slow and miss everything.
On the scuba bubble scale of 1 to 10 I give this place 10 can't get better than that.

reviews.name: Zsuzsa V
reviews.title: One of the most beautiful and fun mountains all year around.
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is 25 mile from East Salt Lake City, excellent camping, hiking, biking, rock-climbing, fishing, picnicking place in the summer. Spring and fall you can photograph the most spectacular wiled flowers covered hills. Winter you can enjoy the winter sports with the best snow. For history lovers: Utah’s beautiful mountains are covered with lots of ancient Indian rock arts.

reviews.name: Jane T
reviews.title: Great place to hike, ski, snowshoe or just enjoy the scenery
reviews.comment: Since I live nearby, I'm up in this canyon many times a year. I had to laugh a little at the review which said there was no canyon.......??? It's 15 miles long, and at the top are two fantastic ski resorts: Brighton and Solitude. There's definitely a canyon! The road takes you from the valley floor level (about 4800 feet) to the ski bases, which are about 9,000 feet. From there, you can hike (or X-country ski or snowshoe) up higher if you want. The canyon has a number of excellent hiking trails to explore. I recommend stopping at REI or Kirkham's if you're not familiar with the area and pick up a hiking guidebook and some tips and suggestions from the local outdoor enthusiasts who work at either of those stores. Big Cottonwood is a great getaway from the summer heat, and you can grab a good meal at the Silver Fork Lodge on the way up or down (it's 1 mile or 2 from the top) or a burger at the Brighton Village Store.

reviews.name: TP5002013
reviews.title: Beautiful Hikes, and few people
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood has some of the best local hikes. All levels of difficulty. Early mornings and winter anytime means few people. I especially enjoy Mill D North in the winter. If you haven't already - but some micro-spikes to strap to your shoes and enjoy the solitude of the beautiful winter days - white snow, great views.

reviews.name: GKPai
reviews.title: Excellent Ski Area, Very scenic Hiking area, good for rides, camping and other outdoor activities
reviews.comment:
If you have lived in the Salt Lake valley, you wouldn't have missed this obvious canyon. Lined by a creek, which is one of the watershed areas for the valley, trees along the mountainsides if not interrupted by the rugged, rocky, cliffs, it is a sight to behold for anyone that drives through this wilderness area easily accessible even by the urbane.
Brighton, the locals favorite and Solitude, the place to get away from the crowd, are probably two of the best ski resorts in the US. These get among the best powder and of the deepest snow in these areas. The road that dead ends in winter at Brighton and goes over the Guardsman Pass over to Park City in summer with an unpaved (but, easy to drive) link, is well maintained throughout the year.
The 15-mile long canyon whose mouth is 2 minutes away from a freeway (I-215 belt route) is punctuated by picnic areas, camping sites, hiking trails, fishing area and rock climbing spots. Yet, it is not as crowded as much lesser nature's beauty out towards the coastal regions. The only time you will see a lot of traffic is during and right after closing of the ski area for the day in winter (weekends). The average summer driving time, one-way, is less than 30 minutes.
Canyons remain about 10-20 degree F cooler than the valley and often remains above the inversion effects that is seen in the valley.
Expect no public transportation in the summer, but the local public transportation, UTA, plies promptly in winter, carrying skiers/boarders up and down the canyon.
Water and restrooms are available at some picnic and camping areas. Restaurant and basic facilities at the Brighton and Solitude ski area (more extensively in winter). There is one good restaurant (Silver Fork) about 80% of the way up the canyon. Ski areas are at about the far end of the Canyon.

reviews.name: Roy A
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon, So close to SLC.
reviews.comment: Great place to take photographs. Lots of recreation, Rock climbing, Fishing, Picnicking, great ski resorts Large group campgrounds for reunions or parties. The Spruces Campground in particular.

reviews.name: Tyler Y
reviews.title: Best Place to Hike
reviews.comment: If you are looking for a place to go hiking, the cottonwood canyons are the place to go. So many trails and spectacular views.

reviews.name: UtahJerry
reviews.title: Favorite Salt Lake Canyon
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is my favorite of the Wasatch Front canyons for all seasons of the year. In the winter there is Solitude and Brighton ski resorts. These are both great ski facilities that are considered to be more 'local' than some of the other resorts in the area. They have great runs and facilities, but are not nearly as crowded or commercialized as the bigger resorts. Fall puts on a great display of colors and there are plenty of great hiking trails to enjoy during the spring and summer.

reviews.name: NewportNative
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon
reviews.comment: Beautiful canyon with aspen and spruces. We enjoyed stopping at the Spruces campground and leisurely walking around looking at birds and soaking our feet in the relaxing cool stream. Close to the city and a great place to unwind.

reviews.name: joeyelbows
reviews.title: An SLC must!
reviews.comment: Wow what a beautiful place. This was the highlight of our trip to SLC and definitely must stop. No crowds and abundant natural beauty. All just a short ride from downtown.

reviews.name: Randy O
reviews.title: nice drive.
reviews.comment: Summer travelers should drive over Guardsman's Pass between Brighton and Park City. The road is paved and views spectacular.

reviews.name: CallieSLC
reviews.title: A Magical Place
reviews.comment: A magical place whether one is hiking in the summer or skiing in the winter. Best accomodations are with Mount Majestic who have a range of cabins and chalets for rent in the canyon. Good eats can be had at Silber Fork Lodge.

reviews.name: 787sallyb
reviews.title: Spectacular summer, winter, spring and especially fall
reviews.comment: Grew up skiing at Brighton, have hiked many trails in the summer and taken a dip in Mary's Lake. But when the Autumn leaves are in full color, Big Cottonwood Canyon is a thing of beauty. Only downside in winter is the bumper-to-bumper traffic slowly edging its way up to Solitude or Brighton.

reviews.name: Candace K
reviews.title: Autumn Splendor
reviews.comment: I have been hiking here since I was a child. If you can go on a week day in late September or early October, it is difficult to find a more perfect place on the planet.

reviews.name: Anna P
reviews.title: Wonderful hikes to escape the city
reviews.comment: Some truly great escapes await you up this canyon! Some of my favorite hikes in all the Wasatch Mountains are located up this canyon (especially Red Pine).

reviews.name: Davismamawolfe
reviews.title: A Most Beautiful Escape Outside SLC
reviews.comment: A most beautiful place just outside of SLC. Great for ummertime hiking, winter snow sports, take a nice drive, or exploring lakes and rivers. What a gem so close to the city!

reviews.name: Bernie G
reviews.title: Respite close to the city
reviews.comment: Wonderful canyon, nice short hikes are up to Mary's Lake and Donut Falls. Many other hikes are shorter and longer. Also great for skiing, rock climbing and rappelling. The picnic areas get full on weekends and holidays.

reviews.name: M Richard M
reviews.title: Scenery beyond compare
reviews.comment: the ride up the canyon is breath taking, guardsman pass unbelievable, the ski resorts on your right, going up hill, are spectacular, the hiking, climbing, walking fabulous

reviews.name: david r
reviews.title: Wonderful drive to te top.
reviews.comment: Recommended by a txi driver in Salt Lake, we drove it in summer and had so many stops for photos, it is truly beautiful, must be even better in winter time. If driving be aware of the altitude change from bottom to top, take plenty of drinking water if you intend to walk on hiking trails. Coming down watch your brakes,,,

reviews.name: eyemlucky
reviews.title: Steep green mountains
reviews.comment: A skiing area, but in the summer the mountains go steep on either side (formed by glacier movement a long time ago). Very green and gorgeous.

reviews.name: Jenny H
reviews.title: Love hiking here!
reviews.comment: It's so nice to be able to escape the city by slipping into Big Cottonwood Canyon. We love to hike and camp and even just picnic. Great way to spend a few hours, or a few days.

reviews.name: MeliChr
reviews.title: Beautiful drive
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood is beautiful whether your taking it in via car or bicycle. It's a long, but moderate climb. There are wonderful and varying hikes and two ski resorts. Silver Lake at the top is perfect for families with babies and toddlers and older kids as there is a paved path around the lake.

reviews.name: Seattle J
reviews.title: Beautiful place to hike
reviews.comment: If you drive about 20 minutes into the recreation area, you can take a very easy walk around Silver Lake or choose a more challenging hike. It is a dramatically beautiful drive.

reviews.name: Terri D
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Walk
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon - always beautiful! An easy walk to many wonderful sights. Once we saw some moose - a mama and a baby! Easy walk for older folks too!

reviews.name: rjcvg
reviews.title: Pretty Mountains and Landscape
reviews.comment:
We rode thru this park to go on a short hike at Doughnut Falls. Drove past it for 6 miles to Brighton, UT. Turned around and went back thanks from a nice lady at Brighton. We found it and after driving around in the gravel parking lot for a bit we found a place to park. Very popular in summer. Crowded. This is a 1 mile RT hike up a gravel and rocky trail. Not paved. Easy to moderate difficulty. Saw many children hiking. Older folks may have a problem. Falls were pretty but not fantastic. Had to hike up the rocky river a bit to get to the falls. We did not do that.
The drive thru the park was very nice. There are many other hikes in this park just do your research to fine the best one for you.

reviews.name: Michael D
reviews.title: Remarkable Natural Beauty
reviews.comment: Two hours ago I was looking out over the treetops below me in Big Cottonwood Canyon. This is a place of remarkable beauty, and stark contrasts, and should not be missed. From the mossy rocks in the canyon stream, to the spruces and pines, to the scrubby sagebrush and tall aspens, I was simply overwhelmed by this jewel of the American southwest. There are many places to pull off the road and take in the scenery, which I recommend you do frequently: the air has such an earthy perfume, and the view will not disappoint you. Be sure to take along a camera, a comfortable pair of shoes, and a warm sweater for the high altitude (just in case). Above all else, enjoy it. I hope you love this place as much as I did.

reviews.name: Behzadvaziri
reviews.title: good for overnight camp
reviews.comment: my first visit to the campsites around the salt lake city. Liked the place, campgrounds, the nature, and the nearby hikes are awesome....

reviews.name: MaitreyeeMayhem
reviews.title: Gorgeous Canyon!
reviews.comment: This canyon is gorgeous! I love driving up here because it really is breathtaking. It gives you a chance to get out of the city and enjoy the world around you. You will never want to go back.

reviews.name: 1Maxon
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: I have traveled the canyon literally hundreds of times and it never fails to take my breath away. If you haven't been up Big Cottonwood, it's time!

reviews.name: curiousexplorer2015
reviews.title: Should not be missed
reviews.comment: Beautiful, scenic, and accessible from Park City. Great for hiking. Bursting with wildflowers in the summer. Should not be missed.

reviews.name: Yun G
reviews.title: Great Piste!
reviews.comment: Heard it's probably the best skiing resort in all of North America. But I went in the summer so no snowy pistes in site. but unbeatable scenery definitely!

reviews.name: KathyP2410
reviews.title: Local Gems
reviews.comment: I grew up around here. I moved as a young adult. There is now too many people in SLC for me to want to move back to it. But I still sorely miss these canyons.

reviews.name: csjkong
reviews.title: Very Scenic
reviews.comment: A lovely Scenic drive which for all to enjoy for free. If you haven't driven around the Cottonwood Canyon area, you must. There are also lots of trails to test out.

reviews.name: sidedoor
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: Insanely gorgeous place with a variety of hikes for all fitness levels. The summertime scenery is incredible. We purchased a book on hikes in the area from the local REI and we so glad we made the effort. Pack a picnic and hit the trail!

reviews.name: Dustin C
reviews.title: Well worth the trip to see it!
reviews.comment: Beautiful area with some great hikes - from 1mi to as long as you want (100 miles) - your choice. You will see some steep terrain and amazing views. Well worth the drive and make sure to get out of the car to do some exploring

reviews.name: savvychef
reviews.title: Escape the summer heat-and hike, too!!
reviews.comment: The mouth of the Canyon is very close to my home, so access is minutes away!! Lots of trails to explore, vistas of the cornices that will be covered with snow in the winter. Stop at the Silver Fork cafe on the way up, and sit on the deck. It's easy to find parking spots, and don't forget to take some pictures so that you can 'return' whenever you'd like. A stream along the way might even have a flyfisher or two enjoying the day!!

reviews.name: oceangrlz
reviews.title: It's Not A Movie Set...It's Real!
reviews.comment:
I had a visitor from Tennessee and when she looked out my east window, she saw Big Cottonwood canyon and said, "That can't be real!" Of course, her experience of mountains was the rolling hills of Tennessee. When I actually took her on a drive in to the canyon, basically her mouth just hung open the entire time. I know there are more majestic mountains in the country and in the world but to have them so accessible every season of the year and to be able to get out of the car and take a hike of every endurance level you would choose, is something.
My husband and I went to Silver Lake this past weekend. Even as many times as I have been there, it's still quite stunning and beautiful. Some of my favorite hikes are Mill B South, of course, the simple stroll around Silver Lake, Spruces, Tanners Flat, Lake Blanche, Gobbler's knob (This can be accessed by both Millcreek and Big Cottonwood canyons) Keep in mind that not all trails are wheelchair accessible but Silver Lake has portions that would be.

reviews.name: catepra
reviews.title: Hike
reviews.comment: Wildflowers are beautiful - many trail hikes, lakes and waterfalls. Take a look at a trail map to pick what suits your ability. Donut Falls is easy and beautiful!

reviews.name: lope1430
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment:
The canyon is on the road from Salt Lake to Guardsman Pass. Entry to Big Cottonwood is only a few minutes outside Salk Lake. On weekends the road can be crowded as there are various place for family outings and folks riding bicycles. Many places to stop and take pictures.
This is the road that will take you to Guardsman Pass.

reviews.name: Anna
reviews.title: Great hike, lots of people
reviews.comment: I only took a short hike on one of the first trails, but it was an easy, beautiful hike. The places to park are limited and some spots are very close to a steep drop off. It was a stunning view all around and I would definitely go back and hike all the other trails.

reviews.name: 4burns
reviews.title: Beautiful Way to Beat the Heat in the Summer
reviews.comment: Lovely area for hiking, camping, wild flowers, great skiing in the winter. The mountains are the best part of Salt Lake City.

reviews.name: joyhope
reviews.title: Epic hike
reviews.comment: We hiked a 5-mile hike to Desolation trail then up to the Spine. Was absolutely incredible standing at the top. I never dreamed it would be so mind blowing. We are not in the greatest shape but were determined once we were committed to doing this. We will treasure this memory always. There are so very many hikes through here. But so thankful we did this one. Even though after another 5 miles down the mountain wi was truly done in.

reviews.name: Dabblings
reviews.title: Amazing scenery
reviews.comment: We drove west to east & the start was a long climb up the mountain. As we were going up, hundreds of cyclists were coming down at break-neck speed! Stopped at Brighton & took the mile long board-walk loop around Silver Lake. It was beautiful. Took Guardsman's Pass over the mountain to Park City. This is only open summer time. On the outskirts of Brighton as you start on the pass road there's a beautiful look-out where you can see for miles. The pass is only 12 miles, but takes about 35 minutes. It's VERY twisty!

reviews.name: budfoluse
reviews.title: Could not agree more.
reviews.comment: Prior to visiting SC we obviously read the reviews on things to do. The canyon was rated number one and we will just agree with the previous reviewers. We were able to drive the Guardsman's Pass which was spectacular as well. A definite must see for every age group.

reviews.name: Asphaltman
reviews.title: What a view!
reviews.comment: Beautiful Canyon. Home to two ski resorts Solitude and Brighton with many summer and winter activities each. BCC has many day camp areas and a couple over night spots. The Spruces are my fav. Look closely as you drive up, you'll spot many old abandoned gold mines. During the summer you can drive an access road at the top called Guardsmans Pass. Beautiful drive, and it takes you to Park City.

reviews.name: DaSpelunker
reviews.title: a great drive
reviews.comment: Welcome to the Wasatch mountain range. The spot from where you enter the canyons till the end of road is just so scenic. There is a spring that flows beside you, downstream and has got cut outs at places where you can stop to smell the grass and see the beauty of running water. Pack a meal and you can just drive down here, and eat it in all the sylvan surroundings. as you climb up the mountain, you will feel the air go colder, and every mile with a new hue and color. there are several spots where you can stay like the solitude and brighton ski resort. we drove till the end of road. There is the silver lake at that spot which has a pathway that goes around it. View from here is awesome and we have found snow till the end of May in those slopes. There are a couple of restaurants up there in the ski resorts as well. Carry water and munchies if you want to hike the other lakes that are well hidden in the mountains. The trek would start form the silver lake of course. All in all a great place with a great geological significance as you get to see the cliffs/hills that remnants of the ancient sea (look for signboards that highlight these). there is a small waterfall (on the right when you drive up) and an ampitheatre (on the left) this waterfall is rough when there is ice in the mountains but quite dry in the summer months. The ride is good, the roads are new and the numerous trails, worth a climb. I know people camp there but have never tried on my own.

reviews.name: Lynn H
reviews.title: Perfect day trip from SLC
reviews.comment: Great day trip from SLC.Quick lunch at Silver Fork Lodge, continuing to Guardsman Pass. Awesome drive that ended in Park City then back to SLC. Took us 4 hours with lunch and photo stops.

reviews.name: Annette G
reviews.title: A great hike, close to SLC. Bugs were out!
reviews.comment: My hubby and I had just an afternoon to hike a bit while staying in SLC. Glad we choose Big Cottonwood Canyon. A pleasant drive, great trails, not too crowded. A bit buggy--early July, but other than that, it was great. Even had internet service most places.

reviews.name: mac2jeter
reviews.title: Great Place to Ride a Bike
reviews.comment: One of my favorite rides/climbs in the state. If you are not a bike rider, take a nice drive up the canyon and hit one of the many hiking trails. You cannot go wrong with the mountains here in Utah.

reviews.name: durigirl1
reviews.title: Breathtaking Beauty in Big Cottonwood Canyon.
reviews.comment: We went here on the recommendation of a friend and what a find. We love the mountains and this site did not disappoint. There are trails for all levels of ability. Wildflowers are abundant and there are wild life sightings as well. It is a spiritual feast with its natural beauty and serenity.

reviews.name: Baboonarms
reviews.title: Beautiful drive & hike
reviews.comment: Normally a ski area but not in the hieght of summer when its fairly quiet. Visitor centre very helpful on where to walk / hike, got some sandwiches from an eatery and set off to the lakes

reviews.name: Kent B
reviews.title: One of the canyon drive thru the Utah mountains.
reviews.comment: One of the canyon drive thru the Utah mountains. This roads leads to Brighton and Solitude ski areas. Lots of great hikes and beautiful mountain scenery. Guardsman pass goes over the mountains to Park City is at the end of the canyon. At Brighton there is hike around Silver lake that accessible to all.

reviews.name: Carrie S
reviews.title: Great canyon with gorgeous scenery
reviews.comment: The canyon includes picnic areas, camping areas, some cabins, a great stream, and 2 ski resorts towards the top all within about 20 minutes of downtown Salt Lake. There is a small lake at the top of the canyon that is an easy walk so it is good for everyone. Colors in the fall were spectacular. The only downside is there are no pets allowed as the water is culinary water.

reviews.name: Amy C
reviews.title: Amazing place for a quick hike
reviews.comment:
We did a quick hike up to Doughnut Falls and had a very lovely trip. The Canyon is only about 30 minutes away from the downtown area so it was quick and easy to drive to, and offered really stunning views of the mountainsides and rolling hills.
There are numerous hiking trails along the canyon so I would recommend searching around online for something that seems interesting to you and give it a shot!
NOTE: Our trail was not marked very well, so if you're someone who worries about that sort of thing you may want to bring a GPS.

reviews.name: Randy W
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: It is beautiful. It is cool in the summer months, far above the Salt Lake Valley. Snowfall in the winter averages 500" of snow. Skiing, snowmobiling, snowshoeing, summer hiking and lots to see and do. Go to one of the ski resorts, hike to one of the many lakes, see scenery unparalleled.

reviews.name: GButler
reviews.title: Simply stunning
reviews.comment: Even just a drive up the canyon is worth it. Although highly recommend some of the hikes. Some easy hikes are silver lake, donut falls a bit harder is willow lake. Even harder and longer is lake Blanche. All very beautiful and different.

reviews.name: David G
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenic Drive
reviews.comment: The drive though Big Cottonwood is beautiful! We will be back to try some of the many hikes in the area.

reviews.name: RICHARD F
reviews.title: An absolute must !
reviews.comment: My wife and I drove up Big Cotton Canyon after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. Sooooo glad we did. Beautiful drive but the jewel in the crown is the Twin Lakes Wilderness trail hike. It's a 2.5 mile rough hike up to Lake Blanch. Hikers need a level of fitness, and lots of water, but the views are stunning. Highly recommended to the more active vacationers.

reviews.name: TimeVariant
reviews.title: Good family hike
reviews.comment:
Nice hike to a nice lake, 1 hr each way max.
Lake seems to have swimming possibilities (for humans and dogs!)
Beware the steep parts of the dusty trail - hiking stick is useful, though not essential.

reviews.name: Diane w
reviews.title: Wonderful area
reviews.comment: We visit this area often in summer and winter. There are endless things to do outdoors from hiking and skiing to art festivals and outdoor concerts. Great for the whole family from young to old.

reviews.name: Linda N
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: 18 miles to the top is a breathtaking drive. Many wonderful hiking trails, go early to get good parking as there are some that are road parking. The hikes are stunning. If you drive to the end of the road you can see salt lake valley.

reviews.name: Kathaleena J
reviews.title: Eye Candy for sure
reviews.comment: So much to see and the beauty is kissed by God, great place for couples on their honeymoon or families or just out by your self, Utah canyons offer so much for the eyes to enjoy!

reviews.name: Donna L
reviews.title: Nature at her best
reviews.comment: ..can be enjoyed whether driving, hiking, fishing and/or for family gatherings. Nature provides the scenes with sound, smell and her beauty.

reviews.name: octravelbug
reviews.title: a lovely little drive
reviews.comment: You can get up out the valley and into the cooler air quickly with this scenic drive up into the canyon. Nice road and I saw deer!

reviews.name: vjeric
reviews.title: Beautiful an Scenic!
reviews.comment: We love Big Cottonwood Canyon. There are several hikes and rock climbs for most levels, some small towns with amenities including lodging and restaurants and our favorite, Silver Lake at the top of the Canyon. It's a beautiful day drive or a great place to stay a few days.

reviews.name: jfrieda
reviews.title: amazing views, wonderful hikes
reviews.comment: Great hiking,mountain biking spot. Go in late june when the flowers are all blooming. We walked off trail and found an old stage coach road and a spring meadow. I wish I had studied geology so I knew more about the mountain uplifts. They are truly amazing. Hike to a lake too;..WOW

reviews.name: dumples19
reviews.title: This is a gorgeous canyon; lots of hikes!
reviews.comment: This is a gorgeous canyon to drive, and there are a lot of fantastic hikes throughout. I have kids who don't like to do big hiking, so we do the smaller ones. A favorite is a quarter mile walk to Hidden Falls at the "S" curve, and Silver Lake up at the top of the canyon. Twin Lakes and Lake Solitude are fantastic 1 mile hikes above Silver Lake, and well worth the drive up the canyon to get to the cooler air. It's really stunning to simply drive through as well, and it's so dang close to anyone living in the Salt Lake Valley!

reviews.name: Memo46
reviews.title: Local and wonderful
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon was named after the size of trees at the canyon mouth. Brighton and Solitude ski areas are differently local huge and family friendly. Solitude offer haut cuisine and burgers. Brighton offers skier fare at the base. Molly's offers real meals. There is a small store. Silver Fork has good food breakfast, lunch dinner and beer with a beautiful deck.
Hiking is limitless with day-hikes throughout the canyon to backpacking or cross canyon excursions (see local published guides) . There are also short level walks around the lake at Brighton.
The creeks are fast with limited fishing the lakes are more popular.
The Autumns are colorful and rival anywhere and amaze that they are such a short drive from the center of Salt Lake City. Access to the canyons is the reason so many people live here. Go enjoy, don't forget to smile.

reviews.name: ReubenUT
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon is amazing
reviews.comment: Striking scenery. Great hikes including to Cecret Lake and to the ridge between the neighboring canyons. Hikes are relatively short and easy. Beautiful wildflowers in Late July and early August.

reviews.name: Kristin M
reviews.title: A Breathtaking View
reviews.comment: If you are in the area, take time out of your day to drive through this canyon and pull over to take a hike on one of the many trails. It is absolutely stunning!

reviews.name: Sandy W
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenic drive
reviews.comment: Loved the rock formations, scenery - must be gorgeous when the mountains are covered in snow. Ski resorts look fantastic. Had lunch by the lake at the end of the Canyon - really nice.

reviews.name: Anna D
reviews.title: Short Drive From Salt Lake City
reviews.comment: I absolutely loved the drive through the hills, it was breathtaking and the photos absolutely cannot do justice to the panoramic views! The only annoying thing were the drivers that were tailing so dangerously close, because they didn't think a speed limit applied to them apparently. The roads are winding so it's difficult to see around the corners, definitely watch out for people on bicycles. Besides the safety, why rush through such a beautiful place?

reviews.name: James H
reviews.title: See them both Big and Small
reviews.comment: We took the scenic drive up Brighton Mtn at Big Cottonwood and were rewarded with a pleasant boardwalk around a small lake with options to continue the hike to two other lakes. It was great to see families walking with their young children along the boardwalk pointing out spider webs and small fish. Other families were fishing for trout with success. This is a generous reward for the drive from Salt Lake City. Hint; If you plan to hike the longer trails take the boardwalk to the right from the Visitor's Center and it will be shorter to your to choices. The drive up and down through the canyons reminded us a little of Zion. Early morning or late afternoon and the sun will be your friend taking pictures.

reviews.name: RachelSMsRC
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Give yourself enough time to make plenty of stops along all the twists and turns of the guardsman pass.

reviews.name: Bob G
reviews.title: wonderful day
reviews.comment: We went for a scenic drive to Big Cottonwood Canyon. We had a lovely day. The views were stunning. There were hikers and bikers also enjoying the day. There are places to pull off to take pictures. This was a highlight of the trip, don't miss it.

reviews.name: Chris D
reviews.title: Keep an eye on the wheather!
reviews.comment: Mother natures full beauty! The drive is windy and narrow, it's tough in rain or snow so be aware of the forecast. Shoot for a nice sunny day to get the full appreciation of this masterpiece. Bring your climbing gear, bike or hiking shoes. You can go as far as you want.

reviews.name: Michael W
reviews.title: Fun and really good food.
reviews.comment: Both big and little are packed full of great outdoor summer activities. Good biking and hiking. Hit the lake at the top.

reviews.name: OK2BU2
reviews.title: An amazing scenic area close to the heart of Salt Lake City!
reviews.comment:
Go here!! This area is just too close to the city of Salt Lake not to take advantage. It's an amazing scenic drive that winds it way into and up the canyon. Snow capped mountains, big Cottonwood Creek:one of the largest streams entering Salt Lake Valley from the east from the Wasatch Mountains, and then there is the potential to see Moose. So just do it! Drive up to the top where Brighton Ski Resort is located, then slowly wind your way back.
For those that like to hike, there are many choices and levels, and I would definitely recommend taking a picnic lunch and stopping at one of the picnic stops along the creek.
Note: There is a fee for parking or use of picnic areas. It is self-pay.

reviews.name: Pat P
reviews.title: Worth the Drive
reviews.comment:
This canyon is 12 miles south of Salt Lake City, and it is a stunning 10 mile climb though a park with ski slopes. When we reached the Brighton Ski area we parked in the large lot, and ventured out to the Silver Lake trail behind the visitor center. There s a very stroller and wheel chair friendly trail that circles the lake. When you reach the one of the ends of the far side of the lake you have the opportunity to continue in a much more rugged trail to Lake Solitude. We went near the middle of June, and there were still spots of snow on the trail around Silver Lake. I am from Pennsylvania so this really impressed me. I had never seen snow before in June. I was in flip flops, but I decided to hike the upward trail to Lake Solitude any way. It was worth the effort. We saw three deer and wild life. There were beautiful views of the canyon. At one point on the trail it is important that you bear left or you will end up down a long hill at a ski lodge. Fortunately we were able to follow people ahead of us who had stopped to watch the passing wild life. The trail got steep toward Lake Solitude and it was rough to do it in flip flops, but I am a rather adventurous type. It is about a one mile trail one way, and we were able to rest, drink water and have a snack at the lake. The chip monks there are very friendly "or aggressive" and will beg for food. Going down the trail when it is muddy is more challenging than climbing it.
We stopped at a restaurant in the Brighton Recreation Area, but it was closed. On our drive back there is a popular bar and restaurant about half way down on the right. "The Silver Fork Lodge". The food was great, but it was little expensive.
This trip is a must do if you are visiting Salt Lake City. It only took us a half day to complete, and it was worth the rental car fee. I would do it again, only next time I would choose different shoes. We would have loved to have done Zion Canyon, but it is 4 hours away.

reviews.name: Ken D
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon drive
reviews.comment: We had a few hours to kill in SLC and decided to take a picnic and drive up the canyon to Silver Lake. Beautiful drive and enjoyed the easy walk around the lake with several interpretive signs about the animals and vegetation in the area. Unfortunately didn't see any moose, but it was all quite beautiful. If we had had more time would have loved to take one of the trail heads along the canyon and take a hike.

reviews.name: Linda R
reviews.title: In Our Own Backyard
reviews.comment: We are only 5 minutes from the mouth the this canyon. Big Cottonwood is a place where we hike often. There is Silver Lake that is accessible for strollers and wheel chairs. And there are many trails near mountain streams such as the S-curve where there is parking and a bathroom. Camping is a favorite for many people and we even had our wedding ceremony at Storm Mountain park. If you are in the Salt Lake area, this is one of the many beautiful canyon to explore here in Utah.

reviews.name: TonyRK
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Rude path to the lake, but it worth it. We also saw moose very close to us. Important to bring water and food.

reviews.name: Tamar M
reviews.title: great hikes, wonderful wiew
reviews.comment: we did a nice hike there in September. beautiful scenery and a lot of options for short and long hikes.

reviews.name: utemom
reviews.title: Great easy walk Silver Lake
reviews.comment: Took my kids up to Brighton ski resort area and did the very easy and short hike around the lake there by the small visitor center. Fishing is allowed although we didn't catch anything. A few places to stop and sit along the way, very pretty. Easy for kids as all flat. There are a number of trails leading off on more strenuous hikes. Check with the visitor center. Bathrooms in the center.

reviews.name: randy7496
reviews.title: awesome drive
reviews.comment: we had a nice peceful drive up the canyon , nice views of the river and at the top we saw 2 moose which was really cool to see.,

reviews.name: Craftylady23
reviews.title: Haven
reviews.comment: We were looking for hiking near Salt Lake City. Several trails of varying difficulty are found at marked trailheads, several offer parking, trash recepticles and restrooms. Lovely views of rapids are found along the creek. The water and cottonwoods offer a cool respite to visitors. We observed many individuals, couples and families enjoying fishing, hiking, biking and climbing in the area.

reviews.name: Pam H
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenary
reviews.comment: Hiked to the top of Donut Falls. Interesting trees along the way, a semi steep climb. Moderate hike.

reviews.name: bamcraker
reviews.title: Lovely winding drive!
reviews.comment: Beautiful drive on the way up to Snowbird and Alta. What made it really special was the moose drinking from the stream!

reviews.name: Coffee48
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views
reviews.comment: This was an excellent three hour trip. Got to see some moose, took a nice walk and the views were amazing.

reviews.name: Gweneth13
reviews.title: Great Hiking and great Scenery
reviews.comment: To be honest, I didn't know what to expect when I went to SLC. My friend who is from this area took me to Cottonwood Canyon and I fell in love. (with the canyon) This area was beautiful and there was a ton of places to hike around to. They have porta potties all over the place so you don't get too far off the grid without the ability to use the facility. I will be back!

reviews.name: metraveleraway
reviews.title: Pretty
reviews.comment: A beautiful drive and perfect to see a little snow and some fall colors on trees. It is pretty any time of year!

reviews.name: ArlettaC
reviews.title: So beautiful!
reviews.comment: We were lucky to read about this beautiful area and work it in to our drive on our way from California to Colorado. I wish we had had time for some hiking, but at least we got to experience the sheer loveliness of rock, trees, cliffs, and water in their beautiful combinations. The geology is fascinating, the aspen trees in their fresh green baby leaves are beautiful, and there is a wealth of hiking trails and picnic areas ready for exploration and use. Breathtaking views around every turn.

reviews.name: buzltyr837
reviews.title: Spectacular Breath Taking Views ~ Always A Pleasure!
reviews.comment:
We moved to SLC in 1993 & this was one of our 1st treks into the mountainous area.
So close to SLC yet far enough to feel like your miles away. So much to do! Since moving here we usually plan a ride up to Big Cottonwood Canyon. Spend a day or a weekend in this Natural Forest Area & "get away from it all" And on the way back have dinner at one of the many Restaurants located just outside the Canyon Area. Check Tripadvisor for a Recommended Restaurant in the area. You can thank me
later!

reviews.name: somebodyhere
reviews.title: So much to do in the canyon
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is full of winter and summer activities. Lots of trails for hiking in the summer and snowshoeing in the winter. The Crest trail is one of the best mountain bike trails around. Also, both Brighton and Solitude are located in this canyon and are both great ski resorts, popular with the locals. Solitude is especially good during the weekdays as there are very small crowds but great skiing terrain. Brighton is popular with the snowboarding crowd.
Some of my favorite hikes are in Big Cottonwood Canyon. Dog Lake tops the list. Also, lots of preset rock climbing routes can be found in the canyon as well. The Slips is a popular rock climbing area with climbs of various ratings. Best part about the canyon is that it is only minutes from the Valley. No charge to get up the canyon and the hikes and rock climbs are free. Ski resorts to charge. Check their websites for current pricing.

reviews.name: KBSLC
reviews.title: A Hike to Remember
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon (BCC) offers great hikes, camping, winter skiing and snowboarding as well as incredible views. BCC is part of the Wasatch Mountain Range. There are some challenging hikes as well as some easy hikes during the spring, summer and fall. Please go to http://hikesandlakes.com/bigcottonwoodcanyon.html for a description of the hikes available and how to reach them. Be sure to have breakfast or lunch at the Silver Fork lodge on the way up the canyon. There are parts of the canyon where dogs are not allowed because it is a watershed area. Be sure to verify before bringing your canine hiking companion. Also, be weather wise for storms if on the forecast as lightning can be an issue. 6,500 to 10,000 ft. elevation. Dress with layers and bring water/food.
During ski season, there are immediate area hotels in Cottonwood Heights and Sandy, Utah, which means you can be up the ski hill in 25 to 40 minutes. Ski buses pick up boarders and ski buffs at the parking lot at the base of BCC.
There are also ski season and summer rentals up the mountain. Many are connected to Solitude Resort or Brighton Resort. Not all trails give access to bicycles. No ATVs or motorcycles on hiking trails. These are mountain trails and not wheel chair accessible.
Enjoy this beautiful area.

reviews.name: mioSaltLakeCity
reviews.title: Sightseeing at home.
reviews.comment: Great hiking, great skiing, thrilling scenery, a great place for exploration, one of the best things about living in Salt Lake -- so easy to get back into nature from the city.

reviews.name: Gtxtrem
reviews.title: Beautiful Place to ride a bike or anything else outdoors
reviews.comment:
In this Canyon you have access to world class biking, hiking, skiing/boarding, mountain biking. Two Ski resorts, and restaurants..... great place for just about anything.
From the mouth of the canyon we rode our bikes to the top. ~17 miles of up hill. great training ride to kick the season off. Not for beginners.
Easy access from just about anywhere in the SLC area.

reviews.name: mberg18
reviews.title: These Nebraskans are Impressed!
reviews.comment:
My husband and I recently relocated to SLC from Nebraska. The mountains are breathtaking! We are still acclimating to the higher elevation it seems, but some of the hikes are still doable for us. Even just driving you'll get some great views, but the hiking is even more beautiful.
Silver Lake is more of a walk for those who can't "hike," but it is at a very high elevation. We have even seen a moose! If unable to hike/walk around the lake, at least drive up to see it. It's literally right down the road from Brighton ski resort.
The Donut Falls hike isn't as strenuous as other hikes, but be warned it may be difficult in a few spots for little kids. We encountered a mom with three little ones, and my husband all but carried two of the kids across the river there and back, but even if you just go as far as the river and turn around, you've still seen very beautiful views. Also, we have seen a moose right off the road by the main parking lot here.
Just a note, as it was confusing to us at first, I wouldn't recommend parking in the parking lot on the main canyon road; take a right and head down the narrow road to the head of the trail, unless you feel up to a very long walk, the hike, then another very long walk back to your car. Parking is quite limited at the trailhead though.

reviews.name: Evan S
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon, Great Breakfast Restaurant--Silver Fork Diner
reviews.comment: Be sure to plan time in the summer to eat on the patio of the Silver Fork Lodge. I prefer breakfast, but lunch and dinner are good, too. The setting is breath-taking and the food is very good. Service is good, too. Be sure to have some of their Salt Lake Roasting Company Special Blend Coffee. Delish!

reviews.name: SunriseFitness
reviews.title: What is not to like?
reviews.comment: I love big and little cottonwood canyons. Lots to see, great easy drive, lot of hiking, fishing, walking, etc.

reviews.name: travelingrandma54
reviews.title: Worth the Drive!
reviews.comment: The drive up the Big Cottonwood Canyon was spectacular! We did a lot of driving while in the Salt Lake City area and this was one of the most amazing drives we took in 7 days. Plan a couple of hours for the trip up and back down. We were hoping to see wildlife, no luck with that. Someone told us that they had seen a moose there.

reviews.name: Stephanie E
reviews.title: East Coaster Amazed
reviews.comment: This was a great place to drive through and stop and take scenic pictures on a recent business trip.

reviews.name: Nancy L
reviews.title: Amazing!!!
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon is lovely. We like to hike and camp and it has many amazing trails and 2 really nice campgrounds.
Also great skiing and rock climbing.
It is really an all season park.

reviews.name: C_B782013
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment:
To drive up to the top of Big Cottonwood Canyon is an amazing experience. The scenery all the way up is beautiful. There are many places to hike, picnic, camp, eat, etc. The skiing at Solitude and Brighton are local favorites.
My favorite place is to hike around Silver Lake that is accessible to almost anyone. It is an easy hike and great fishing.

reviews.name: J L
reviews.title: GORGEOUS!!
reviews.comment: The views were GREAT! Everything from the drive in to departure was breathtaking. I only wish we were able to stay longer. Bring your family, they wont regret it!

reviews.name: njkuhr
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive, with lots of stops
reviews.comment: I love this area, when I used to live in slc, I would drive through canyons on days off pull over and park to walk the trails. There are plenty of picnick spots and so many views and a great place for nature photography. A relaxing drive does the trick as well. The road is windy and there are a lot of blind corners so pay close attention but there are plenty of places to pull over and not worry about being out in traffic.

reviews.name: Jared F
reviews.title: Indescribable
reviews.comment:
The giant granite cliffs are like no other. The awinspiring vistas will take your breath away while providing a plenapley of out door activities from hiking, to biking, rock climbing and snow skiing.
It is a must see if you are in the northern Utah area. Take a drive or the bus, up the canyon, spend the night at a hotel up the canyon and ride the tram to the top. You won't be sorry you did.

reviews.name: Paul V
reviews.title: A great drive and fun place to have a picnic
reviews.comment:
The views and vistas are beautiful all year round, but I prefer the fall and spring. You can find a pull-out stop and have a picnic and take in the views or go hiking.
Lot's of people stop and bike here.

reviews.name: Patricia D
reviews.title: Much better than Alta if you're a beginner
reviews.comment: So my daughter and I, and sister in law, had done lessons over Christmas here. Our teachers were simply wonderful. Don Johnson, my teacher, really improved my technique and confidence (my 4th lesson). But in March, we thought we'd try an area we hadn't skied, And Alta is always high on everyone's list. So, we tried it. Not fun. For one, the lessons for kids are huge in scale, they didn't pay much attention to individuals. Second, for my lesson, the guy gave me no help and instilled fear of skiing in me. I decided it was time to return to Solitude. That was the best decision! I found Don again, by chance, and he showed me how I was leaning back, gave me exercises to improve my technique and had me enjoying myself and doing much better by the end of the lesson going down Moonbeam. He basically saved skiing for me. He even had notes on me from December! The long beginner's hill was much better for my sister in law. It is small, intimate and caring. And no lines. Frankly, it's the best.

reviews.name: Scott S
reviews.title: Simply beautiful
reviews.comment: There are so many trails to hike, lakes to see, and views that overlook Salt Lake City, you can't go wrong. All of the trails are well marked and offer varying degrees of difficulty, and the fact that they allow dogs every other day is also great.

reviews.name: scribblin
reviews.title: Great Sledding
reviews.comment: Out-of-town family members wanted to go sledding, and a local recommended a spot along the Donut Falls Trail. It was fantastic! We found everything from long, quick runs to fairly steep drops. The sledding was so good that we returned two more days in a row. Great memories!

reviews.name: Abhirup D
reviews.title: In March the Canyon is just a nice drive.
reviews.comment: I heard about the high ratings for this place. Frankly speaking, if you are from Colorado, like us, this is just another drive through canyon. You cannot compare this with the marvelous canyons we find in Colorado. Just for local sentiment, it's worth a drive.

reviews.name: Sherry B
reviews.title: Snow shoeing at Solitude Nordic Center
reviews.comment: Had a wonderful time snow shoeing in the Silver Lake area. Cost in the winter, with your own equipment, $5/person. It was a very warm day & the the snow was icy & slushy, but still fun. Will return again. Wonderful views around the lake.

reviews.name: slc5rings
reviews.title: Silver Fork Lodge - A Great Getaway
reviews.comment: The employees at Silver Fork Lodge make you feel like it's your mom cooking for you and serving you. The menu is limited, but all of the items are well thought-out and prepared. They have an excellent variety of alcoholic beverages. And in warmer or sunny weather you can eat out on the south-facing deck. Overall, a great experience

reviews.name: David L
reviews.title: Hate to say how good it is. Don't want it more crowded.
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful canyon - winter, spring, summer, and fall. So close to major metropolitan area that it is loved to death. Impossible to totally get away from people, but some areas and trails are less populated than others. I hike various areas accessed by this canyon in every season. Winter is the best due to the least people.

reviews.name: Sandra J
reviews.title: The canyons in Utah are amazing!
reviews.comment: You really need to visit this canyon and as many others in Utah as you can. Especially gorgeous in the summer.

reviews.name: tt4
reviews.title: Solitude
reviews.comment: A delightful place to ski - should I be telling people about a place with tons of steeps and no crowds? It's a really nice alternative to Alta and Snowbird a canyon over --

reviews.name: vanner1
reviews.title: Some of the best snow near SLC!
reviews.comment: Don't be fooled by Park City, the Cottonwoods consistently get more snow! Skiers and snowboarders, head this way!

reviews.name: vjgonzo3
reviews.title: Glimps of an early Spring
reviews.comment: As anyone familiar with this part of the world knows, anytime the weather allows is a great time for a drive through Big Cottonwood Canyon. This trip allowed us to see the early glimpses of Spring. The Canyon terrain itself is showings buds on trees and shrubs, as well as a short growth of green grasses. Looking up toward Mount Olympus shows new growth on the pines, and topped with fresh powder giving great contrast and providing for stunning photo's. From taking pictures to getting your hiking on you will find something to smile about. From Big Cottonwood you can also enjoying the views to the west of the canyon, of the Oquirrh Mountains off in the distance.

reviews.name: Arlingtoniantravelle
reviews.title: Brighton Ski Resort is the best
reviews.comment: Every winter I make sure I ski at Brighton when I am visiting SLC. It's only 45 minutes from downtown and the drive up Big Cottonwood Canyon is breathtaking. Brighton has reasonable rates and lots of blue/ green trails, which are great for east coast skiers like me.

reviews.name: Patricia C
reviews.title: Life Elevated in Twenty Minutes
reviews.comment: Big Cottonwood Canyon is a treat any time of the year. Bring walking shoes, sun screen, a hat, water, and be prepared for the cooler temperature. Get the scenic stops and restaurant opportunities.

reviews.name: dennis l
reviews.title: Beautiful area
reviews.comment: All of our canyons are beautiful....winter is or can be open or closed due to weather....in spring / summer / fall it is a great ride.

reviews.name: sonofa61
reviews.title: great
reviews.comment: very beautiful hiking and trails excellent plenty to do and see very accesable and easy access from the city

reviews.name: Laci10
reviews.title: Solitude Ski Area
reviews.comment: Beautiful area, enjoyed the skiing. My husband and I teach skiing at Grand Targhee Resort in Wyoming. We used to live in Utah but had never skied Solitude. We so enjoyed it and would highly recommend it.

reviews.name: chrus59
reviews.title: Great Skiing at Solitude
reviews.comment: Solitude is a family friendly mountain with groomed runs and great views. It is the perfect mountain. It is a great destination for families and eastern skiers.

reviews.name: RandBrad
reviews.title: Brighton & Solitude
reviews.comment: These two mountains are the best deal in skiing in the USA!! So much mountain and Utah snow for $70/day or so. Can't beat it.

reviews.name: Todd J
reviews.title: Enjoy Big Cottonwood Canyon by Running it
reviews.comment: The most beautiful time of year to enjoy the canyon is in the fall. The best way to do it is, why not RUN IT. A full and half marathon will take place again this year September 12, 2015. The BIG COTTONWOOD CANYON (Go Big) is incredible. The full starts at Brighton Ski Resort and the half starts at Solitude Ski Resort. While running the sun rises and you see the fall color glimmer in the leaves. GO BIG.

reviews.name: RobertCSlc
reviews.title: Awesome canyon
reviews.comment: The views are great both during the summer and winter. Hiking is amazing. Skiing is great. Silver lake is a must during the summer. Brighton is a great resort during the winter.

reviews.name: Angelus-haven
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Beautiful. Love going on hikes. Breath taking scenery. Great for the family. Nature at its best. Bring plenty of water and food shoes. Temperatures drop at night so be prepared and being a jacket even if it's warm out.

reviews.name: ShilienKnight
reviews.title: A true beauty.
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful canyon in Utah imo. Offered a wide variety of recreation activities, be it a simple camping near the lake, an interesting ride up the hill, or even a tough hike. if you're into some real action, snow shoeing could also be your cup of tea - but remember, don't take Mother Nature lightly!

reviews.name: Jon K
reviews.title: Best snow on earth!
reviews.comment: So if you're a skier, you got to heaven and didn't have to die to get there! Ain't too much more to say...

reviews.name: Anthony M
reviews.title: Pure Beauty
reviews.comment: A beautiful place to go on a little drive and view some nature and neet hiking spots. dress worm and always prepare for safety. Highly recomended.

reviews.name: Joe H
reviews.title: Amazing snow shoeing
reviews.comment: Did some snowshoeing today. We went to the Guardman Pass trail, which started off with great views in the parking area, getting better from there. My only complaint was that snowmobiles were riding in the off-limit area. The trail was moderate enough for a sea-level person like me, yet still offered a challenge for my SLC friends.

reviews.name: Hafsa A
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Its a beautiful area, and great for hiking. Depending on where you go, it is a pretty tough hike, so make sure you're wearing good hiking shoes and have plenty of water

reviews.name: ufan2014
reviews.title: silver fork lodge
reviews.comment: Great place to eat breakfast ! this place is very cozy and it has great food ! Loved the fireplace with a great view of the snowed mountains. would highly recommended !!

reviews.name: FairCityFrasie
reviews.title: Awe-Inspiring Drive
reviews.comment: Very scenic drive up the canyon with its craggy mountains and cliff-faces (especially Strom Mountain). Winding drive holds interest at every turn - especially the 360 degrees left and then 360 degrees right that winds the road halfway up the canyon (the SatNav suggested I make a left and then a right.....it was the only route possible!). With the snow too, the whole atmosphere is a splendid one.

reviews.name: JoeBTraveler
reviews.title: fantastic
reviews.comment: Always a treat to visit this beautiful canyon while driving to Solitude. Often overlooked for Park City & Alta/Snowbird.Bring snow chains!

reviews.name: carrolljd
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: I came to SLC on business, but I stayed an extra day just to get up in the mountains. I stayed at the Residence Inn on Little Cottonwood Parkway so I was ready to go when I woke up on my day off. I was hoping for snow-capped peaks, but it was 60 degrees in SLC in December and I didn't get my wish. The drive, however, was still beautiful. I would love to do it with someone else driving sometime so I could focus on the views, but I took what I could get. I need to come back in the summer when all of the trees have leaves on them.

reviews.name: samanthas609
reviews.title: Beautiful Drive
reviews.comment: This drive is beautiful in the summer and fall, before they close it for the winter. Head up BCC to Guardsman's Pass and drop down into Park City. Great trails, beautiful views. Solitude has an awesome Disc Golf Course also!

reviews.name: Lesley D
reviews.title: 1/2 marathon
reviews.comment: You have to come here for the 1/2 or full marathon in September. It is one of the, if not THE best races I have been to. Beautiful canyon running when leaves are turning color, super organized, amazing finisher's medal, plenty of hotel deals and places to eat........this has become a tradition that brings more of us each year to attend. Go, have fun, make great memories, and post the FASTEST TIME EVER!! I I got a PR at this race by 11 minutes!!

reviews.name: GADGET1967
reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW
reviews.comment: The canyons surrounding SLC are all amazing and this one is no different, with vibrant colours and amazing landscapes a real contrast to the city itself, the fresh air is exhilarating

reviews.name: Mark W
reviews.title: Behold the true beauty of Mother Nature!
reviews.comment: An excellent trail for hiking lovers. The view on the way is superb, and on the other hand the trails also tend to be harder than some other trails around the area. If you don't like hiking, you can try the ski resort here in the winter season. It's also amazing!

reviews.name: jerald t
reviews.title: Breath taking
reviews.comment: This is to place to be if your an outdoor person looking for the perfect hiking trip. The nature was beautiful

reviews.name: arualpalm
reviews.title: Good hiking and views
reviews.comment: Stop at some of the trails along the way; these trails tend to be steeper than those found in Little Cottonwood Canyon. Good, majestic views. Keep driving to see Guardsman Pass. Go to the bathroom before you start.

reviews.name: Alicia L
reviews.title: Nature, yay!
reviews.comment: It was lightly snowing the afternoon my friend and I took a drive up to the ski resorts. Gorgeous views and the snow was so pretty. I can't wait to come back to go hiking!

reviews.name: 780Globetrotter
reviews.title: Don't miss this one!
reviews.comment: So much to do! In the winter, 2 ski resorts,snow shoe, go sledding, photographers haven, and even picnic! It's my favorite for something close to home (20 minutes from SLC) on Christmas morning! A quick snow shoe trip in the woods is an awesome way to start the holiday! Just as much to do in the other seasons with lots of hiking trails and waterfalls. Silver Lake at the top is a great walk (1 hour) for families.

reviews.name: NED541287
reviews.title: A wonderful morning walk
reviews.comment: The drive up here was very scenic. Had to admire the dedication of the cyclists tackling the climb too! Parked at Silver Lake and had a walk around it first. Then headed uphill and, eventually, reached the lake at the top of the trail (a reservoir I believe). Would usually be an easy walk for us, but we live almost at sea level - so the altitude takes a bit of getting used to! It was a beautiful day and it's a beautiful place.

reviews.name: csolsen2
reviews.title: No place is more beautiful.
reviews.comment: Okay, I am biased a little. Living here pretty much my whole life, their is nothing I love more than to jump in my Jeep with the top down and the doors off, and drive up this canyon in the fall. It is majestic. Go for a hike, take a walk through the aspen groves. Have a bite at Snowbird or The Shallow Shaft. When you do, you will understand what makes Utah the place it is. Open the windows, put the top down on your car. Smell the air. You will understand.

reviews.name: pblaha
reviews.title: You need a full day to truly appreciate this place.
reviews.comment: If you are looking for something to do while in SLC, Big Cottonwood Canyon will not disappoint. Talk about scenic views, this area has many hiking trails. You can easily spend an entire day here.

reviews.name: yyyzzz_utah
reviews.title: plenty of hiking trails and fun spots
reviews.comment: if you are an avid hiker, you are lucky to have big cottonwood canyon around. there are plenty of well maintained trails around. at the end are silver lake and a number of alpine lakes. in the winter time, it is a great location for skiing.

reviews.name: C M
reviews.title: Holy scenery batman
reviews.comment: Great little, narrow and slow drive up to the ski resorts above. The rock formations are amazing and the transition from desert to forest and alpine is breathtaking. This is a must-do trek for visitors.

reviews.name: ssparkd
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: Easy drive, lots of pull-offs. Hikes and scenery outstanding. We traveled the Guardsman Pass both ways. Saw a large moose along the way.

reviews.name: Stephanie S
reviews.title: Hiked Lake Blanche
reviews.comment: We hiked Lake Blanche on Friday October 10 and it was perfect! The weather could not have been more gorgeous, and the fall colors were out in full force. All in, this hike took us about 4 hours.... Not gonna lie, it was tough! The first 2-ish hours were uphill, until you get to the lake. We took several stops on the way up, to catch our breath, drink water, and snap photos. The scenery along this hike is breathtaking, one of the most beautiful places I've visited. Once you reach the top, Lake Blanche is equally beautiful - incredibly peaceful and serene. We didn't see many people on the way up (started around 8:15 am), but saw lots of folks on the way down. If you're in reasonable shape, I would 100% do this hike.

reviews.name: Jeff11382014
reviews.title: Lots of room to explore
reviews.comment: I've been here many times and have not even begun to explore all the trails and campsites. There is something here for everyone. Lots of beautiful nature to explore.

reviews.name: cleoder
reviews.title: Scenic drive
reviews.comment: Great rock out crops with high canyon walls as you climb through here going to Park City. Cool spot.

reviews.name: Runforfunn
reviews.title: Worth the drive
reviews.comment: Unbelievable views as you drive through the canyon. Loved the hike around Silver Lake at the top. We then drove to Park City with even more great views.

reviews.name: dasb3ar
reviews.title: YES! A MUST!!!
reviews.comment: We drove through the canyon during a thunderstorm and it was BREATHTAKING!!! The pouring rain added to the rushing rivers that flowed through the mountain. The fog and storm clouds made the mountain so mystical and romantic. It was breathtaking driving around every bend and turn. During the fall, the trees were changing colors and the forest was incredible! We couldn't help ourselves and had to stop every few minutes or so and snap photos. It was so refreshing being in the storm in the middle of the canyon! Stop by Park City and enjoy a cup of coffee and shop the boutique stores!

reviews.name: KThom_3
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: I had a lifetime of an opportunity to take the cable car to the top of The mountain. We were let out to take in the breathtaking scenery at 11,000 feet! I felt as if I could tough the clouds!! It is a must do and take a camera!

reviews.name: Suz206
reviews.title: LOVE Big Cottonwood - SPECTACULAR hiking and scenery
reviews.comment: loved the hiking and the Silver Fork Lodge is a great place to visit after a hike. Lake Blanche is amazing.

reviews.name: EJSLC
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyon
reviews.comment: Amazing scenery, particularly beautiful in the autumn months. Great skiing in the winter. Nice in the summer to get away from the heat.

reviews.name: aubpgh
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: Such a beautiful place to visit. Perfect place for taking great pictures of the natural landscape of the area. Will definitely be back again

reviews.name: Spencer J
reviews.title: This is a spectacular canyon drive.
reviews.comment:
If you haven't lived in the mountains, or even if you have, this is a great canyon. And there is also little Cottonwood canyon. Very inspiring and awesome. Leading to great Ski Resorts.
The best in the world.
Spence

reviews.name: Cobby C
reviews.title: Beautiful place
reviews.comment: My wife ran the Big Cottonwood Marathon and couldn't stop gushing about the beauty of the scenery as they ran. The next day we drove up the canyon, stopping at various points to do a little hiking and climbing and take pictures. Definitely something to do when you're in SLC.

reviews.name: Susan B
reviews.title: Beautiful Photographs
reviews.comment: I was with a group of about 200 photographers. We captured some beautiful landscape photos. We took a bus from Salt Lake City from the conference.

reviews.name: PaulL9
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Marathon
reviews.comment: This canyon was so beautiful. My first trip to Utah will last in my memory because of my time in this canyon.

reviews.name: Sjennie B
reviews.title: Worth the drive
reviews.comment: The Big Cotton Woods Canyon is truly amazing, we pulled over a few times to take pictures of the giant rock mountains. Definitely recommend going there if you like mountains.

reviews.name: Akkur01
reviews.title: Big Cottonwood Canyod
reviews.comment: There is not much to see other than an urban trail very close to a highway. No Canyon at all. We parked near the trail and took a walk along the trail.

reviews.name: DesertGirl1956
reviews.title: Truly spectacular vistas through Big Cottonwood Canyon. Must see for any mountain lovers.
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood Canyon, Little Cottonwood and Wasatch Mountains are what's worth seeing in
Salt Lake City. The sheer beauty of the mountains, the massive rock formations and upward vistas provide stunning viewing around each bend. Many trails for hiking, rock climbing or just getting off the road into the forest. Skip the man-made architechure of Temple Square and drive through Big Cottonwood Canyon to see the real thing!

reviews.name: Nana2B2
reviews.title: Great nature trip
reviews.comment: I love the 'S' curve on this road to stop and take a short walk to a spot that is just down from the road but gets you really close to the creek. Level and great for all ages and abilities. Silverlake at the top of the canyon is also a great place for families to picnic, hike, enjoy the view.

reviews.name: AnninSLC
reviews.title: Fall Drive
reviews.comment: If you want to see fall colors and spectacular mountains, maybe some wild life try this drive. Be careful - drive slowly, enjoy the beauty and don't come to close to the many cyclists who will be enjoying the canyon road with you.

reviews.name: AnaBaile
reviews.title: How did we miss this all these years? Easy hike and quite renewing experience.
reviews.comment: I guess we were a bit "snobbish" about our outdoor experiences after living in northwest Montana for many years; although we have found wonderful sights and adventures in Utah. It always seemed that the hikes near Salt Lake City were overused and underwhelming. Although Big Cottonwood Canyon is a busy place, a group of friends hiked up to Lake Solitude last week and found, well, solitude. And no mosquitoes. The trail starts at the Silver Lake center (restrooms available) and is a pretty easy 1.5 mile hike up to a small, yet pretty lake. Anyone (almost, there is a somewhat steep short portion just before arriving at the lake) could do this easy trail. I recommend it for a little morning getaway. We headed up the trail around 10 a.m. We only saw a very few people on our way up, then had the lake to ourselves for about 20 minutes. On our way back down the trail we passed quite a few people as they ventured up. Now I regret not doing more cerca-City exploring over the years. It was really a delightful morning.

reviews.name: IslandGuy376
reviews.title: Scenic But Not Visitor Friendly
reviews.comment: I read about hiking/walking trails but there was no apparent welcome station or anything else that would guide you to the various walks. We also saw signs that indicated dogs were not welcome. Get some proper water treatment and get over it Salt Lake. All animals poop in the wild and while we bag ours, most of the wildlife doesn't.

reviews.name: YvieLeeds_
reviews.title: Great city getaway
reviews.comment: We had a fabulous day with our two boys here. Very beautiful areas with quite a lot of wildlife to see. We were so disappointed however that when we arrived at silver lake we just missed out on the moose which had been sunbathing for more than an hour. Some people told us that it went into the bushes just before we arrived. It was still a lovely place to visit and the walk through the trees from solitude to silver lake as it was really peaceful as there were hardly any people around. The drive through the canyon was beautiful and only 20 mins drive from the hustle and bustle of the city.

reviews.name: Rather_Nomadic
reviews.title: Scenic drive for lots of hiking options
reviews.comment: I used Big Cottonwood Canyon road to access the Silver Lake hiking area up by Brighton Ski Resort. There is plenty of parking near the Silver Lake visitor center and you can use that trail to access Twin Lakes and Lake Solitude hikes as well. Silver Lake visitor center has restrooms, trashcans and water. Great half day adventure from Salt Lake City proper. Even with kids, the Silver Lake loop is relatively flat and fine for strollers.

reviews.name: drillerboy
reviews.title: a scenic drive
reviews.comment: We just had a couple hours to kill so we drove up to the Solitude Ski area, it was a very scenic drive, and a lot of cyclists were making the climb on a good shoulder. We would like to go back for a hike sometime

reviews.name: Ricardo35
reviews.title: What a treat!
reviews.comment:
The canyon is beautiful, pleasant temperature of 70F during August. There a lot of picnic areas, creeks and green areas for nature's lovers. Early in the morning is less crowded than afternoons.
Several hiking trails, one better than the other...a must see canyon!

reviews.name: Dan R
reviews.title: As if Big Cottonwood were just one thing. . .
reviews.comment:
Are you coming skiing, summer sporting, picnicking, hiking, snowshoeing, concert going. . .
A bit meaningless to write a general review, but Big Cottonwood pretty much gets 5 stars on all the above. I haven't done a lot of the trails yet, but Lake Blanche was outstanding.

reviews.name: Stolen Buick
reviews.title: Close to City - Easy Drive - All levels of Access
reviews.comment: Very close to the city and an essay trip if you are visiting. The drive itself is about 30 minutes and is a very beautiful, canyon and mountain drive with lots of places to pull over, view, hike, picnic, etc. (I visited in August but it is a four season wonder). We drove about 12 miles in to the lake and did both the board walk hike which is short and east for anyone and is accessible so perfect for kids, seniors or whatever – and has awesome views of the lake and mountains! If you are more of a hiker, there are a many wonderful trails with vistas and views. Just a great experience overall and not to be missed if you are visiting SLC!

reviews.name: LASocialWorket
reviews.title: Pretty drive
reviews.comment: Mill D North a Fork Trail is a must see and do. Easy walk around Silver Lake, beautiful setting, and great opportunity to see wildlife.

reviews.name: Tim F
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: We try and go up this canyon once a week. There are many trails, rivers, lakes, and wildlife to see and enjoy.

reviews.name: Anonymous1366
reviews.title: Not to be missed for its scenic highway, challenging hikes, and towering canyon walls amid the aspens.
reviews.comment: Lots of traffic on this highway can be challenging, and frustrating. But go early, and plan a hike or at least a walk around Silver Lake up near Brighton.

reviews.name: awilk7
reviews.title: Emerald Escape
reviews.comment:
Big Cottonwood is a great escape from the urban Wasatch Front, both winter and summer. In 10 minutes, you can be off of I-215 and into a rugged, mountainous chasm on the way to waterfalls, woods, and alpine lakes and peaks.
Besides the obvious (skiing), I've enjoyed sport climbing, hiking, snowshoeing, camping, scrambling, and picnicking in Big Cottonwood. It is a great place for all of the above.
Parking is either excellent or challenging, depending upon the crowds and where you plan to go (Silver Lake Trailhead: easy, S-Curve Trailhead: tougher on a busy summer day unless you get there early).
Lake Blanche is a prototypical alpine lake: clear, beautiful water with wildflowers below and craggy peaks above. The lake is a great place to start if you are wanting to delve deeper into the Wasatch Range, away from the roads and ski resorts.

reviews.name: princespoison
reviews.title: mARY, mARTHA AND cATHRINE!!!
reviews.comment:
Silver lake is a fantastic little lake that is easily accessible and 30 to walk around the whole lake but for the hikers its all about the Sisters. Yes, there is several all over the top of Big Cottonwood Canyon but as a pro photographer Mary's lake is not to bad of a hike with newer, easier trails and the landscape in and around Mary's Lake is awesome and good for cliff jumping too.
