reviews.name: kimmer26
reviews.title: wendover will
reviews.comment: we've seen him each time we've been in Wendover. It's interesting the first time, but then just becomes the "norm"

reviews.name: PFW1234
reviews.title: road sign
reviews.comment: I am a old person now but remember going to Wendover as a youth with my parents and seeing the BIG cowboy sign waving as you come in to town and it still does.

reviews.name: happy4travel
reviews.title: What a cool guy!
reviews.comment:
This is the coolest guy EVER! We were traveling along Wendover and saw this amazing cowboy along the road. Of course we had to take pictures!
FYI: I'm in love with Wendover Will :)

reviews.name: OregonMs
reviews.title: Love this guy.
reviews.comment: Wendover Will is a cool guy and makes an otherwise austire place seem welcome and friendly. Wendover would not be the same without him.

reviews.name: flexitdriver
reviews.title: Interesting statue on the entrance to town
reviews.comment: Unsure of the history of this statue, but stopped on roadside to get photo, illuminated at night too!

reviews.name: Joan H
reviews.title: Interesting Landmark
reviews.comment: Not a very long walk from the Rainbow and in the evening there wasn't much traffic so it was easy to get over to the statue. Not very good surrounding light for nighttime photography

reviews.name: RedHornet72653
reviews.title: Hes a big greeter...
reviews.comment: Nother to share really. He just stands there when you enter town and lights up at night. The Las Vegas style downtown appeal of Front Street.

reviews.name: C9671DNjill

reviews.name: The Total Package
reviews.title: I love Neon
reviews.comment: This is really cool! Especially at night. Beautiful retro neon sign at the west end of town. Great for photos with the lights of Wendover in the background. Lights up front and back and is seen from I-80.

reviews.name: SraGlover

reviews.comment: I believe is kind of "reference" point, you can easily see the statue from almost every place of town, nice to take a pic as a memento.

reviews.name: Perkadventures
reviews.title: Wendover Will
reviews.comment: Big Statue in the middle of the road. Park car safely and walk over to see front and back. It is my understanding that Wendover Will is lighted at night, see if possible. Near by is the Victory Highway Monuments to see also.

reviews.name: Linda D
reviews.title: Good photo op
reviews.comment: He stands right in the middle of the road.Small area to pull off to get a good picture.Not much in Wendover except casinos.

reviews.name: TedSLC
reviews.title: It's ok as far as signs go
reviews.comment: I mean, it's a neon sign. In the middle of the road. It's fun and you'll probably want to take a selfie in front of it, but that's about all.

reviews.name: butch447
reviews.title: Will

reviews.name: ekpresley
reviews.title: Vintage sign in Wendvoer.
reviews.comment: Neat to see it and tell everyone "you've been there". Not much to see in Wendover. Make sure you get a tour of the salt flats and the old airforce base, a piece of history that is quite amazing.

reviews.name: tshaw34
reviews.title: Cute
reviews.comment: Fun welcome to and thank you for visiting Wendover. Had our pics taken with the iconic figure. Nothing too crazy fun about it other than being part of the Wendover experience.

reviews.name: Lm D
reviews.title: Mr. Wendover Will is pretty cool.
reviews.comment:
Mr. Will is pretty cool. Big ol' cowboy statue/sign, made of neon. He is pretty impressive during the day, but more so at night when he is all lit up.
The reception clerk at the hotel says all the locals say Mr. Will is pointing at West Wendover, the town. We took a look the morning we left, and yes, indeed, it appears he is doing so.
Good to visit for a highway stop. Food is nearby, there are casinos if you are so inclined. You can explain to your kids what he has hanging out of his mouth!

reviews.name: groupleader45212
reviews.title: Iconic sign
reviews.comment:
I always love to see this iconic sign at the end of the street . It is a flashback to the 50’s and always brings a smile.
You can buy a magnet or key chain of this smiling guy

reviews.name: Torgy2travel
reviews.title: Fun stop for a photo
reviews.comment: Wendover Will was a fun stop to take a group photo or a selfie. Our tour guy stopped for us to take our picture.

reviews.name: sweetatr
reviews.title: Kinda Cute Welcome Mascot
reviews.comment: Stopped by here to take a look then came back at night to see all of the colors. Very nice welcome mascot for the city. Good place to stop for a picture.

reviews.name: pers0nalview
reviews.title: Blast from the past
reviews.comment: It is an iconic blast from the past. Sort of like the old Las Vegas sing or the Reno arch. I think it is great that they have preserved a little of the past in an ever remodeled world. It only takes a second to see but brings back memories of a better time.

reviews.name: 499theresas
reviews.title: If you're in the area, might as well stop by. :)
reviews.comment: Wendover Will is on the opposite side of town from Montego Bay, but really only about a mile away. We drove to it at night the first time. The kids thought it was really cool to see a 30 ft lit up cowboy in a "gambling" town. Completely different from our town. :) There is a grassy area at the base, so you may take pictures. We parked in front of it, just a little off of the road, which is probably not what the township wants you to do, but the traffic was very light. We hopped out very quickly and took a quick picture.

reviews.name: toad69
reviews.title: Eye catching and impressive
reviews.comment:
We loved driving from Utah to Nevada on the old road through Wendover into West Wendover.
It was such a stark contrast literally one side old town quiet then Nevada big brash and riotously alive all summed up by Wendover Will as historically important as Vegas Vic.
A bit of history below from wiki
Pat Denner was commissioned to design the sign for the Stateline Casino in 1952. Denner had just completed the Vegas Vic sign that was erected in 1951. The sign was constructed by The Young Electric Sign Company.
Wendover Will was named after the town of Wendover and William Smith, who founded the Stateline Casino. The 63-foot-tall (19 m) sign was intended to draw travelers in from US Highways 40 and 50, later known as Interstate 80. The sign includes 1,184 feet (361 m) of neon tubing.[2] When driving east on Interstate 80 a caption under the sign reads, "This is the place," apparently in homage to Brigham Young. When driving west the caption reads, "Where the West begins".

reviews.name: Kim S
reviews.title: Will waves "howdy"

reviews.name: H2 O
reviews.title: So Fun!
reviews.comment: This is what I love about Nevada...the Neon! And Wendover Willy does not disappoint! So fun to get a picture! And you can get right up close!

reviews.name: tbeach2002
reviews.title: Pretty Neat
reviews.comment: Did not realize he was an old icon, until I saw the Movie "Worlds fastest Indian" lol Pretty Neat. that they kept him around.

reviews.name: Doug E
reviews.title: Break up road trip
reviews.comment: Stop and say hi to wendover Will. Smile and wave if you must drive by. Check out the Victory road eagle and marked near by. Think of travel along this road in a wagon.

reviews.name: Bellanca
reviews.title: So NIce They Saved This Guy
reviews.comment: Yes, there was a version of this guy in Vegas, Reno and Wendover at one or another casino. Now he has been saved and stands on his own pedestal on the west side of town. He is just a fun deal to see. He was here when I was a kid like these grandkids. I am still impressed with the old sign after seventy years!

reviews.name: selpap35
reviews.title: Awesome photo op
reviews.comment: It's cool when he's lit up, but still fun to take pictures. It is free to the public. Wendover is small enough, that you can walk to visit him.

reviews.name: Jeremy H
reviews.title: A Nastalgic piece of Wendover history
reviews.comment: A big tall cowboy facade on the west end near Smith's market. It used to be near the casinos on the East end of Wendover but it was moved years ago.

reviews.name: mini
reviews.title: Iconic Wendover Will, West Wendover, Nevada
reviews.comment: We went to see Wendover Will, which is a sign landmark for West Wendover. The sign was originally made for the Stateline Casino in 1952. West Wendover is a casino town on the Nevada/Utah border.

reviews.name: Tim H
reviews.title: Nostalgic
reviews.comment: Always would see Wendover Will as we drove to California for family vacation. Had to stop by and see him as an adult!

reviews.name: Raylene Brown
reviews.title: Been there, done that and got a photo
reviews.comment: Grabbing a photo of waving Wendover Will is a must when you are passing through the town. He is located on the west end of main street, near the liquor store and grocery store.

reviews.name: BigSmittyx7
reviews.title: Cool statue!

reviews.name: Amanda B
reviews.title: Wendover Fun!
reviews.comment: Wendover Will is always great to see... Shows the history of Wendover and is always bright at night.

reviews.name: Fran G

reviews.comment: As you ride through the town of Wendover, you will find Wendover Will at the end of the strip. This is a very large figure of a cowboy that is very welcoming and fun for children to see. We were there during the daytime. I think it lights up at night.

reviews.name: Zipperwill
reviews.title: You can visit the entire town on the shuttle and it friendly and comfortable.
reviews.comment: This is one gambling town that will NOT rip you off. The people are nice and the businesses are there to serve you and not just take your money and leave you stranded.

reviews.name: randkbara
reviews.title: Its a great town to visit
reviews.comment: They have many hotels, great workers. Friendliness about town . The hotel people go out of their way to help you and make you feel comfortable.

reviews.name: troy f
reviews.title: Nice town sight to see
reviews.comment: Right in the middle of the town road there is Will standing tall it's a great sight to see and you need to visit when your here.

reviews.title: Very Cool

reviews.name: queenbeejane
reviews.title: wendover trip

reviews.name: Jaime Y
reviews.title: Kool sign and very interesting historical site right next to it
reviews.comment: The sign is visible for miles. It's just up the road from the major SMITHS Market. It's not unusual to see people taking pictures of friends next to it.

reviews.name: sndovale
reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment: Arriving after dark and seeing this iconic piece still here after decades was cool. Took a picture which came out good.

reviews.comment: Nice welcome, cute idea Guess he's seen a lot of people Been here many years I imagine. Don't know any history or who made him up.

reviews.name: onetoonehundred

reviews.comment: It was probably in a better spot in its original place at the border but it still looks good where it is now. Easy to take a good photo day or night and worth the effort.

reviews.title: A fun welcome
reviews.comment: Will was a site for sore, tired eyes! We had driven for nine hours, ready for rest first, then fun! ...and we did

reviews.name: clarissatrujillo
reviews.title: Wendover Will!
reviews.comment: You can't visit Wendover without visiting the famous Wendover Will Statue! This guy has been around for years!

reviews.name: norman v
reviews.title: Historic sign used to belong to one casino, the city fixed it up and kept it for everyone.
reviews.comment: North of Wendover Will sign, right in front of the new City building, is a historic gravel road with about seven roadside information signs about all the history of this area. Military training area, telephone wires, Lincoln Highway location, railroad tracks, pioneers crossing the salt flats, land speed records set on the salt flats. Allow an hour to read all the interesting information.

reviews.name: Suzi S
reviews.title: Pretty cool guy....
reviews.comment:

Just off the main road, so it worth the 1 minute drive up the road.
Snapped my pic with Will and headed back to SLC. Pretty cool day.

reviews.name: Anne M

reviews.title: Embrace Your Touristy Side and Snap a Shot

reviews.title: Great Photo Opportunity

reviews.name: NMC_12
reviews.title: Typical Roadside America
reviews.comment: Reminds me of the cowboy down in Vegas. Small America trying to leave its own mark to be remembered.

reviews.name: TAMAN1951
reviews.title: Can you say hokie
reviews.comment:
Huge welcome sign decked out in neon lights.
Not much here really but you cannot miss it if coming into town.
Part of roadside America for sure.

reviews.name: 59GypsyGirl
reviews.title: Howdy gamblers
reviews.comment: Walk over from the Red Garter and immerse yourself in some city history. I love knowing about the places I visit. There are several plaques to read and be greeted by Will.

reviews.name: TravelingMedTech
reviews.title: Best welcome in town
reviews.comment: Wendover Will is an local town icon for over a century. A must see and snap a picture of the huge icon. He's arm was not moving the day I was there but the cigarette was a waving back and forth at night. Truly a great quick 2 minute stop at the end of town.

reviews.name: Treadmillace
reviews.title: Tin and neon is at the heart of this Nevada triplet
reviews.comment: Resurrected and restored, Wendover will stands at the edge of casino row, waiting to be gazed at and photographed. Luckily the road he's on isn't too busy, he sits in the middle with an ambiguous space of asphalt which is unlikely a safe place to park, but deters no one from just stopping. He has two brothers made by Young Electric Sign Co: Vegas Vic, (downtown Vegas) and River Rick (Laughlin NV). A must see, and the easiest way / beacon to find Smiths, when you run out of beef jerky and bourbon.

reviews.name: Steven W
reviews.title: Can't Miss Him
reviews.comment: If you visit Wendover, you'll most likely spot him. He's tall and stands out, especially at night. An icon of a bygone era that still lives on.

reviews.name: Dunn45
reviews.title: Well Known
reviews.comment: The electric cowboy with the waiving arm has been here "forever." He is iconic. He is a fun "sight."

reviews.name: R T
reviews.title: A Wendover Icon
reviews.comment: The cool thing about Wendover Will is that the 63-year-old icon has been preserved, but placed on the western outskirts of town. A cousin of "Vegas Vic" Will is no longer animated.

reviews.name: LaVidaBuono
reviews.title: The Single Attraction in West Wendover
reviews.comment: How this is not the number one attraction here escapes me. I mean, besides hanging out at the Love's Truck Stop, this is THE THING to see and do here in West Wendover. If you are staying here, it is a MUST SEE.

reviews.name: Yodelman
reviews.title: old road remnant
reviews.comment: Wendover sits along legendary roads of passage across the desert and salt flats. At the Montego Bay Casino, there's a restored Lincoln Hwy marker--a later alignment of the Lincoln was routed to Wendover then down to Ely. And Wendover was also along the Victory Hwy (back when roads had names not numbers), named for the WW1 veterans. Wendover Will used to sit by one of the casinos some years ago, but now he has been relocated to the west side of town, on the old highway leading out to rejoin the interstate. It's nice to see a remnant of the old road culture survive in 2015.

reviews.name: JoeS1828
reviews.title: Our trip to WENDOVER
reviews.comment: Great land mark, good to send selfi photo to friends or family.Island area well kept and clean, nice job Wendover!

reviews.name: Greg S
reviews.title: He stands out in town.
reviews.comment:
Not too much to say about him. We saw him, stopped and took a photo.
He is certainly tall and you can not miss him.

reviews.name: simpleyme
reviews.title: Howdy !
reviews.comment: as you are driving you come across a big waving cowboy,how could you not like it? We took the obligatory picture and drove on .

reviews.name: elelvr
reviews.title: I know it's cheesy, but........
reviews.comment: Whenever we drive near Wendover we always take a drive by Will...I know it's cheesy but we like driving past the welcome (or goodbye) of Wendover Will, haha

reviews.name: mildtowild2009
reviews.title: Nice picture stop
reviews.comment: We stopped and took photos in front of Wendover Will. Good photo stop while sightseeing in the Wendover area. Also has historical markers nearby.

reviews.name: foto_monkey
reviews.title: Draws attention
reviews.comment: We stopped and were goofing around posing for pictures with "Wendover Will" which seemed to be drawing an audience. People were honking and waving as they drove by. This is a fun landmark in the west part of town.

reviews.name: Pete
reviews.title: just like Vic
reviews.comment: Just past the Casinos on the Wendover strips in the middle of highway 80 sits Wendover Will.He is a Carbon copy of Vegas Vic. There is a place to park and get out to see him and take pictures. We stopped in the day time and them came back at night when he is all lit up with Neon. When in Wendover you must see this.

reviews.name: Susan L
reviews.title: Informative welcome center
reviews.comment:
We stopped here last minute. We were impressed with the amount of photos, memorabilia, and history this building held. It also was the site of small trinkets to buy—-magnets, pins, tees, cards, etc.
After reading the displays we made our way over to the the Airfield museum.

reviews.name: John M
reviews.title: Mini museum and super friendly and helpful staff!
reviews.comment: Welcome centers vary greatly in quality, and this one is a mini museum with super friendly and helpful staff!

reviews.name: TheGuv-and-Bolli
reviews.title: So friendly and helpful
reviews.comment:
Not having had the best of welcomes in Utah, having travelled on from visiting the Bonneville Salt flats, we headed into West Wendover before starting our return journey to SLC.
There was no state sign we could find (it's only on the interstate we were told) so we got a photo at the Nevada Visitor Welcome sign.
The lady in the centre Friday 21 June could not have been more helpful, loads of information on Nevada and adjoining states including California which encourages tourist travel. She was generally interested in us and our Road Trip, and we wers asked to sign their guestbook.
Thanks Nevada I'm sure we will return to explore more of your state in the coming years.

reviews.name: Deborah K
reviews.title: interesting
reviews.comment:
lots to learn my dad is vet we learned much with him able to tell us of items had alot of interesting items and pictures
'

reviews.name: happy4travel
reviews.title: If you're a pilot you'll want to look around
reviews.comment: We love anything related to aviation. Whenever we spy an interesting aircraft we make a point to check it out. We didn't have much time but we really enjoyed a few folks on the ground. Very nice people,

reviews.name: RedHornet72653
reviews.title: Good little welcome center
reviews.comment: The staff was nice and reasonably knowledgeable. The Wendover and West Wendover communities need to figure out how to merge their efforts. The Bonneville Salt Flats and Wendover Air Field are all they have and they miss miserable in comparison to what the areas needs are.

reviews.name: Gerri F
reviews.title: Not much to offer
reviews.comment: I received a pamphlet on the salt flats after asking for it. The lady who was working did not go out of her way to be friendly.

reviews.name: gwavra
reviews.title: Nice visitor center
reviews.comment: The visitor center is adequate for the size of town. They might open the center during the weekend for a few hours in the afternoon as I noticed several vehicles stop by on Sunday.

reviews.name: Linda D
reviews.title: Thought they had a gift shop?
reviews.comment: Thought they had a gift shop, that was the only reason we stopped there. There are a few exhibits behind glass and the normal visitor pamphlets.

reviews.name: Linda K
reviews.title: A few days of relaxation
reviews.comment:
We walked to the Visitor Center from the Peppermill Casino, it’s just across the street. Hubby and I were surprised at all the information that was in there. Most of the displays were of the history of Wendovers important training role during the years of 1944-1945, Bonneville Flats and racing.
The woman that worked there was very knowledgeable about the history of Wendover and she was very friendly.
Hubby managed to find a silver medallion to buy and also another less expensive one. He collects medallions so he was excited to get these from Wendovers anniversary.
This free visit was worth our time and we would recommend you to go when you’re in Wendover.

reviews.name: Diana M
reviews.title: Montego Bay Resorts
reviews.comment: A very nice place to stay and has lots of games to play whether itn is slots or cards, i prefer cards and nhad a good time learning a new Buster Blackjack. nice game.

reviews.name: Ron H
reviews.title: Surprise Youself With A Stopover!
reviews.comment: You may be inclined to pass right through the Wendover area, but do yourself a favor and stop at this visitors center to enjoy a little history of the area. It goes back to the time of Wendover AFB, where training occurred for the ending of WWII. There are lots of great photos and interesting artifacts, giving you a real sense of the times. The folks are friendly, knowledgeable and willing to answer any questions. It's not your regular "travel through" resting place and you'll enjoy spending an hour to give yourself a stretch break. I give them an A+ and highly recommend it.

reviews.name: toad69
reviews.title: If not for Tripadvisor would not have stopped here
reviews.comment: Fantastic presentations inside with the history of the area we spent about 30 minutes browsing round while chatting with the helpful person running the centre

reviews.name: retired592017
reviews.title: air flight is great ( cash drawings & food vouchers ).
reviews.comment:
Flight is fun cash drawings and complimentary non alcoholic drinks . mixed drinks are available
time just flyes

reviews.name: cmrdan
reviews.title: Nice place with a very nice park
reviews.comment: Nice to have a good welcome center in a smaller casino town. Good information, and very nice adjacent park for walking our dog. Thanks.

reviews.name: josephj736
reviews.title: Great place for info on the West
reviews.comment: Perfect place to gather info while driving on I80. Knowledgeable staff on the history of the Wendover airfield and the Bonneville Salt Flats. Tons of free brochures on attractions in the Western United States.

reviews.name: Cheryl L
reviews.title: Visit! Visit! Visit!
reviews.comment: This is one of the best Highlights of our whole trip. Save a lot and very relaxing. Make sure you take your Friends there too. They will enjoy the Employees.They will tell you about all the History in the area!

reviews.name: Jaime Y
reviews.title: Need something to do? Start here.
reviews.comment: In the summer months when the weather is good Wendovver offers plenty of walking, running and hiking trails. The staff at the visitor center have personal experience and offer great guidence even for the beginners.

reviews.name: onetoonehundred
reviews.title: Helpful staff and Center has lots of imformation
reviews.comment: The staff are very friendly and eager to provide information. Also a good display of events from Wendover's history. Unfortunately there were no casino coupons available

reviews.name: clhinwi
reviews.title: Excellent Info Center
reviews.comment: Woman at the counter was a walking talking encyclopedia of information! Certainly stirred my interest in the Salt Flats as well as the War Museum.

reviews.name: BCRON
reviews.title: A must to get your discount coupon
reviews.comment: We stopped in here to get our discount tickets to the buffet at the peppermill. Has big parking lot and knowledgeable people that will tell you about the town and a little history.
